name: Limnopoula Camping
description:
Beautiful situated at lake.
24.82 Euro for 2 persons and campervan. The lake looks not very inviting to swim, but the camp is okay for one night.

name: Bushcamp Beach
description: Bushcamp on the beach near Naros. No facilities, but quiet and we saw many dolphins here.

name: The Pink Palace
description: Not just a place to stay but also a place to make friends that you will have for a lifetime. This hostel features budget accommodation, including breakfast and dinner. You can attend many activities like kayaking, quad rentals, hiking, toga parties etc. The beach which the Pink Palace is situated is one of the best in Corfu Island and many of the rooms offer an astonishing view.

name: Camping Bacchus
description: Nice campground under shaded trees with a nice pub. Friendly, helpfull staff. A short walk to the mediterrenean sea and about 10minutes to the harbour of Lavrio (GR--> IL).

name: Wild Camping @ Beach
description: Nearly in the middle of the little village Katafourko, at the opposite of a little restaurant, follow the sign to the beach. Down at the beach, pass the little bar/kiosk and have a look for a nice, quite place at the beach.

name: Mangana Beach
description: Nice beach area. When you reach the beach and carpark. You will be two beach bars right in front. Turn left and drive to the end of the carpark and you will see a sandy track. Along this there are multiple turn offs onto the beach. Good 4G Vodafone signal.

name: Meteora Monasterys
description:
Rough, stoney area on corner of road. Ok if you sleep in/on your vehicle. Good view of one of the cliff top Monasterys at dawn. Good 4G Vodafone coverage. Road is quiet at night. Not good for pitching tents.

Only for vehicles with high clearance.

name: Delphi Camping
description: Nice campsite with great views, nice pool and shop. Camping is on gravel areas, but its ok to pitch tents. Hot showers and clean facilities. 4km from Delphi ruins. Or 40min walk from campsite. Good 4g Vodafone coverage.

name: Menelaion Ruins
description:
Wild camp on hill top next to ruins overlooking Sparta. Sign posted concrete road/track from main road is ok for 2wd but is not suitable for big rigs because of low olive trees and two very sharp turns half way up. Good 4g Vodafone coverage. 
There is also a small Chapel here. So Sat night/Sun morning might not be a good time to camp.

name: River Wild Camp
description: Large flat grassy area next to river. For access tracks look at google sat images. Easy tent pitching. There is also a few trees for shade. Ok GSM/Edge Vodafone coverage.

name: Plagia Beach Camp
description: Private ground with a huge "for sale" sign on it. Short drive down a gravel road past some farmers. Flat lawn with nice ocean access. Visible from the bay/from boats. More private in the back. 4g signal.

name: Wildcamp Poseidon
description: Close to a small road with little traffic.  Not visible, quiet space. Even gravel/grass floor. There are beehives around, so expect a farmer every now and then. Empty beer cans indicate that this spot is sometimes used as a local hangout. You will be able to find other places in the area, as well. Good 4g coverage.

name: The Old Castle /city View
description: It's a street next to the old castle, you can park on the side of the street, there is mostly a free space! At night it can be loud, because there are bars! But if you want to go out in the city, this is the best place to stay! At sunset time you'll have the best view from the top of the stairs! In 5 minutes you are in the city centre!

name: El verano beach bar
description: El verano beach bar offers a free place for campers! Free wifi and showers are on the beach! Great place to stay!

name: Campsite Municipale
description: Ok camp on the beach and good to stay before or after Turkey.

name: Keramoti Camping
description: Well established campground. Paid 10 euros for a bike, small tent and one person. The beach is right next to campsite. It also would be possible to wild camp on the beach right next to the camp.

name: Santa Rosa
description: This is mainly small bungalows place but they have very nice area with grass where you can put up your tent. Beach is like 50m. There is also "municipal" campground down the road but this one looks much better and was 10euros for a bike, tent and one person. The other one was like 14euros. I think that you can also wild camp right next to it without any problems.

name: Road from Moschokarya to Stirfaka
description: Gravel patch in a bend of the road. Very little traffic on the road, especially at night. There is a little noise from the train that passes nearby a few times an hour but other than that it's a very quiet spot.

name: Beach Camp
description: Nearby campsite is used as a dumping grounds but this little beach is off the road, secluded, plenty of gravel for wet weather (no getting stuck in sand) and a little shrubbery for shade so a good overnighter if you like views & a sunset! No facilities

name: Hilltop Views & Camp
description: There's a gravel track that leads up a steep hill overlooking Kavala town. Couple of small flat areas to pull off. Road appears to be largely unused so we had a private, quiet night here with nobody coming by, incredible views, though a little windy at this height with few trees for coverage.

name: Nice Parking At The Beach
description: Perfect place to stay in Volos. There are a lot of parking spots in front of the city beach of Volos. At night quiet. With a bike within 10 minutes you can see the whole city. If you walk the way at the water is very beautiful.

name: Camping Athens
description: Textbook example of a city campingground. Expensive, noisy (right next to a very busy 4 lane road), small places. Toilets and showers are clean though, and the staff friendly. Since there is little or nothing else to be found in the vicinity of Pireaus  (for shipping your car to Africa ), this might be your best option.

name: Small Forest
description: Few parking spots to pull off in the forest just above the town - shade & picnic benches, a playground and walking tracks. Good for one night, quiet road at night, only 2 cars passed. No facilities other than bins

name: Trikeri Beach Parking
description: A small parking at the beach close to the small town of trikeri. Little restaurants are in town! The parking is very calm and nice to swim a bit! Don't try to drive in the city with a camper, very small streets! On the other site of town is an other small parking like this...

name: Papigo y Micro Papingo
description: Quiet, with good views and is ideal to visit the natural pools.

name: Eparchiaki Odos Asfaka
description: It doesn`t matter where you want ot spend the night at Pindus, any place here is more than good, you can be surronded by nature, have  a nice views or just park next to the road, nothing and nobody will bother you.

name: Apolloni, Grecia
description: Like many of the beaches of Lefkada, it is best to go very early in the morning or before sunset, to find a place to park, to enjoy  and be more tranquil.

name: Riza
description: Facing the sea, with showers and next to the road. Very well located to catch the ferry which crosses to Patras the next morning. Using the bridge to cross is faster than the ferry, but it is also more expensive.

name: Pilos
description: By the port you can also spend the night, both sites are quiet. Pilos is a beautiful village of Peloponese,  and a just few kilometers away from Voidokilia Beach, which is perfect to spend the day. Although when you enter the at beach with the van there is there is a sign that prohibits parking at night, if we have a tent,you can always park before such a signal, and find a hidden corner to set the tent.                                          The sweets in Pilos are delicious

name: Plaka
description: Parking at the end of the village. Nice place for a night or two. Small, but nice beach with the good view, trees and showers. No electricity, internet or toilet, but a few restaurants around. It can be crowded in the high season.

name: Koutsounari
description: Big camping in the olive trees, but very small sites. Direct access to the beach, Internet, electricity, toilets, washing machines, kitchen, etc. Camper - 16Euro without electricity, 20Euro with.

name: Pervolakia Gorge
description: Nice spot at the entry to the gorge. Drinking water you may find at the monastery 300m from this place. Limited room for the big cars due to the tamarisk trees

name: Oxia view point
description: A must see when you are around Vikos national park! From this point you can see how impressive the gorge really is!

name: Konitsa Stone Arch Bridge
description: Next to the main road there is a parking place. You could stay there or follow down the gravel road to this place right next to the bridge. Level.

name: Zazari Lake
description: A place next to a hut by the lake. A gravel track going around the lake is right beside, but almost no one came by. Easy access, almost level. Space for 2 or 3 cars.

name: Kap Xifaras
description: There are a few wonderful places to stop around here but as the road leading to it was too rough for our bus we decided to stop earlier. No problem for a small car with decent ground clearance.

name: Hidden Beach
description: The whole coastline is perfect for wild camping in off season, but at this little bay it seems like there is not really tourism happening in main season. So enjoy your private beach. Entry from the gravel road is a little steep. Place for a few cars.

name: Zampetas Caravan Camper Service
description:
The Zampetas brothers are very friendly and can help you with every problem. They have a big workshop and shop with even very special parts. They speak english and german. Highly recommended! 
Tel.: +3023920 71760
info@zampetas.gr

name: Zampetas Camper Stop
description: Zampetas offer on their ground next to the workshop and selling service also free camping spots. Toilet, cold shower, dumping stations, electricity, WiFi and washing machine (5 euro per washing). A little loud in the night but good to visit Thessaloniki and getting some special camper parts. Store closed on Sunday—you can stay but can’t drive in or out. Check Google Maps for store hours as the gates are locked at other times unless you make special arrangements.

name: Nature Night stop
description: A nice, grassy flat next to a dead end field road. River close, quiet in the night exept for some highway noise depending on wind direction. We stopped a little earlyer because it was already dark when we arrived. But now I see that here is the biggest, nicest place on the track.

name: Yliki Lake
description: You have to follow about 8km of gravel road to reach this place if you are coming from west. Plenty of space at the moment beacause the valley is dry. Expect a farmer from now and then. Besides that you are in the middle of nowhere. Nice place.

name: View to Saronida
description: Nice place next to the track that leads to the transmitter mast on the hill top. Almost not visible and surprisingly quiet.  A little messy.

name: Thermal Spring Sidirokastro
description:
Private bath rooms: Open from 9 am to 11 pm; Water 43 degrees; available, 13 € for 40 minutes

Hammam: open from 10 am to 2 am; Water 43 degrees; each our entrance changes for men and women, in the evening couples are allowed; 5€ 

Lot of possibilities to stay over night

name: Thyme Plateau
description: A nice level place at a hill top. Easy access. Good overview - you can even see Athens from here! Quiet and wild thyme growing all around.

name: Camping Diana in Olympia
description: Ok if you don't mind paying for a campsite.  We were only guests so ok for us.  Paid €16 (normal price €25 - 2 people plus car).  Wifi available outside reception area.  A little tatty but a good option if required.

name: Beach camp
description: Strip of narrow beach - can probably park anywhere.  Beautiful sunsets here and quiet at night.  Some litter unfortunately.

name: Potamos Beach
description: Mini Sahara by the cristal clear sea!Clothes optional.Park 10m from the sea and stay as long as u like.About 2km long sandy beach,10min to the opposite side of the small peninsula very,very nice place!

name: End Of Kasandra
description: Not sure if u can get there by camper but it is ok for any car.The beach is 150m wide,30% of the shore is sandy,the sea bottom has enough pockets with sand as well.We spent 5 beautifill days in 2016 Oct. Very romantic beach,specially sunsets are uncomparable.Have enough wather and food,nice company as well...everything else u will find there,alone in the wilderness

name: Tripotamos
description: Very nice and wide sandy beach next to the formal Tripotamos Beach.Have seen campers and several tents at night.Just by the main road,stop and see,there is carpark at the top of the beach and unpaved path straight to the sea.

name: Paralia Korinos
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: WARNING! Thefts and vandalism reported in this location. Please use caution.

Long unspoiled natural beach. There is a dirt track following the beach on the left of the parking, leading to smaller tracks leading to the beach. There is a 'no camping' sign so probably better off season.

name: Paralia Korinos
description: Sandy beach,more than 6km long! If u drive from this point to the north about 1km (unpaved but very good road) u will notice many paths toward the sea. In the neighborhood there is camping area with all facilities,bars...First class  beach but somehow abandoned for now.Have visited many times.Naturisam is highly tolerated (north part of the beach).

name: Toroni
description: Small sandy beach just by the main road,very frendly enviroment.Very wide space for all type of vehicles,small bar! One night spent in the little cave was rely very nice experience!-ha

name: 'Mecanico' Miguel
description:
we needed to get our carburador fixed. some other (& nice) guys from a repuestos shop sent us to this guy, who has some experience with car tuning but is not at all a mecanic.
finally we had our car in his workshop for about one week while awaiting some parts. he was then unable to fix it, so we went somewhere else...and everything fine!

after we had left and were way too far away to come back we realized that the 'mecanico' Miguel had stolen some more or less worthful stuff we had forgotten in the car during our week of waiting. the workshop was locked by him, so it must have been him.

don't go there or punch your fist at him in our name!

name: Tartaruga Camping
description: Best Camping ground I ever been. Beautiful view over the sea at the turtle island with shady places under the olive trees and palms. Direkt entrance to the sea. Rock beach with clear turquise water. Clean bathrooms with hot water. The campingsite is build tarreced. Good restaurant with daily chancing menus. Very friendly owners. One in all simply great.

name: vrondou mountains
description: lots of sandy roads here where you can find spots for wild camp. No people here.  trees and grassy/sand ground.

name: long Beach wild camp
description: camp on the beach next to a little fisherman place. friendly people and there was not a sign that you couldn't  camp.....

name: Stratoni beach
description: Right on the beach camped here for one night beautiful sunrise. Only access with 4x4. View on peak atos oros 2033m.

name: wild camp in forest near Nikiti.
description: In the mountains with a beautiful view over Nikiti and the olive trees. We went up through the old town of Nikiti on our way to an old small church.  you need 4x4 car because of some steep gravel roads. you will be on top of the mountain with a wonderfull view of the coast line. total privacy.

name: pelikanen and bridge view next to lake
description: grassy field next to the lake with beautiful landscape. lots of birds to watch. houses are a 100 metres away. Full signal with Cosmote 3G.

name: Volos view
description: Camped with our cruiser on top of a hill. 4x4 preferable. We took the road volos go Zagora and  just before the top were you can see all the antennas we took the gravel on the gravel.road twice to the right just a bit further as the small forrest

name: left behind beach
description: beach with an taverna and little house and caves but left behind. small bay. concrete ground where you can stand on. at the beach on the left go over the rocks and you will find another tiny beach. just like paradise😊. you need a 4x4.

name: wild camp beach
description: Old  olive trees and beach. you can stand in between the olive trees and nobody will see you except a fisherman on his boat. 4x4 is needed to go up and down the steep path

name: Near Volos
description: just 1 km drive left of the tar road to the sea. A newly but not finished built factory. there are two gravel roads downhill. take the right one down to the sea. there is a spot with nice view over the sea and quit. you can see the ferry going from Volos to Skiatos.

name: Lemon pie bushcamp
description: Just 200 m from tar road. Shady in the afternoon. Sunny in the morning.

name: Damos Beach
description: This stunning place is only accessible with small 4x4 like Landcruiser or Landrover. There are two beaches. You take the road in the village Richea at the end on the T junction. The left road goes to a beach where you can camp on the beach  ( which is accessible for all small cars)The right goes to a narrow gravel road and you camp at the end. There is just enough space to turn your car. On the gravel road  75 m before the end there's a sign that goes to a cave. If you follow this rocky path you end on the beach. The road in Richea is also very narrow. Niejotravels.com was here.

name: Kochylas Beach
description: Tar road to the end you can camp at several spots. Stone beach but easy to swim. great view.

name: Ferry view beach camp
description: From the village Killin you can enter this small beach there are a view roadsigns to the beach but at the end they stop you follow the gravel road trough the olive trees to the end. Although there were some local swimming and let their dogs swim the place is nice. And a sandy beach.

name: wild camp near Astakos
description: 2.5 km from Astakos a big gravel parking space totally empty (beginning of may). great view over the bay and beaches. there is a stairway to the beach (beach is stones) lovely swim almost no waves and clear water.

name: Santa marva
description:
Nice campsite with good facilities.
View over sea and nice owners.

name: Sandy beach with facilities
description: This deserted beach probably was something someday, but not anymore. They've left the toilets (with running water) and changing cabins though. The only downside was that between the sandy beach and the toilets, there lay a kind of plant that hurts to walk on with your bare feet.

name: Alexandros Camping
description:
Arrived late afternoon.
Only visitors but warned there is a wedding next night.
Bathrooms clean and tidy.
Site generally clean and tidy
€4.50 per person
€5.00per tent
€6.00 for electric
Wifi available in the restaurant.
Beachside camp handy if just crossed from Turkey as we had.

name: Aigeas Camp
description:
Beachside camping.
Also with a pool. 
Small shaded pitches might struggle to fit a bigger camper van (not all spots). 
Clean toilets and showers. 
Wifi available 
€17 per night 2 adults tent and car.
Electricity is extra.
Approx an hour to Thessaloniki.

name: Makris Service
description:
5 star servicing.
We had coolant leak on our Defender.
The guys pulled out all the stops and had the head gasket replaced, the head tested and everything back together in less than 48 hours.
After collection everything was great until hit the motorway and heard a whistling whining noise.
Kostas jumped in his car and came 40km to check it. Found the exhaust manifold had blown.
They got a new gasket and it was replaced under warranty.
These guys quote a price and stick to it or in my case it was actually less than quoted.
Both Kostas and Tolis are a great team and nothing is too much trouble.
You pay nothing until the job is complete and as in my case the additional work to remove the AC compressor etc and remove the exhaust manifold was free of charge as was the 80km round trip to diagnose the blown gasket.

Makris Service

Mobile phone:+306947810301
Workshop phone:+302310661801
Address :Karaoli Dimitriou 171 
                Thessaloniki Evosmos
                 P. O. Box 56224

name: Samikas
description: Local car repair shop, close to hardware & parts shop about 100m before on the same street. I bought new brake pads at the shop and they charged a very small fee for fitting.

name: Castle Camping
description:
Reasonable site but lot of permanent caravans.
By the beach with bar and ratuarant but the restaurant wasn't open for our visit.
Got very busy and noisy at the weekend.
Warm water seems to be only when busy.
Wifi is very slow,
Electric at the pitches. Pitches offered are different sizes but even the large ones are small and would be difficult to maneuver  a bigger van into.
Cleaned daily.
Has a laundry and washing machine.

name: Venezuela Camping
description:
Lovely site by the water run by a lovely older couple who take pride in their site and offer you a great welcome.
Off season when we were here but all toilets showers etc in operation and clean.
Everyday is a cheery hello and one day was free fresh bread, next day was free half litre of local wine.
We paid 18 Euros a night for Land Rover and Trailer tent plus 2 adults and electricity.
Also the wifi was good and we got a chance to upload photos to our website.
Plenty Campervans in and out daily and only a small percentage of permanent caravans.
Best we have seen in over 2 weeks in Greece.
Hot showers, kitchen and laundry facilities but no washing machine.
Big rigs can fit but limited places mainly due to trees etc causing height issues.

name: Abandoned Road
description: Great place to sleep for 1 night on the road to or from Lamia! First part is small steep hill (maybe for 20m) but after that it gets level and there is even a tarmac road. If you follow the tarmac you will find the end of the road pretty soon. Pick your place, you can pitch your tent in the grass or your 4x4 with rooftop tent on the tarmac. There is plenty of space for lots of cars. Can be reached with car and bike if you can take the first hill! (Not a challenge but just so you know)

name: Ramnous Camping
description:
Beach campsite with nice friendly bar and restaurant.
Busy at weekends.
Well maintained
Hot showers all day.
Wifi in restaurant area only.
Toilets showers require key access to stop beach only visitors making a mess .
Initially asked for €25 per night but we got discount to €20 per night.
Nice spot to explore the rest of the Athens peninsular.

name: Monolithi Beach
description: Shadowed place almost on the beach. There is a small restaurant with WC and public beach showers in the walking distance. Place for 2-3 campers ( can be a problem with room during high season and weekend as locals park here )

name: Zaritsi Camping
description:
Nice campsite by the beach.
Very friendly staff.
Clean and tidy.
Hot water all day.
Wifi at restaurant / mini market.

name: Mani Beach
description:
Beach side camping.
Clean tidy and friendly staff.
Wifi at mini market and bar only
Electric at or close to pitches.
We paid €20 for 2 adults s trailer tent and Land Rover
Free sun beds and umbrellas at beach

name: Aphios Camping
description:
Nice site, room for big rigs but not a large site.
Swimming pool 
Wifi at all pitches
Washing machine 
We paid €18.50 without electricity for 2 people to camping trailer and Land Rover.
Very handy for visiting Ancient Olympia

name: Enjoy Lichnos Camping
description:
Terraced pitches leading down to beautiful bay with bar and restaurant.
Mini market that is expensive so head 2km into town to Carrefour for supplies.
Clean facilities with bathrooms etc on each terrace.
Washing machine €7 per wash which again is expensive.
Very busy with campers and beach goers at the weekend. 
If you come in a bigger camper or with trailer park at first pitches and walk down as space to turn is very limited.
There is wifi throughout the camp but the speed varies considerably often dropping.
3G coverage but again intermittent.
We paid €22.50 per night with electricity for 2 people plus camping trailer and Land Rover.
It is a nice site for a couple days to relax

name: Camping Vrachos Kastraki
description: Near the Meteora Rocks. This place has been around for 50 years. Has a mini-shop, restaurant and swimming pool. Toilets and bathrooms are well-maintained. There are places for BBQ, stove for cooking and refrigerator to store food, free for use. For tents and motorcycle, €9 per person per night. Postcards are free to take.

name: Agia Ierousalem beach camp
description:
We wild camped at the second of the two nice little pebbled beaches. The first beach has a small, but good taverna (with some established camp possibilities if you prefer, price we don't know). The beach were we camped is out of sight from the taverna and most probably you will be the only campers here. :) 

Keep in mind, there's poor cell coverage here!

name: Agio Kiriakis Beach camp
description:
We camped on a piece of grassy land (what was ment as a parking space we found out later) just in front of the very nice beach. At the end of the dirt road there's a taverna with a cold shower and toilets. Please ask the taverna if you may camp - when you're planning to stay here in high season. The taverna provides wifi.

Overall, a very nice spot which will force you to stay for several nights. :)

name: Secret beach campspot
description:
Stunning little pebbled beach, completely isolated. Only possible for tent camping! You'll have this little beach for yourself for shure. 

How to reach: use google maps and type "Lazarou beach". Follow instructions from the town Poros and drive your car (high clearance or 4WD highly recommended) or walk (will take some time) as far as you can get - most probably a fence block. Park there and continue by foot on this road for about 10 mins. Ignore the first beautiful beach, this one is not reachable by foot. The next beach you see is the ONE and is even more stunning. You can find your way down using the terrace like terrain. There's no path, you need to find your own. Try to reach the beach at the north side. Last part to the beach can be tricky, but is absolutely doable. Enjoy, mind the environment and be safe!

name: Picnic pavillion near look-out
description: Nice and quiet flat ground next to a picnic pavillion. Even a little wifi from the nearby guesthouse!! only possible annoyance is the street light, if you don't have good curtains. there is a water tap by the pavillion. not sure if drinking quality. But we used it for washing hands and washing dishes. It's a dead end and not a single other car came up there this night.

name: hotel PERGAMOS
description: a two star hotel 0.8kms from center city Athens. we stayed for 25 Euros including Breakfast and Free Parking. the Parking was 5 star but not the accommodation. This is Great for the safety of the car when everything else is way more expensive in the area.

name: Forest Field
description: We turned off the main highway onto a narrow road and then found this track leading next to the forest.  About 800m along there is an unused field where we camped.  Quiet.  No facilities. Free.

name: Camper parking on the lake
description:
Official camper parking on the lake. There's a little shelter to sit. Quite open without trees here, but great view of the lake. Further along the road there are some small grassy spots to wildcamp right by the side of the road that are more in the forest. Barely any traffic on this road. 
The locals say: beware of bears.

name: Ammoudia beach
description:
nice place near the sea - wild camper spot - although surrounded by others - in spring 2017 police fined €300 to all wild campers
shower at the beach - very nice place to swim

name: Quiet beach camp
description:
Beautiful beach camp, off the road, right on the beach. Follow the dirt track off the main road along the beach. We parked here, next to a friendly goat shepard's place, but there are more of places to park, especially if you follow the dirt road east towards the concrete slabs. 4x4 recommended. Our place had a bunch of friendly shepard dogs guarding us during the night. 
Big rigs fit the site, but not sure about the track.

name: Lingos Hotel
description: established hotel, very nice rooms and rooftop Overviewing the city. bike parking directly in front. highly recommended! more@ www.RTWbyBIKE.com

name: Nea Kessani lakeside
description: At the end of the gravel road you find   a nice spot to park directly at the shore of Lake Vistonida. Some trees offer a little shade. Very quiet. Good spot for birdwatching. Pitching a tent on the sandy ground should be possible.

name: Vatsa Beach
description: A wonderful tavern right on the sandy beach (red sand like the more famous Xi beach) with great food. We asked if it was possible to park the van in the back, no problem at all like in all Greece. But - there is only space for 1 or max 2 vans. Still, worth to come and see!

name: Camping Asprovalta
description: Only open from the 1 June. Grass in driveway is over grown and nobody staying there.

name: Agios Achillios Island
description: Large grass field 100 m before the parking and bridge to the island. in mid october I was alone. Possibly this place can be used as a parking place in high season. At night it is totally quiet.

name: Acropolis Hotel
description: Small Hotel, more like a Homestay. Use of kitchen and facilities. Very centrally located. One of only a few open in the off season at an affordable/reasonable price. The owner Maria was very helpful - made phone calls on our behalf and offered assistance. Wifi, TV. Parking is on street -but we were able to get our motorbike in the front yard

name: Vergina archeological site car and coach park
description: Large car park. Away from habitation apart from a restaurant at one side near entrance to archeology site. Probably much busier in summer but end of October we've got the place to ourselves overnight.

name: Kastro
description: Small parking lot adjacent to beach and  small harbour. Also possible on the other side of the harbour, next to the Kastro. Near lighthouse. Cristal clear swimming water. I was here in november. Possibly crowded in summetime. Distance to town 20 minutes walking

name: Karathonia Beach
description: Nice sized beach, quite at night. Seems to be a popular camping ground, at least several other campers along the beach. Very beautiful sunrise.

name: Pittas tire shop
description: Good tire shop in Athens. Recomended work, good quality

name: Tower view
description: From the Main Street leads a short, but small but rough gravel road to this place. We managed the road with a VW T5 (on a rainy day) but bigger rigs will probably have problems. The place itself is not very flat but with some stones you can adjust. The view up to the mountains and especially to the so called "towers" is great. You can not be seen from the main road, but you can hear the cars, there is no traffic at night.

name: Cove Paradiso
description:
Follow the signs to Cove Paradiso.
This is unfortunately just a good place for low season (we went here mid November). I think there is usually a beach bar.
You have an access to a small beach, a really nice view and even showers.

name: Propan Refill
description: There is a Gas station where you can refill your bottle. I think they have adapters for every kind of bottle.

name: Water in Chortata
description: You will find a water tap in a small stone building at the left side of the street, when you're heading south.

name: Lonesome Mountain
description:
Peaceful, quiet and lonesome wild camp with mountain view.
You have to pass a 2,5 km long, absolutely okay gravel road to this place. You will arrive at a grassy field with a small monument (picture). The place is not completely flat. 
If you have 4x4 you could probably drive further, there are some more really nice places by the road and at the end a beautiful clearing (excellent to pitch a tent) If not, you could hike that road and enjoy the great view.
 Comment: Beware! This place seems to be a hunting area at weekends. There were some hunters in the early morning, they didn't say anything but we didn't feel good about their presence

name: Lefkada marina
description: Gravel truck park in front of the marina entrance. Near restaurant and shops; free.

name: Marina Lefkas laundry toilett
description: Very expensive laundry (15 € washing and drying), but you have no other choice when it rains. WC.

name: Lefkada
description: Shop to buy a water pump. The boss lends the material to do the installation.

name: Draghano
description: Local bar restaurant at crossroads.1.50 € for coffee. Nice house. We parked on the side.

name: Astakos
description: On the sidewalk facing the tennis field. Next to a lawn that is muddy today. rain. WC at fuel station EKO.

name: Patras Hotel Delfini
description: Along the sea at 1500 m from the center on a large parking.

name: Krathio parking
description:
un parking dans le centre du village
au bord de mer , 2 autres sur la même rue plus à l'ouest
à car Park down town on sera side two others on same street at west

name: Canal de Corynthe
description:
le long du canal un chemin carrossable pour tout véhicule de nombreux autres stationnement pour passer la nuit
along the canal à path fore all  véhicule Manu others place for stay on night

name: Isthmia Fishing Port
description: Too much wind on the canal next to the small fishing port by the sea

name: Ancient Corinth
description: Car park downtown, near ruins entrance ( closed on Monday); restaurants, shops, restrooms.

name: Nauplie port
description:
immense parking avec les camions aucun service
Big car Park with truck no service

name: Palea Epidhavros Est
description: Old Epidaurus at the end of the road after the sports field is a small parking. Prohibited in high season.

name: Laconia Hilltop
description: There is a gravel road leading to this place, doable for vans but not for bigger rigs. There is a small chapel up the hill - seems abandoned or pending renovation. Very silent, very nice views and the possibility for hiking. The site is not really flat, but you will find a place. It may be quite windy and the temperature is quite cooler than down by the sea. There are also bee houses around whom owner may come to check out from time to time.

name: ,Avisi lac Padermo
description: Along a very small road at the entrance of the village at the lake lake border. No Internet in the village.

name: Agrolid strand camping
description: Campsite by the sea. 17 € for 2 + + truck and electricity. Internet bad, just to read the mails. Washing machine 5 € two hours.

name: CampingGaz outlet
description: Tank CAMPING GAZ 3 TIMES cheaper than in France

name: Kosmas
description:
sur la place du village en bas de l'église  aucun service
on the main place of village behind church no service but Internet

name: Kalamata tennis
description:
au bord de la mer à côté des tennis pas de service
sera side just near tennis court no service

name: Fossil Forest
description:
Small place at the end of a rough gravel road (ok for vans). Definitely a place for more than one night. There is an easy hiking trail along the coast. You could also find swimming opportunities, if you like rock climbing. There are good places to pitch a tent, flat meadows (picture) just a few meters from where you park the car.
Great weather in December, but kind of windy. Very lonesome, no houses in visual range.

name: Filiatra stadium
description:
devant le terrain de sport de Filiatra une aire en gravier sans service
stadium Filiatra à gravel area no service

name: Behind small parking along the road
description: Take the small dirtroad at the end of the parking place. 4 km from Delphi. Quiet during the night. Out of sight. Almost no traffic. Beautiful view over the valley on one side  and steep rocks on the order side.

name: Lailias Mountain Lodge
description: A mountain lodge located in a beautiful forest. There is a cafe/restaurant as well. Call ‭+30 2321 062400 or +30 6936 636 382‬ for reservations.

name: Minoan Grimaldi
description:
This is where you go first to get your car in Piraeus. You will have to pay Grimaldi for a fee (driving the car out of the ship....)
Around 120euros.
With those documents, you can go to port.

name: Port Authority
description: Second step, come here with your papers, on 1st floor, roro handling, someone will process your papers. You then have to pay for parking on port (about 8 euros per day). Then get more papers and stamps, and go to customs.

name: Piraeus customs
description: 3rd and final step, get here for customs, give your documents, takes some time, and then you get a final document. With this you can get back to port, next to the port authority, and pass the gate to your terminal. Should be G2 ? Some documents to do here, then you can collect your car and drive out.

name: Parking in the beach
description: free parking on the beach. very quiet. It has a very good shower on the beach. There is a small bar on the sand.

name: Chapel at hill top
description:
Very quiet and gorgeous-view place. Provide outdoor tables and chairs, BBQ oven,  and even a basketball playground! 

No electricity nor water. However there is a water pipe which is not functioned. 

Very good mobile signal. 
FREE!

The entrance from the road is narrow. About 2.2-2.4 meters wide.

name: Orange Beach
description: Nice beach with sand and rocks. Access is a bit rough. Some food trucks around, but they were closed when we were there.

name: Selino lake side
description:
Small picnic area near the lake. 
Less rubbish than the other spot at this lake. Spring available but probably not good for drinking. But should be ok for a shower.

name: Beach camp
description:
Several places to park along the beach. 4x4 could help. But the places near the road can also be reached without 4x4. 
No trees!

name: Wild Beach
description: Above beautiful, quiet bay. Flat solid ground near the coaststreet. Nearly no traffic on this street. The very small Taverne was closed.

name: Nies beach
description: Off the main roads, very quiet bay. In the village Nies (very narrow streets) no amenities. Turn right before the entrance to the bay. In 04.2018 tavern in the bay is not in operation. Showers on the narrow beach in operation. Flat, stable ground.

name: Beach
description: Gravel ground site next to the beach club and the coastal road.  You may not be alone here as both Greeks and campers know of these places. Many more of such sites along this coast. Wonderful sunset.

name: Taverne Bekatsas
description:
Gastfreundlicher Ort, seriöse, nette Besitzer.
Besuch im April 2018. Da außerhalb der Saison war die urige Taverne nur tagsüber geöffnet. Man isst quasi direkt am Strand. Das Essen war sehr gut. Den Fisch konnte ich noch vor der Zubereitung selber in der Küche begutachten. 
Zur unserer Überraschung gab es gratis noch ein  Dessert - hausgemachter halbgefrorener Schokoladenkuchen. Lecker!
Der Besitzer u. der Sohn sprechen englisch. 
Der Rasenparkplatz vor der Taverne kann nach Auskunft des Besitzers gerne als Übernachtungsplatz für Wohnmobile genutzt werden. 
Es gibt sogar ein ganze passables kleines separates Toiletten-Gebäude.
Der Besuch der Taverne wird dabei wohl gerne gesehen. ( Kann man aber auch empfehlen)

A quiet agreable point to stay for a night or even longer and enjoy excellent meals in the Taverne and the hospitality of the owner. The food was really good and inexpansiv. 
The place is easy to access and the distance from the parking spot to sand and stony beach is about 50 meter.  The off-season the Taverne is open only during the day. 
You are invited to stay on the large privat ground and to be a guest to the Taverne.

name: Peristeras motorcycle tires
description:
Motorcycle tire shop and repairs. Michelin, Pirelli, Metzeler, Bridgestone, ... 
They stock tubes also.

name: Camping Milos
description:
A camping with a lot of longtime camper and a small stony beach. With ACSI membership-card we paid 17,20€ for 2 person + campingcar + electricity  in 4-2018. Noise from the mainstreet nearby.
Free Wifi.

name: Isthmia Camping
description:
A sympatic campground. Most of the pitch are quite narrow and only useful for vans, but have shadow by trees. Some bigger pitch excist also. Wifi is free at the entrance. Minimarktet was open at 1.mai 2018. Discount with ACSI - card = 19 €.
There is a fence with an electric gate to the beach. The beach is stoney with some trees for shadow.

name: Water tap at gas station
description:
Easily accessible drinking water tap at gas station. Gardena tube connector. 
They also have free Wifi at the gas station.

name: Nireus Hotel
description: Decent cheap-ish hotel on the seafront of Nea Makri, good sea views €50 for a triple bedroom with breakfast

name: Camping Bekas Beach
description:
Sympatic Campground with a small stony beach.
There are several campgrounds nearby.

name: Camping Elena
description:
Nice campground, very well maintained. Some pitches directly on the waterfront. Taverna and nicely arranged sitting areas. Friendly owner (George) - used to be a motorbike traveller himself.
Price for 1 person + motorbike + tent should be around 10 euro (prices on their website  http://www.campingelena.gr)

name: Voutsaras
description:
Roadside restaurant, run by a German lady who moved to Greece and now continues their dream after her husband died. Signposted 'snack bar and coffee'. Good food, nice chatty lady. 
She offers overnight place for camper vans or tents (free of charge). Electricity water and toilets available (shower possibly in future). 
For the German travelers being homesick: she had Bratwurst on offer (didn't try it).

name: Voutsaras
description:
Overnight place for camper vans or tents (free of charge) in front of restaurant. Electricity water and toilets available (shower possibly in future). Directly next to the road but probably little traffic at night. Nice area for hiking. 
The restaurant is run by a German lady who moved to Greece and now continues their dream after her husband died. Signposted 'snack bar and coffee'. Good food, nice chatty lady.
For the German travelers being homesick: she had Bratwurst on offer (didn't try it).

name: eparchiaki odos astrous leonidiou
description: small range stone and sand, near a plantation olive. not Super easy access, 4x4 or motorcycle strongly advised.

name: Polemarcha Beach
description: Beautiful Spots next to the beach mostly under trees. Heavenly!

name: camp near neokaisareia
description: possibility of camping in a plantation. easy access, 1 min of dirt road.  light water pump nois for watering the plantation. 1 min of de river

name: Neptune Lines / Nikos Liakris
description:
Shipped to Piraeus from Alexandria, Egypt. 
Went here to pay €106 in fees to Neptune Lines and get our delivery order. 
Nikos Liakris, customs broker, picked us up here. Nikos only works with Neptune Lines. Paid him €100. Took 4 hours to complete paperwork and clear truck. Nikos is nice, experienced, professional and efficient. About 60 years old. Customs trusts him enough to allow Nikos to inspect the vehicle instead of a customs agent. We felt he was worth the money. Probably would spend €30 - €40 in taxis to do this ourselves. Only additional cost was €12 in port charges for storage. 
Total paid in Piraeus: €218
nikos-liakris@hotmail.com
+306936693078 (use a VPN to call from Egypt)

name: Cocoon city hostel
description: Hostel in downtown chania, crete. Clean and close to bars and restaurants! Highly recommend!

name: UnderTheTree
description: Nice (big) Place, many trees, next to beach, free, nothing else. But keep an eye on your things!

name: Camping Karavomilos
description: Very large campground with shade trees, bushes and flowers separating each site. Plenty of space to spread out when we were here in June. Modern and clean bathrooms. Many amenities: WiFi, washing machines, mini market, restaurant.

name: Kryoneri camping
description:
Small camping area with very cozy with spots for tents with shade and campers. Kitchen, bathrooms and laundry area ... all in good condition and very clean.
Close to the sea, in season has a bar.
1 motorbike 1 person 1 total carp 08.50 € / day
---
pequeño camping muy acogedor con plazas para carpas con sombra y campers. Baños cocinas y zona de lavadoras...todo en buen estado y muy limpio.
Cerca del mar en temporada tiene un bar.
1 moto 1 persona 1 carpa total 08.50 €/dia.
---
Open May 1 to Sep 30.

name: Corycian Cave Wildcamp
description: Camping at the end of the gravel road to the Corycian Cave on Mt Parnassos. This cave is awesome. It has been a sacred site for millennia. (Read about it online). Beautiful view. Very peaceful. It’s best to have 4WD.  Very large or tall trucks will hit the tree branches. Easy to turn around at top and to level with some rocks. If you are traveling with pets, be aware that a herder may pass through with goats and dogs.

name: Barlos 4x4
description: 4wd specialist mechanic. They took us right away, sourced the parts needed and fix the problem quickly. Not really good English, but we managed to understand each other.

name: Camping Stolos
description: Convenient location for reaching Mt. Olympus. There are many campgrounds in this area which are full of long term caravans. This one seems to be one of the better ones. Clean, modern bathrooms with hot showers. WiFi is fast - but only works some of the time. Laundry is €5 per load with your own soap. Restaurant. They only have only 6 spots for daily campers, but these have grass and shade. Quiet location near the beach. Very nice owners. Paid €20 for two people and a truck with rooftop tent.

name: HolyHill
description: Behind the church. Place only for one or two little Campers. Nothing else.

name: Border Greece to Bulgaria
description:
US citizens entering Bulgaria from Greece
Border with many EU cars passing through quickly. We were asked to park to the side and we waited just 15 minutes while our passports were stamped out of Greece & into Bulgaria and car document reviewed. A Bulgarian customs official asked to see our Green Card insurance. Then we could go. He said we could stay 3 months in Bulgaria. 
**Important: you must turn on headlights and you must buy a “vignette”  sticker at a petrol station for driving on Bulgarian roads. There are no road tolls in the country so this is the road tax. Cost is 15 leva for one week for a car or truck in K3 class - up to 8 seats and weighing under 3.5 tons. Fine of 300 leva if you don’t have a vignette

name: Long quiet beach with a couple of trees
description:
Seems to be a popular place for camper vans. There were 4 or 5 on the same night as us. We were the only ones with a tent. Few friendly dogs and bins around. 
It's maybe the only relatively clean beach in the area. Please help to keep it clean if you camp there to show that campers don't make the place dirty! If you go to neighbouring beaches you'll be horrified by the trash (maybe you'll find a good challenge in cleaning them up)! :-D

name: Παραλία Κάτω Φανά (Kato Fana Beach)
description:
Very nice beach with some trees, accessible through a dust road. No need for a 4WD (unless you want to go to the far end of the beach). I don't remember if the road is big enough for rigs, but the road is quite big and accessible for a dirt road.
Beach goers and fishermen seem to leave before sunset. Many mosquitos and horseflies however...

name: Hillside with view on Anavatos
description: A good flat quiet space with a great view on Anavatos. The dust road going up there (or down if you come from the north) is quite rough and rocky - a 4WD is maybe not needed but certainly preferable, as well as enough ground clearance.

name: Elinta beach
description:
Quiet stone beach, with softer flat areas between the trees. Accessible with 2WD, but a small 4WD and enough ground clearance is preferable to find yourself the best spot. Not sure if big rigs can get there; I remember a sharp turn and in our Suzuki Vitara we were hitting many soft branches falling on the road from the sides (seemed like bamboos).
Very quiet place, some people come by during the day. The little church and the nearby "properties" seemed abandoned. There are horseflies and mosquitos around that can be annoying.

name: Agio Gala riverside
description:
There is an outdoor little restaurant near the river / stream down the hill and village or Agio Gala. The manager Anastasia (who also manages the nearby cave, church and museum) lets people camp around if you spend a reasonable amount at her restaurant (e.g. one or two meals a day, or drinks). 
It's a very nice environment, children-friendly, full of trees, with separate spots for tents and campers. There is water and toilets.
From the main road, the little path / ramp down the parking place is a bit steep and more easily accessible from the south (very sharp turn if you arrive from the north - you may need to maneuver or turn around further where space allows).

Contact: Anastasia Galatoula
Tel: +30 22740 22004
Mob: +30 6945 331354
E-mail: polyxwros.agiogalas@gmail.com
Fb: Facebook.com/polyxorosagiogalas

name: Poseidon Hotel
description: Nice, relatively cheap hotel. The receptionist is fluent in English and the rooms are clean and have AC! It's located in a quiet area. The bathrooms are very small, you can't even open te door entirely. But other then that I would defenitely recommend it.

name: Yefsis Traditional Souvlaki House
description: Cheap restaurant with delicious greek food. You can have a whole meal with a drink for only 9 euro. The owners are very friendly.

name: Kalamitsi Beach / Παραλια Καλαμίτσι
description:
Very nice and fairly quiet stone beach. Popular enough, people come and go from 8am to 9pm. There are some properties around; it seems one of them is inhabited, and the other one in construction or renovation. We haven't been bothered on the one night we stayed there. We put our tent after sunset. Very peaceful. Not 100% flat space directly on the beach however (unless you want to work a bit the ground), but it was comfortable enough.
Any vehicle could get there although a 4WD would help to be right on the beach. It's wild camping so there's no fee, but I'm not sure it's authorised.

name: West Velikas beach
description: Large sandy area on the beach where we put our tent. There's a parking space but best is to have a 4WD to find somewhere quieter and more hidden. Almost no shade though...

name: Olive terasses
description:
camp with a beautiful view. lost of trees for shade. 
road unpaved, may be difficult with rain.
just 4W.

name: Beach / Grass campsite
description:
Large  flat grassy and sandy area right at the beach. Pretty quiet in the offseason and easily reachable by bike, car or camper. 

There is water on top of the little hill at the chapel.

name: Mosquito Beach :-)
description: Beautiful beach with unfortunately many mosquitoes when it gets dark. But definitely worth it!

name: Agios Giannakis beach
description: Parking area located at small beach. Beautiful place and quiet at night. There's a small cafe at the beach which is closed at night. Shower available on the beach and a toilet cabin which is closed at night.

name: Kleidonia bridge
description: Lots of level places to park or put up a tent right next to a beautiful but very cold river. Amazing place and start of a hike along the river. Picknick benches around. Rafts come down here.

name: Taverna in Sarakina + Camping
description:
Meteora is one of the places to see … but a nightmare for campers. The few campsites are small, expensive and not very inviting and wild camping is not allowed. 
We do not mean to advertise commercial places, but this is an exception: Consider staying a few Km outside at this truly great place: nice small, quiet, cosy and friendly taverna. One can stay for free on the green and flat parking and have dinner in the peaceful garden (at very reasonable prices). Definitely much better than the place up the road towards the monasteries. Water is available from the nearby water tower/tap

name: Beach at Agiokampos
description: A quite nice long stretch of beach with some restaurants, bars and shops nearby … i.e. it might well be busy and possibly noisy during the high season. The spot is somewhat exposed as everybody can see you, but nobody cared about us … save for a single person who was sneaking around our camper at night and seemingly tried to climb up … but ran away quickly as we opened the window and screamed at him. An incident that might happen everywhere

name: Parking at Spa Pond
description: A wonderful, shallow warm water pond with a relatively small parking area. The pond is quite well frequented by locals, coming and going from early in the morning until late at night … but nobody seems to care about a camper and we had a quiet night. The hot springs a few km to the east may also be an option … but the neighbourhood is not necessarily very welcoming.

name: Kastrosykia Beach
description: A flat area between a couple of tavernas, of which one also offers some sort of a camping area (incl. water) … provided one has dinner there … which was perfectly ok. Quiet at night. Probably impossible to stay during the high season.

name: off the coastal road
description: This road is beautiful to drive, not much traffic and hardly any houses. So one can perfectly well stay on one off the bays just off the road. This one is quite flat, offers a beautiful view across the sea and the setting sun. Moreover, one just has a few steps down towards a small, beautiful beach!

name: in the woods
description: Crossing the mountains does not offer many opportunities for wild camping. There are some nice spots along the road #74 between Panas and Vytina. The one mentioned here is on the narrow but beautiful #1202 leading south towards Tripoli, a bit off the road, which is dead a night.

name: Varkiza Beach
description: Ample space to park as this beach is frequented by the locals. Great to spend here the day and to stay one night. Although the road is some way behind, there might be some noise also during the night.

name: Thessaloniki near Marina
description: Not an overly romantic place to stay, but quite quiet and within easy cycling or even walking distance along the promenade into the center

name: Beach near Nea Iraklaia
description: A long stretch of beach with some beach bars, which presumably can get noisy. However, at the north end it was quite quiet, plenty of space and even a good spot to go for a swim in the sea.

name: Olymbiada
description:
Looks like a semi-official informal campsite … at least tolerated to stay. Just off the quite nice beach and near the restaurants along the promenade
quiet … except for the dogs
Beach shower with water tap

name: Beach camping
description: Just off the road is a small path down to the beach. A bit further is also a place where a few other campers and vans were camping so we felt safe but also a lot of privacy at the same time. Also shower on the beach is available a few minutes away! Two minutes away by car is also bakery, supermarket and coffee bar so all you need for a short or longer stay!:;

name: Beach camping
description:
Beautiful bay right at the beach. Follow the pretty steep road on the right side of the main road to the beach. We stayed here for two nights. On the first night, several other campers and tents were staying as well, but on the second night, we were just with two cars. Recommend this place!

Camping within walking distance with a small shop en restaurant if needed.

If you are a big rig, you need 4x4

name: Parking lot
description: Large pretty much flat parking lot among trees, next to a tennis court. Tap available. No parking on Mondays because of market. Quiet place if you need to spend a night near Litochoro.

name: Mountain forest camp
description: Tucked away spot in the mountains with beautiful forest views. 4x4 preferable but not essential, especially in dry weather. Lots of options for camp sites in the semi-cleared area. 4x4 will get you to some nice hidden spots.

name: Lerissos
description:
Just in front of the sea where boats are under construction. At the end of the city before going to Delphini Camping.
You can park, have a beer at the bar. There is a kid's playground too.

name: Quite spot below trees at plantation
description:
Quiet space for a tent. Below trees next to plantation. 

The owner came by in the morning and asked something in Greece, while we were still in the tent. When I was dressed and outside the tent he already sat in his car again and waved goodbye.

name: Kavala only over night
description: gravel place. wonderfull view over Kavala. easy to go there. Calm

name: Florina mobile towers
description:
We free camped for one night at the top of the hill nearby the town of Florina. 
Two mobile phone towers are end the end of this dead end track. There are some security cameras but they aren’t pointing anywhere useful so we were fine, no locals bothered us, good flat ground and some amazing views on the way up to the campsite

name: On the top of the montain
description:
Very good place, quiet and nice view.
We spent 1 night. Nothing more.

name: Akklisia Aglios Georgios
description: Flat and grassy spot near a small church. In the middle of fruit fields.

name: Gas Station
description: Free water at the gas station. Nobody in the station

name: JBK Land Rover
description:
Fantastic help from Dimitris and John on our way to Asia. It isn't cheap, but it's worth it. They replaced a transfer box, fixed up some of my own botched repairs, and have a large stock of parts.

It seems to be the place to get your Defender fixed in Greece. There must be a hundred Defenders (literally, I think) parked up in the surrounding streets waiting to be serviced.

name: Beautifull parking just before Nymfaio.
description: At the top of the montain, 200 m before the beautifull village. Very calm.

name: On the beach-volley
description: Lot of gras, toi can camp Where toi want and the Time you want

name: Blue Dream Camping
description:
We don't recommend this place! 32 Euro for 2 persons and campervan and they charge you extra for every shower (0,30€/6min). No toilet paper, no soap. 
Huge campsite, many longterm camper. Beach full with sunbeds (they charge extra) and there is not much space left to lay on your own towel. If it wasn't late at night we wouldn't stay..

name: On the beach
description: On the beach, no problems, no facility

name: Ekklisia Agios Georgios
description: small church with table and roof. between fields and industrial buildings. a few visiting dogs at night but armless. lots of mosquitos! good spot in the area for cycling travellers like us.

name: Wildcamping at the beach
description: You take the official road till you can’t drive forward. You take at your right the sandy road to the beach. It’s a short road, but you need 4x4 to come there. There are a few local people (in the summer) at a sandy with a little gravel beach. Nice place to stay.

name: Beach cape kiviri
description: Nice quiet small beach outside a small village. Flat area on beach to park your car.

name: Rovies beach
description: Great camping spot next to the see. There are a lot of spots, it is a sort of nonofficial camping. Super flat, suitable for all kind of cars and tents. Also very good spot to spend a few days.

name: Karavostasi by the Sea
description: Free parking provided by the council. No shade but nice carpark. Quiet and friendly locals. Good for overnight or even longer.

name: beach
description:
Grassy flat spot at the beach. We stayed here because the other place was not possible to go with our car.
Cose to a hotel.

name: Diesel Service Workshop
description: Next to the Renault service there are 3 Garages and the middle one is specialized in Diesel injection and pump service. He regenerated my pump in 2 days for acceptable price. He hardly speaks english but is reliable in helping you.

name: beach bar parking
description:
we camped on the grassy spot next to the bar. direkt at the sandy beach.
we ask, and its allowed to stay and camp here. (free)
(we dont understand why people are going to the owercrowded and expensive campsite close to here... there are so many spots direkt at the beach.)

at the bar you can have chairs, small snacks, beer and all you need. (chairs and umbrellas are for free if you order something)
very nice and friendly people

name: a road with almost all type of car garages
description:
fiat garage.
you can find almost every car garage at this road. service and everything you need

name: on the way from the view point
description:
close to the road from and to the view point of the gorge. close to the road but close to no traffic at night. great view in the valleys. no service at all. Easy access even without 4x4.
LTE+ network

name: Thassos beach camp
description: Right on the beach, with a tree for some shade. Beach bar close by.

name: Ketamoti beach camp
description: Nice spot on the Beach, view of Island thassos, beach showers.

name: Natural bridge (Strava)
description: close to the beach with a fantastic view on a natural bridge. leveled place easy access with a 4x4 or normal car with clearance

name: Parking Dora Stratou Theater
description: Paved parking of greek dance Theater, quiet at night. we stayed two nights and left the car also there during the day. It is in the middle of the city, right at the Filopappou hill park. 15min walk through the park to the Acropolis entrance gate. Supermarket and bakery at st. Kato petralona metro station (10min). On the way to the this metro station there are plenty nice bars and restaurants (no tourists only locals) and a playground half way the google routing to the station. the parking is free - we asked at the ticket office of the theatre and they said no problem to stay. Portaloos on site (pretty clean for a portaloo).

name: Akrati beach Camping
description: Campground with direct beach access, very nice Greece-Australian owners, super clean facilities, tavern on site. we paid 18€ for two adults and one child (babies are free) plus the truck.

name: PAPATHEOCHARIS E.KONSTANTINOS, GARAGE TRUCK in Katrerini
description: best truck service in Greece. friendly staff and helpful.

name: Behind great lake
description:
A very nature and nice quiet place quite in front of the river. Some fire placees! keep it clean 
better to have 4x4

name: Lake beach
description: Small gravel beach with good access to the lake for swimming. 2wd vehicles ok but avoid deep gravel. Some grass nearby. Some noise from the nearby road but little trafic at night. But LOTS of noise from the frogs !

name: Abandonded spot
description: it is a abandonned camping or parking on the beach. easy to get in. perfect for big rigs

name: kastro
description: on the beach parking on sand and green. the place is owned by a german club who leave it free for motor home.

name: Marmari beach
description: Beach parking. Easy access. Room for big rigs. Water (shower) available. Toilet if you are brave!  Strong 4G. Few trees but no good for morning shade. Resteraunts and shop a short walk away.

name: Blue Star ferry office
description:
Tickets can be bought here if like me you couldn't get their site to let you book a vehicle.  Friendly English speaking staff. 
€105 car and driver Kos to Athens. Daily evening departures.

name: Chios free parking
description: free parking spot near the center of Chios. arrived at night so we didn't want to explore the island in the dark. very quiet place reachable for campers trucks not sure

name: Roundabout in the mountains
description: We just kept driving up into the mountains and found this deserted hotel (Lailias Mountain Lodge) with a parking lot and a roundabout. It's part of Lailias Ski Area (3 draglifts on a mountain). There is a little entrance into the forest halfway around, perfect for a hidden, quiet night. Or just camp on the roundabout or parking lot, since there is nobody anyway.

name: Perfectly hidden beach
description: Spot underneath a tree, with loads of shade, on the beach. Grassy patch. Might be hard to get to without 4x4 (sand path). Completely hidden from the road.

name: Secret Beach
description: Secret Beach is remote, quiet and beautiful. 4x4 only. There is a large, flat, grassy area with some trees.

name: Hidden little spot
description: Nicely hidden little spot, good for 1 car. Ofcourse there is some rubbish, why take it with you when you can leave it behind, right?! There is a beachbar close by but it was closed off season.

name: Fire camp
description: If it happens for you to be in this remote location, this spot may be your overnight stay. Quite clean, several flat parking opportunities, completely deserted. Running water is found 500m up the road. This is for nature lovers, leave the place as you found it and respect the surroundings.

name: Picnic Area in Dadia Forest
description: Ideal for overnight camp, deserted spot, flat and very quiet. Offers space for several rigs or tents. Keep it clean, take your rubbish with you.

name: Corfou
description:
Large parking close to the old citadel. Perfect for visiting the old city and the new citadel. 6 € for the day and the night.
--
Grand parking à deux pas de l’ancienne citadelle. Parfait pour visiter la vieille ville et la nouvelle citadelle. 6€ pour la journée et la nuit.

name: Beach road
description: Plenty of spots along this beach road. Different beach bars with showers, but none of them open at this time of year (November)

name: Camping on old bit of road
description:
An old section of road that is totally quiet. It's a little difficult to find a level spot but we found one. It's completely quiet, only noise is wind. Unfortunately there are no services. 
3G on Vodafone.

name: Parking area next to windmills
description: Just if the main road there is a section of old road that leads behind the windmills (electrical generating ones, not old style) and there are flat areas to park. There are no services but it is very quiet with full 3g on Vodafone Gr.

name: Car park next to nice beach
description: We were here in November and it was empty, but the beach is lovely. I would think that it is very different in Summer. 4g on Vodafone. Water available from tap near tree.

name: Very quiet beautiful beach
description:
We stayed here in mid November and it was completer empty, we had the place to ourselves. The sea is beautiful and clear. There is a water tap and cold showers. It really is amazing. But it might be very different in Summer. 
4G Vodafone Greece (and using our old Turkcell SIM card too)

name: Leros Marina
description: Leros Marina - We camped here for 2 nights as we passed through on our way to Rhodes. The price is 10€ per night with hot showers and clean lovely toilets. You also pay 5€ for metered electricity, which lasted us well over 2 days. Also free WiFi and expensive laundry (8€ per load, same to dry).

name: quiet place with sea view
description:
Small unpaved road (30m) next to asphalt road, very quiet with wonderful sea and mountain views
Hidden from the road

name: Parking Guest House Arsenis
description: Big parking place, free for campers, camper facilities.

name: church on hilltop
description: Beautiful place on a hill surrounded by forest. Little church and club house of local moto club. Children's play garden and lots of places to park and picnic . Might not be quiet in season, I was here in November. Good 4G reception, no water, toilet was locked.

name: Deserted part of the island
description: Here is a very quiet place to camp fora night. This part of the island is very quiet with very little houses. 4G with Vodafone.

name: Mandraki Marina, Rhodes Town
description: There are a few places along the marina where it is fine to camp. When we arrived we went and asked the Marina manager and he said it was fine, he even allowed us to use the shower and toilet, this is normally locked but he opened it for us. Water available.

name: Patras ferry
description: Here is the port of Patras. you can buy ferry tickets for vehicle and passengers to Bari, Ancona or Venice.

name: Cape Sounio Wild Camping Spot
description: Small clearing on the cape peninsular. Hidden from main road and overlooking the sea. There is a house round the corner but out of the way - not close enough to disturb each other!

name: Parking on quiet dead-end road
description: This road leads to a quarry and there was no traffic in the tone we stayed there. So it is very very quiet. There are no services.

name: Amazing beach parking
description: There are many place to camp around here, we were here in winter and the place was deserted. Not sure what it would be like in summer. There are water taps around and a toilet which was locked when we were there. Good mobile phone signal.

name: Long gravel road with lake view
description: There is a long gravel road on the north side of this hill, looking out on the lake. The coordinates are from where I left the tarmac road and started searching for a camping spot. I camped at 40.652088, 23.086434. Nobody passed me, totally silent, with great view!

name: Very quiet road
description: Quiet parking spot on a very very quiet road. No traffic came past us. Full 4G on Vodafone Gr.

name: virginale private car park
description: Private parking with electricity and water. The very nice owner has charged us 7,5 € with electricity.CALM

name: Pkimmiri Car Park
description: We were here in winter and it was completely deserted. Not a person around. Perfect.

name: Harbour parkinglot
description: Parking on the quiet port with electricity and water.

name: Forest Picnic Area
description: Large picnic area with tables, running drinking water and a waterfall

name: MOTO Service Katsigiannis
description: Good service for bike. Great, helpful and professional team, brothers. Really clean place, possible to make all the maintenance. Reasonable prices. Highly recommended.

name: Minoan Lines RoRo ticket office for Alexandria
description: Right hand door when facing the white building. Xanthia was my helpful agent. shipping, customs, broker, port, agency fees total Euro1299 paid via online. I'll use CFS fixed in Alexandria, cost euro990.

name: Large parking area on quiet road
description: Large parking area near a statue memorial. Next to train station. Very quiet. There is a water tap next to statue. Flat and good for a night stop.

name: Nostos Beach Bar
description: Very friendly owner Mrs Flora and staff. Non charge for the place, just have a drink - coffe or eating something of great home made greek cusine. Water tap for free, also wc disposal. Possibility for power supply 220V (with charge). Very nice place for swimming and relaxing, specialy from June - 15 of July and 20 of August - 30 of September.

name: Wild camp spot near Angelokastro
description: Small wild camping spot just off the road between Angelokastro and Highway 5. A small dirt road turns off the road into a small clearing with several beehives, and behind the beehives is a small spot for a tent. Secluded spot with a panoramic view of the valley below.

name: Road side Spring
description: fresh water spring on road side. We filled our tanks here

name: Large Parking next to archeological site
description: Nice big flat car park next to the site of Ancient Edessa. There are bins and a water tap. It was deserted in March. May be busier in summer. Site is open Tuesday to Sunday 09.00 - 16.00. Free entry.

name: Road side next to spring
description: We found this at night but it's quite flat and there is a water spring, which we think is ok to drink. We did and we were ok. There is good 4g signal and there are nice taverns in the nearby village. Very quiet, very dark. Good spot!

name: Road side spring
description: Fresh cold water from spring next to road. We filled and drank lots of the water. All good.

name: Parking on side of old road
description: Nice place to stop for a night very near the border with Bulgaria on the old road, so very very quiet. You can hear the new road in the distance but not much. There is a water spring just down from here. Good signal on Vodafone and Cosmote.

name: Seaside with restaurant and playground
description: Is it the nicest spot? No of course not, but it’s nice enough. Paved and dirt lots at the end of the road with a restaurant and playground. There were people swimming and some dogs but all friendly.  Showers and toilets available.

name: Camper Club
description: Brilliant quick and fair mechanic. He helped us with a blown inverter, saw us and fixed it within a couple of hours.

name: Beach camp into the dunes
description: Nice beach camp behind the dune. Seems to be a national park and a well known camper spot so in summer I guess you won’t be alone. There’s nothing around, just the long beach which is quite nice. People from villages come along for bathing and fishing. One old men comes to sell fruits and wine to the campers. We were alone and enjoyed the stay a lot. Easy to reach with 2wd.

name: Camp on the cliffs
description: access through a gravel road. there are many suitable places for tents or 4x4 cars with awesome view to the sea. you're camping just in the edge of the cliffs. very calm place with nice sunset.

name: The Ugly Duckling
description: Brilliant little traditional green taverna. Super friendly great English. Live music on Sundays.

name: Abandoned hot springs and refugee camp
description: A peculiar spot, but worth a visit. Hot springs are 40°C and very pleasant. The site is an old resort that is now home to a refugee camp. Ten campers when we were here - lots of flat spaces and everyone enjoying themselves. Trash bins near springs, but otherwise no amenities. Free.

name: Camping spot on dead end rural road
description:
Several possibilities to stay for a night on the sides of a dead end rural road. At the end of the road there is a gate to something like a stone pit.
No 4x4 needed, but the road is quite bumpy. We stayed for one night, in the evening a friendly worker passed by car. You can slightly hear the road, but at night the is no traffic. Little bit of sea view.

name: Wild camp on a peninsula
description: Nice place next to s small church in a light forrest. Very quiet, nobody else here.

name: Kastoria free parking
description: It’s a nice parking lot next to a beautiful lake. There were swans in the lake. Really nice to view. Had no trouble to stay for a night.

name: Outside Kissimis port
description: Large gravel area near the water and a church. Slightly quieter than the parking area inside the port. Good enough for a night before/after the ferry.

name: Phalasarna Beach
description: Long sandy beach with crystal blue water. Large flat parking area on the sand between beach restaurants. Possible showers and water at restaurants in summer. No shade.

name: Isthmia
description:
At the end of the village near the canal
Very calm

name: Pigadia
description: Small little village by the sea almost uninhabited out of season

name: Meteore Stade
description:
Parking in front of Kalambaka stadium without any services
---
Parking devant le stade de Kalambaka sans aucun service

name: seaside
description:
an area near the beach must be used in high season lit at night by hotel seaside area is hotel an other grassy area above --- une aire près de la plage doit être utilisé en haute saison éclairé la nuit par hôtel
seaside area n'est hôtel an other grasse area above

name: Auto Boat Kremis
description:
a well equipped garage repaired me water pump for free --- un garage bien équipé m'a réparé pompe a eau gratuitement aimable
good service friendly

name: parking on the beach,gras or sand.toilet
description: beachplace great.nobody there in november 2017.i really enjoyed it

name: Stravos port, habour
description:
center of the village at the port. drinking water taps at the quays, public toilets
centre du bourg au port de nombreux emplacements robinets d'eau potable sur les quais toilettes publiques

name: Georgioupolis harbor
description: Prking on gravel on both sides of the harbor. Southeast side has water and a toilet near the beach bar. The other side is quieter and near Arkadi fish tavern (expensive food, but cheap drinks!) Connected by bridge and right in a nice town with pleasant restaurants around the square.

name: Camping Elizabeth
description: Older campground on the beach. A little run down and funky, but has everything you need.

name: drinking water
description: Three taps. Drinking water used by locals.

name: Sea view
description: small flat spot at the end of a gravel road. big enough for a tent or a 4x4 car. nice view along the shore and great sunrise. stayed one night. very calm in the night. you can hear lots of birds

name: Karabostási beach
description: Many places to park on small pebble beach for a few kilometers. Small beach bar at end. No services. Peaceful.

name: Bird watching beach place
description: Nice place in a protected area for bird watching/wet land. If you keep the area clean people (even the ranger) won’t send you away. There are different options for staying. This one seems to be the nicest one 37.386799, 22.7658. but you can discover the area and find other places. Not much locals come to this place. Better you enter the place from 37.3661528, 22.7518219, mostly tarmac and good gravel. In rainy days there is a big mud whole before the place but we made it with 2wd... you can also use the road here 37.384874, 22.743818 with gravel and potholes. Enjoy the nature and keep the place clean!

name: Mylos beach
description: Public beach between a resort and housing. About 500m of undeveloped sand and grass. Lots of space. Mt Olympus in the distance. Quiet at night. Other campers are here.

name: small beach Spot
description: Rough way, only 4wd and enough clearance. But perfect place direct at the sea.

name: Harbour carpark
description: Harbour carpark with very clean porta cabins with washbasins and paper even one for the disabled. No charge. Main road goes over the cliff behind. 2 minutes walk from beach and main town. Shower on beach. Very quiet when we were here in May

name: Near blue flag beach
description: We are here in May so things may change in the high season. It’s a parking area overlooking the sea with a bar a hundred meters away and a Blue flag small sandy beach 200 meters. There is a shower on the beach. The main road and town is about 600 meter

name: fishermen
description: good spot on the beach ,very queit....only a few  fishermen

name: Viannos
description: Parking at a memorial. 5 km of the Village.

name: Porto Kagio
description: Parking taverne Porto dans une petite crique

name: Cascade Polilimnio
description:
Parking de la cascade 
Snack en saison
Calme

name: on the beach
description: quiet spot with many trees along the beach and good places for cars

name: On the edge of a forrest
description: Nice wildcamp spot on the edge of a small Forrest. You need a 4x4 to get there, the road in is gravel/ sand.

name: Akti Retzika
description:
Camping ground, small hotel, bungalows and restaurant at site. 50m from the beach with beach bar and sunbeds.
