Very warm Welcome. Run by 2 sisters and their mom. Really Nice people.
All is clean !
18,50€ for one night low season : car, trailer, 2 people, without electricity.
You can have breakfast (buffet) for 8€ pp

name: Ouzouni Beach Camping
description: Very nice family run camping with new showers and toilets! Car with rooftop tent in front row with direct view on the beach and the sunset. Cost 16 Euros for 2 person including car. Owners are very helpful with any problems! Beware there are two campings on the same spot, be sure to take the right entrance which is a little hidden, but you see it when you approach.

name: Diakofto Beach
description: Long beach, little shade, shower and water, nice place and walking distance to the village

name: Año Diakofto
description:
Small chapel on the heights of the village
Panoramic view of mountain, vineyards and sea
One of our most beautiful bivouacs in Greece
Good ground clearance and 4x4 preferable

name: Patra
description:
On the beach
Convenient for the ferry
Snack in season
Calm

name: At lake Techniti Limni Plastira
description: Nice little hidden camp spot. End of a sandy road. there are several places you can park along the shoreline (just check a map). Multiple paths along the lake. The water was high, so some paths were flooded. Sandy and gravel roads, they can get very slippery and muddy after rain.

name: beach with chapel
description: 10 meters down road from chapel parking. nice open area.  10 more meters to sea.

name: Olive tree beach
description:
A beautiful pebble beach, grassy fields between ancient olive trees. You need a 4x4 to get there. The road is steep at places and you need ground clearance. There is plenty of space to park between the trees. Pitching a tent is possible. 

A friendly shepherd came by to say hello, we've asked if we could stay. No problem. Bring some dog treads for his dogs, one of the dogs stayed with us the whole night.

Place take back your garbage and keep this place clean. 4G T-Mobile worked fine.

name: Cliffside
description:
Nice place, just off the sand path. Flat area to park, view of Mount Athos. There is space for 2 or 3 cars/ tents. You will need a 4x4 to get here. The path is not used very often (overhanging branches) Nice and quiet place, with lots of birds singing. We stayed one night with a Defender and rooftop tent. 4G T-Mobile was working. Possible to take a shower at the beach Salonikiou (10 min by car) Enjoy!!
.
Please take back your own garbage, and if possible pick up any trash you might find around. It was very clean when we came around. Keep it that way!

name: Place at the lake
description: We didn't like the place a bit further on the beach as you are completely visible from the road. We took a track about 500 meters before you reach the beach to the right and then followed to the left till the end. A bit more hidden and a lot of shade. LTE signal

name: Free camping
description: Official and free parking for campers on a level lawn. No facilities and no shade but ok for an overnight stay. Near a cold but nice river and close to several beautiful hiking trails. Although it is next to a road, really quite. Only a few cars during day, no car at night.

name: Drinking water
description: Here you can get drinking water out of a natural source.

name: Methana
description: Next to the fishingboat under a tree. Very nice place for one night. Restaurants in the village

name: Ribiera beach at the Golf of Orfanos
description:
Almost empty beach.
clean sandbeach and clear water, with shower at the beach.
no garbage, no streetdogs or -cats!

name: Nice place next to the river, with waterfall nearby
description: Small sandy shadow place under a tree, with easy access to the river. Beatiful waterfall reachable by foot in 10-15 Min. Awesome place!

name: Water Tap
description: Water tap is opposite a large 5m tall statue of a sitting lion, on the small patch of green. You can park right next to it.

name: Alexandroupoli
description: Very good mechanics and kind people. Very helpfull

name: Irakleides
description: Water point with tap.  No indication that water is drinking water but installed in 2015. Tap is clean.

name: Kalamos beach
description: Long pebble beach area. Popular with local families camping and fishing overnight. Beach showers and a restaurant nearby.

name: Parking place near the city
description: Big parking place, suitable for campers and cars. Bit trashy, but on for overnight stay.

name: Athan Parisis Garage / Motor factor
description: Well equipped garage and parts shop. Owner's son speaks a little English. Very reasonable prices.

name: Place with the see view
description: On the beach, just under the main road, sleeping in a car. Nice spot to park right with the beach view. Little noise from the road, but over the night almost gone. Quite a lot of mosquitos.

name: Monastery of St Dionysis
description: Small car park near the monastery of Dionysis on mount Olympus. Spent the night here in a thunderstorm, very atmospheric and a welcome break from the heat off the plain. Not level but quieter than the big car park at the trail head 2km further on, where there are toilets and a restaurant.

name: Small meadow near monastery
description: Meadow with small chapel just down from the monastery. Views of the lake and surrounding hills. Quiet and no passing traffic. Access is to the left if coming down the hill from the monastery.

name: Cliff top Ismara
description: Beautiful open space on a low cliff overlooking the sea. You can climb down to the beach below. Access is via a long gravel track past archaeological sites (Ismara). Very quiet but we were bothered by a lot of flies. Quite a lot of rubbish but we managed to find a reasonably clear area. Track is fairly easy if you arrive from the West. If your coming from the East the track is stunning but good ground clearance is needed.

name: On the beach
description: Rough ground with hard standing right next to beach. Only one other camper here. No facilities but perfect swimming.

name: On the beach
description: Pebbles beach, place for 8 caravans, beach suitable for tents. Taverna across the road. If you ask, you can get water probably.

name: refill bootle
description: you can refill your propane french bootle, Ask Dimitry Manos, his shop it's near the el mondo bar, i wait 2h for translation and pay 20e for 10kg gaz

name: Camping Katerina
description: Semi large campground, 10 meters from the beach, with mostly shade-places. Basic and clean toilets and showers. Helpfull host. Little shop on the campsite.

name: Honda Alimoudis
description: Very good family run motorcycle work shop. Though technically a Honda shop, they are happy to work on most bikes, depending on the job. They can also get standard motorcycle parts couriered in from anywhere in Greece. Very helpful, friendly, and professional. The son, Dimitrios, speaks excellent English.

name: Parking Parkopolis
description:
Mary: 00306972211356 (please try to call before, then you have better chances to get a place :)) 

24 hours secured parkinglot. Very friendly and  helpful owner. The metrostation is 5minutes walkingdistance and you are in 40 minutes on the Akropolis. Water and free Wifi for 15 Euro (until 7m length, over 7m price depends)  Shoppingcenter two blocks.

name: Agia Paraskeue
description:
wildcamppot at an old "church."
Enoigh place to camp wit rooftoptents.
Small road, not for big rigs or campers.
Beautiful view at night
Good phone coverage

name: Meteora central hostel
description:
nice hostel 
15€
safe parking for the motorbike 
kitchen 
garden

name: next to the river
description:
Great spot just next to the river. Very quiet at night. No traffic and nobody bothered us here.
Under the bridge the river is deeper and perfect to swim

name: Archontiko Agonari
description: Wonderful place! But quite difficult to find. We paid 40€ for a room incl. breakfast. But it is so worth to stay here! Everything what you need is here.

name: Summit Zero Hostel
description:
nice hostel with beach in the front 
parking for the motorbike 
15€

name: Vradeto Beloi
description: Small village to start the walk to Beloi view point. We camped on the parking. Very quiet at night. Few cars during the day. In the village there is a small cafe run by Dina. Right behind the hotel. A wonderfull place. In the evening we ate in the tavern from her parents down from her place. Left from church. Truely authentic Greek food and atmosphere. One of our most pleasant stays in Greece.

name: Under the tree front of the beach
description:
A perfect place to rest in front of the beach with shadow under trees. We went there during high season, the "fisherman" place were nice but full of people so we decided to go bit far-way and we found this quiet place. You can hear a bit the road but the wave music is louder.
Nobody there, the beach was just for us.
Access could be difficult without 4x4 or big-rig. Fire pit on the beach and on this place.

name: Arnea village
description: Entrance of the nice old village of Arnea. Quiet place with nice historic architecture in the hill. Perfect for an Ice-Cream for a fresh break in the summer.

name: South of Tferoti on the beach
description:
Long beach with white sand. You can walk for almost 50 meters on the water and is waist deep.
Sandy ocean bottom. Great location

name: Taverna Koustenis
description: There is a parking ground for campers next to a restaurant and hotel. The floor ist gravel so not verry good for tents. The staff is verry friendly. You can stay there for free but if you order something it shouldnt be a problem to use the facilities. Perfect for the Lousios path but ask the staff for the right access they have a map and can easyly show it to you. Verry nice view but in our rooftent a little bit windy and cold during the night(July).

name: Rockslide
description:
Unpassable rockslide (motocross may be possible). 
No track to Daphnopotamos beach (like google maps says)

name: Camping at the lake
description:
Two big camping grounds, one directly at the lake the other one 10m higher. 
4x4 required, a few muddy bogholes on the way in summer. When it’s raining, mud terrain tyres needed.

name: Trash-Beach
description:
Big beautiful beach, appart from a lot of trash.
4x4 required.

name: Camping with a view
description:
Flat spot at the edge of a dried river. Nice view on Mount Olympos, villages and the sea. 
A Park-Ranger came by in the evening and asked for our identities but everything was fine and we could stay the night

name: Turningbay with a view
description: Big turningbay with a nice view over the sea.

name: Port Rooms
description: Great owner (Eleni), safe parking for motorcycles, clean rooms, quiet, good wifi. Recommended. Suggested as a friend and stayed for 35 euros for 2 person in June 2019.

name: Camping next to Thessaloniki
description: Lonely place, but not far from the big roads, 20min to the airport.

name: Beach bar parking
description: Large parking space divided on several areas for two or three beach bars. A little bit crowded in the high season but in the evening you can find several nice spots. There are also more private places in the woods on the left but a lot of longterm campers are staying there. The ground is sandy but good to drive also for campers ore heavier cars without 4x4. You can have chairs on the beach with and sun umbrella for at least one drink (all together 5€). The sea ist verry nice to swim. During the time we stayed the pit toilets were locked but you can get the keys at the bar (everybody verry friendly). Big trees are providing a lot shadow during all daytimes.

name: Parking of beach bar/ restaurant
description: Grassy parking ground of a beach bar/ restaurant directly next to the road but quiet in the evening. There are a lot of trees that provide shadow and the beach is sandy and perfect to swim also for little children because the water is not very deep near the shore. Even thou we stayed in the high season it was not very crowded. It is not a touristic place but a lot of local people were swimming here. The owners of the restaurant were ok with us staying for one night but you should ask whether you are welcome or not just to be polite.

name: Plori Restaurant
description: A very nice family restaurant. Biker friendly. Very good food and the owner can help you with a lot of stuff regarding the travel, motorcycles and more.

name: Techniti Limni Plastiras Lake near Athanasios
description: Easy to reach camp spot at a flat water entry spot suitable for all kinds of vehicle sizes. Last few hundred meter are mud gravel which may become slippery when its wet. Very quiet and relaxing place, from arrival till next day afternoon we didn't see other people while it's close to a small village. Stong 4G signal.

name: Church parking
description: Parking ground of a church directly at the lake. You can park here and use the facilities for a 5€ donation for the church. Just ask the man at the small souvenir shop in the inner yard of the building complex if you can stay there. He will explain everything to you. Everybody is very friendly and they are speaking English quite well. Sleeping in a tent may not be allowed but a camper or rooftent is absolutely ok. There are also several other small spots along the road.

name: Mykonos Fokos beach
description: Mykonos Fokos beach parking is a nice quiet spot during the night. There is a small restaurant with toilet nearby, and a few houses/tourist apartments. In the evening security came by, but said it's ok to stay, only warned us that it is deserted at night and be careful. As we didn't see a "funny" people during the day, it felt safe to stay

name: Athens Toyota dealer
description: One of the bigger Toyota dealers in the Athens city with lot of parts in store. Mechanics and parts sales open till 16.00 (as for most others, dealer till 21.00). We arrived just before 21.00 but sales guys were friendly and willing to call around to find correct part numbers to help us out.

name: Dry river by the sea
description: We arrived really late at night , every beach around had no shade and we gave it a try . It’s was perfect , light breeze from the mountain and shade up to 10.00 am it’s free camping but no one bothered us . 2x4 or 4x4 if you want to go deeper in the trees

name: Psatha beach
description: This is a spot to free camp at the end of a beautiful beach. There is plenty of space for all type of vehicles. No facilities but you can use the WC of the near by tavern with some minimum consumption.Really quite at night and very safe. In the morning a lot of people come for the day.

name: Unpassable road
description: 1-2m deep unpassable roads. May be possible with a very small car, but very dangerous. Impossible for a Land Rover Defender.

name: By the sea
description:
Nice flat campspot with a nice sunset, many catchweeds. 
Too small roads for a big rig tho.

name: Rafting Campsite
description: a place near a cafe ,river, almost quiet

name: Koula beach
description:
Open sandy area at end of sandy track. The far end of the lake shore area at the Prespa Lake side. 
Nice views. Water not as nice as at Konsko. Muddy lake bottom and low level water.
Many pelicans around. Very quiet.
After sun set an absurd amount of big mosquitoes woke up. If you live all your life out side as we do  with roof top tents you might be challenged.

name: Ipapandi Monastery
description:
Gravel track all the way to the isolated hermitage. 
Driving past the heremitage for a hundred meters the track becomes a 4x4 track. Driving just a few meters uphill there is a flat sandy platform right at the side of the track. Big enough for landrover with roof top tents and also for a mid size van. Beautiful view of monastery and beautiful sun set above the mountains.

name: Thermo Lake Beach
description:
Wonderful place for free camping. We were the only ones around, except for an abandoned dog living at the beach, though it was weekend. A nice gravel/stony beach with shadow beneath olive trees. Beautiful warm and clear water, perfect for swimming. It takes a  rather steep gravel track with a couple of sharp bends for about 3.5 km to get there. Rather broad track so bigger vehicles can go down too, just not shade beneath trees after arrival. No need of 4x4 but good with some power. Beginning of track at a view point outside town.
Dog doesnt bother, very shy. Though a little barging during night.

name: Deviation for Monastery
description: The coordinates indicate the turn of for a big monastery. Driving 1.2 km along this road you see a gravel track on the left hand side of the road. Entrance to the track a little narrow. Drive about 200 meters and you arrive at a rather big open, flat gravel spot beneath the rocks and close to what looks like an old unused mine entrance. Beautiful view down towards the Korinth Strait and the olive fields. Not really visible from main road or road towards monastery. Drivable in ordinary vehicle but entrance to gravel track might be too narrow for bigger rigs.

name: Tigani
description: On a stone beach, trees for shade, very nice spot.

name: Chania Camping
description: This is an established campground about 8 km outside Chania. 20€ for two people and a car with a rooftop tent. Has all the services and it is well maintained. A warm welcome from the owners is waiting for you in the entrance. Has a small pool and a mini market also

name: Apothiki Restaurant
description: Great spot to free camp in Triopetra. After passing the restaurants. If you lower your tyre pressure you can drive all the way at the end and camp under some trees. Restaurants have shower,toilet and WIFI. If you have one meal there they will allow you to use them

name: Beach camping
description: Grass areas next to the beach. Several campers at the spot in july. Public shower. No other facilities.

name: Camping Drepano
description:
Large established camping that lies on the whole peninsula. Beautiful location, spots really next to the beach. Clean bathtrooms, basic kitchen. It has an indoor market and restaurant.
 Not cheap :10 euros/night/person with a tent.

name: Anatoli Restaurant
description: On the side of Anatoli restaurant. Friendly owner allow us to stay on this spot that is practically the restaurant's parking. No facilities. We did some minimum consumption in the restaurant and we could use the toilets and the outside water source. We have a land cruiser with a rooftop tent.

name: Sofas camping
description:
Rate 23.50 euro for 2 persons with a tent.
 Restaurant and bar, laundry and nice beach but no kitchen.

name: Vagia beach
description:
A big gravel bank and nice beach. No people around as it is very hard to access, only possible with 4x4 as the gravel is mostly very soft. Even in peak season there is nobody. At the end of the bank is a private house. You can pass it to go to a little island with an old church on it, but the best beach is before (see gps location). Also very nice with kids as there are no waves or stones in the water
It is paradise if you are looking for super lonely peace in Greece

name: Xerokabos
description: This is an isolated village in the SE part of Crete. Beautiful small coves where you can spend the night. There are free showers along the coast if needed. In the municipality parking at the entrance of the village is the only designated area for free camping (has toilets as well) but we had no problem sleeping in other areas. Just ask any of the friendly locals.

name: Vassiliki Camping
description: Access to the beach (70m). .Old but good facilities (refrigerator and freezer).

name: Vonitsa
description: Water tap at the corner. Potable. In front of a restaurant.

name: Loutraki
description: nice place between the trees. shady and almost quiet. get the dirt route from the main road before the bridge. location is 50m from the road at your left side.

name: Camping Dias
description:
Nice organized camping with great camping spots on the beach.
Price for family of 4 with a van with a roof tent for 23 euro.

name: Kalamata river bed
description: On the pretty bussy road next to the beach of Kalamata, where all beachbars, restaurants and campsites are, there are also 2 riverbeds. We stayed in one of them for 3 nights. All good, but I think the Greek have no problems at all...

name: Argylos Beach
description: Another great spot in the area. You can use the clay of the beach here for mud baths. There is absolute no facilities here so come prepared.

name: Preveli
description: This is a small beach 600 m from Preveli beach. As vehicles can not approach Preveli this is your best option. There is a small mini market with basic things and a toilet. Great for overnight stay

name: In frond of Nopigia Camping
description: We arrived here late and we did not want to pay for camping so we camped wright in frond under the trees. We thought we would be told of but the camping owners did not really mind. No facilities

name: Gold Beach
description:
Long, at least 2km, sandy beach. Dirty road, but affordable for campervans.
Few spots under the trees. Behind this there is the Gold Beach camping. They have only few free places. With a great restaurant.

name: Camping Gold Beach
description: CG close to the sea. Mainly long term campers. Some sites for motorhomes. Toilets, hot shower, electricity, wifi zone, restaurant. Clean, friendly reception, uncomplicated. EUR 20 for motorhome (5.6 m) + 2 persons + electricity).

name: Katastari
description: spring water, at the junction ,potabale ,in front of the spring an old man sells virgin olive oil and homemade wine

name: Langadia Parking
description: quiet place on the top of the beatiful village ,we parked at the end of right upper side.spring water at the parking entrance

name: Mantoudi Lake
description: a camping spot across the road. there is a dirt road infront of the spot that pass the river and leads to a beautiful lake

name: Makrinista Play Ground
description: a very big play ground 5km to Makrinista .quiet even in the morning .there is a restaurant near the spot

name: Shower/ Drinking water
description:
public water for everyone 
possible to take a shower

name: Next to River
description:
gravel area next to the river. not much shadow. for tents you need good pegs. you can hear the bridge. not much traffic. 
cold beer at the tavern

name: Bear Beach
description:
small sandy beach at the lake
not much shadow
Locals told us, that they spotted bear footprints sometimes and even a wolve was seen

name: Camping Dias
description: decent campground on the beach.  22 euros per night, a little more if you are on the beach.  we were able to get our 8.2 meter motorhome on, but just barely.  full amenities, friendly staff, and lots of trees and shade.  Mostly tents, but some campers and an occasional motorhome.

name: Dionissiotis Camping
description: A shade campground next to a restaurant and a pool. It is pretty rundown and the facilities are fading but still has all you might need for a night or two. 18€ for 2 people and a rooftop tent.

name: Truck Repair
description: Truck mechanic repair and body repair. We had a leakage to the aux diesel tank and need to find exactly where and weld it. They were very helpful and did the job in the afternoon.

name: Kato Chora
description: A place very close to the local road, near a church, but hidden in the trees and so quiet!

name: Ionion Blue Restaurant and Free Camping
description:
Free camping by Ionion Beach Restaurant.
Nice owner family, good food, nice beach.
We recommend.

name: Motorcycle Parking - Akrapolis
description: Since I had a hard time even finding Akrapolis itself, I thought this would be useful. You can park your motorcycle guarded right next to the entrance and leave valuable luggage, helmets, etc. free of charge. Don't know if the parking is free as well.

name: Parking Haven
description: Open area south of marina in Paralia. No services, just a field on the beach. Very close to town, quite few caravans parked there.

name: Beautiful cove
description: Perfect camping spot. Level ground, sandy beach. Great for pitching a tent or camping with any kind of vehicle since it's a paved road leading to the beach. Unlikely to have it to yourself but there is plenty space for numerous tents and vehicles. Some trees as well if you need shade.

name: Camping Nick
description:
Estabished campground, right on the beach. Has all facilities, toilets, showers, fresh water, electricity. Long term residents , but has few spots available for motorhomes. Not listed anywhere, we found it driving by. Its right on the beach and there is lots of shade. Paid $20 euros / night for 2 ppl and a camper van. Place screams for upgrades at the bathrooms but it did the  job for few nights. Location on the beach beats everything else. 
Beach is ok, though some big boulders in the water.

name: Volos
description: Free overnight parking on the beach. It's by a church and the beach. Close to marina and walking distance to groceries and restaurants.

name: Easywash
description: brand new self laundry place. machine 10kg for 3euros. 34minutes washing machine. dryer 50cts, 10mns. wifi. open from 7am to midnight. very clean. 50cts the detergent. change coin.

name: Tyre Shop
description:
They have good prices and good service.
www.tyreship.gr

name: Kakalis
description:
Small and very neat garage... specialised in All trucks...

I brought filters and oil and they changed and put Grease in Connections, 

Tel 2555022875

name: Desimi camping
description: Nice camping in a quiet place, the beach is narrow but covered with small stones. The place is very good if you have a boat or want to rent it

name: Grabanis
description: Good mechanic, speaks English, very kind! No big rigs or vans possible.

name: Beach Front
description: beautiful spot next to the beach! we were alone! there is a big rubbish bin!

name: On the beach 50 m from the sea.
description:
The road is asphalt suitable for any kind of motorhome.
Mine is 6.5 m length.
Very quiet and safe. The way is narrow and very steep but you can drive it. No 4x4 needed.

name: olympos beach
description: Campsite on the beach near the city of litochoro from where one can go up the olympus mountains with children playground, restaurant and minimarket. Price for family with 2 children up to 5 and asci card 17,50 euro per night.

name: Remote Bay
description: Remote bay directly at the beach. But you need high clearance vehicle and 4x4 recommended. There are some boats and empty trailers around. Place for 2-3 campers. But nevertheless lovely place for snorkeling and swimming.

name: Autosupplies
description: Good car part shop with a very friendly owner! He had the airfilter for a Landrover Defender not in stock but was able to order it so we could pick it up the next day. Very good service, highly recommened!

name: Koroni beach
description: A lovely car park right next to the beach. Ok for a tent as well. Water from a well just above the campsite next to the road. Great swimming spot

name: Propan shop
description: Super friendly guy who refilled our German bottle for 15€. He has all the adapters. Make sure to bring in the bottle before 2pm so you can grab it full after 5pm. You can park in the same street the whole day. With a big rig you can park in front of the giant staircase for a short time. From January 2020 he will sell the adapters for filling.

name: Small area out of Loutraki by St. Nikolaos church
description: Small area by a little church next to a small river. Large enough for a campervan or two, though the last meters up to here are a bit narrow (tarmac all the way).

name: Bakery & Coffee Shop
description: Good coffee shop & bakery with lovely views. Easy access off the main road. Fresh water.

name: Camping Hellas
description: Wonderful welcome from very helpful English speaking hosts. Great bar and restaurant in season. Small shop. €20 for 2 & van with electricity. Food at neighbouring site good too. Had beachside pitch. Good facilities and WiFi.

name: Kato Vasilike
description:
Nice beach, with shower and water. No problem for big camper. Little town, 2 km away.
They let cows graze on the beach area. Make sure to bring a mosquito screen as there are lots of flies everywhere.

name: AB city Supermarket
description: Good supermarket selling all basic needs

name: Rakadiko Restaurant
description: Excellent, delightful place with English menu, several vegetarian and vegan dishes + English spoken & fast WiFi.

name: Mountain Forest
description: There are several flat places in a mountain forest. You’ll be alone, maybe a Shepard will come by. There are options for hiking. It’s wonderful nature and no tourists. Definitely a place for more than one night. Perfectly during the hot period of time because it’s a little colder and shady. No 4x4 needed for the first places, if you drive further in the forest you’ll need one. Also perfect for big rigs and tent campers.

name: Camping Mystras Paleologio
description: Jaded but functional​. Lots of shade & a swimming pool. Bar, mini mart & restaurant + Washing machine and dryer. English and German spoken. Friendly. Open all year. Childrens'​ play area. Mystras 2.5 km away. €23.50 out of season for van, 2 people and electricity. Peaceful out of season.

name: Agia Sotira
description: Potable water from a mountain stream fountain next to the church in Agia Sotira. Large parking area and benches to sit and relax.

name: Nikiteas Bakery and Cafe
description: Great cafe/bakery.  English spoken. Has loo & reasonable size carpark beside the main road from Mystras to Monembasia. Wonderful doughnuts, cakes, pastries, bread, snacks and ice cream. Fast WiFi.

name: Laundromat Bubbles
description: Laundromat/Laundry called „Bubbles“. Does mixed washing by the kilo. Done on the same day. Next to military base. Opposite of a small Avin Gasstation.

name: Abandoned Beach Bar
description: We spent one night here are at the end of October with our small tent and bicycles. There are two abandoned beach bars (for the season) - more like grass huts. We set out tent up on the flat area in front of one. There is a fresh water shower and taps. We weren’t disturbed. Lovely sunset and quiet at night. The only noise was the waves.

name: Diros caves: Vlihada cave
description: Gorgeous boat trip in caves with stalactites and stalagmites. 3 warnings! Disorganised. Get tickets at first car park then go down to bottom of hill. Chaos at entry. We waited 25 mins after being told "a few minutes" only to have 6 Germans who'd only just arrived push in front of us. Boats take 6. You need to be fairly fit for clambering in and out of the boat and there are lots of steps, particularly at the end. Ceilings very low and instructions impossible to understand and sarcastic! You have to sit VERY still in the boat or you are shouted at!! All worth it for €15 or 10 for over 65 or children. Small children free.

name: Ideal Bikes
description: Great bicycle shop. We are cycle tourists who came in for a tune up. Friendly, helpful owners who speak English and have very good prices. Trek dealer.

name: Kerkini Lake Westshore
description: MODERATOR NOTE: Place removed because camping is illegal here.  Protected Area

name: Camping close to the main road
description: Nice space for one night stay. We came here with motorbike and pitched the tent. There is also place to stop with camper van. A little bit noisy from the road but it's manageable - there aren't many cars during the night. There's a concrete platform which is sheltered  - we pitched our tent there and we were quite hidden from the road. There are also 2 abandoned houses which you can camp in albeit quite dirty. The place is surrounded by some flat areas which are ideal to chill in during the day. PS the place is not explore yet so please take your garbage with you when leaving.

name: Octopus Beach
description: Small fishermen port. Beach on both sides of the land bridge. Access little rough on gravel, parking space for maybe 5 cars. Its a small place and locals come by for fishing (one showed us an octopus), but no one bothered us. 4G signal.

name: Cafe
description:
If you need to get some work done - this is the place. Cheap coffee and food (low choice though), at half the price of the city centre cafes.
Super fast WiFi, I mean reaally fast, lots of space, super quiet, some parking spots, but like everywhere in Thessaloniki - parking is a nightmare. 
Athenaa, the lovely owner, even hosted us with free food and sangria. Come and tell her your story, and you’ll be treated like a king!

name: Asprogiali
description: Asprogiali, abandoned beach resort. A bit north of another beach on iOverlander. No one (including locals) were here when we were so we had it all to ourselves. A bit tricky to get down here as there is no paved road, but we made it down in a small 2WD rental.

name: Mercedes Service
description:
Get your Sprinter fix here. Not the original Dealer Service, but they’ve got all the parts available and work on Mercedes exclusively. 
Very expensive, like anything in Greece. We did just oil change and needed original oil after our engine was overhauled, and simple oil was 40% more expensive than in Germany. 
But if you’re pressed and or need Mercedes parts - this is the place. 
They even have a puppy on staff!

name: Motorbiketrack parking
description: A lot of space next to a motorcross track in the woods. River is near but looks dirty.

name: Beach
description: Parking at the beach. The showers and toilets have been vandalised but there is water. The restaurant 200m away seems closed. Maybe only open in the season. (Restaurant IS Open in Season but They dont bother)

name: Revoil fuel station
description: Water available here.  No problem with access for large vehicles.

name: chapel of Liataniotisa
description:
Orthodox chapel at cave's park. Named toy Theotokos Maria as Liataniotisa
see some photos http://agiosthomas.50webs.com/pan_liat.htm

name: Sandy beach with kantina
description: Next to the beach, not crowded off season. Shadow from big trees. Theres showers and toilets next to the kantina. Good food there as well.

name: Parking place at the beach
description: Parking at beach bar. In the summer this place is probably packed. Off season the bar is closed which leaves plenty of room to park. Good place for swimming and snorkeling. Pets were allowed in autumn, not sure about summer though.

name: Beachside
description: Nice spot, very close to the sea. Place for several campers.

name: Sea  View.
description: Parking close to the beach, quiet place. Good for a dive. Showers on the beach.

name: Sandy Beach
description: Place on the beach. Enough place for campers. Cold shower on the beach.

name: Alepochori West Wall
description:
Parking space directly on a quiet street between climbingspot and river. A Fountain with drinking water can be found 
in the next village (Alepochori).

name: Enoymio
description: Fresh drinking water fountain at the end of the village

name: Be(ar)tween war & peace
description: Flat spot 9 minutes away from florina centre. Good street till the Spot. At the dead end of the road is a monastry with a tap and also a parking lot with a Picknick place but there are cameras too, so i decide to drive to This place. During the day i heard riffle shoots from a Military camp in the valley. Not much traffic so its quiet at night. Have seen bear steps near the monastry.

name: Lagada Splithari
description:
Nice and quiet place without internet. In December, the river has no water and sun from 14.30.

1min from the climbing spot

Drive Cearfully - the road is steep in the beginning

(Approach when you drive from Trypi in the direction of Kalamata:
Continue past the parking area for another 300m. On the left, there is an electric power pole and a steep downhill concrete road, which becomes a dirt road.)

name: revoil
description: Easy access to the water tap. Very helpful guy.

name: Messolonghi marina laundry scam
description: Dont do your laundry here. The machines work super slow if any and your caution/ borg is stolen. The marina is fake anyway. Work on boats is forbidden at all. By anyone: owners, personel, hired craftsman etc.

name: Beach place
description: You can park and sleep here just in front of the sea. Near from the road but very quiet. Clean beach

name: Sphinka
description: I've been in this neighborhood for almost 10 days waiting on my delayed boat to arrive with my motorcycle. This place plays good music, good drink, has good food. It's super low key and one of the favorite bars I've found in this neighborhood. Check it out

name: Boutique de batteries Vlahos Battery Line
description: Batteries shop in Patras. Manufacture, Repair, Replacement of all types of batteries, including AGM and GEL for campers. If they don’t have the good one, they can order it to the main company. Very helpful owner. A bit complicate to park in the area.

name: Andritsena
description: Fountain before entering the village of Andritsena

name: Asperi Beach
description: Nice place direct at the beach.The last 100m better 4x4.

name: Arabas Hostel
description:
Just a normal hostel. The only place where I found a "safe street parking " in the city..  because it's just outside of the center. It's around 15-20 min walk to center. 

Prices 2022:
Breakfast € 1.5 (basic) or € 3 (normal).

Dorm rooms around € 15 (fluctuates during the week and season).

Good WiFi

name: Olympia
description: Informal parking below the top parking near the museum.  We stayed a night without any trouble.   All sites a 5 minute walk away.

name: glyfa
description: A good place for services especially if you need to clean out your tanks.

name: Alonia Guesthouse
description:
Where the roads end the real Crete experience starts. The village is ideal for hiking.
They offer huts with 2-4 beds at app. 30€ per room. You also can eat at their restaurant for reasonable prices. The food is excellent.

They also seem to have an area for camping, but we did not inquire.

name: motoparking garage
description: nice motoparking inside a garage very safe and 5€ per night and in the next right it's the Nubian hostel where I stayed

name: Nubian hostel
description:
it's in the next right side of the parking have a hostel 
I payed 4 night with breakfast 54€
clean and comfortable beds

name: Campervan hotel
description:
campervan hotel near Patras ! with shower kitchen bed . in nice place
I found by Airbnb . 24€
safe parking around the yard !

name: Petrogaz
description: We had our German propane cylinder filled here.

name: Lake Trichonida
description: Fresh Water tap - I filled up my expedition trailer’s water tanks.

name: Atelier Rooms
description: Very clean rooms and private bathroom, well-equipped kitchen area, good location in the old town.  Frosso, the owner, is adorable.  There is a parking lot nearby (Fortezza parking) but only for cars.  Otherwise, for large vehicles, parking at the port or the marina.  Have paid 55 € / night for 1 bedroom and 3 people.

name: Corinth Canal high camp
description: You Enter from the main road “Loutrakiou” and take the smaller road into the pedestian bridge (great view over Corinth Canal), then you pass over just the ramp and on the otherside you hold left and take the dirt road up (only 4wd). The camp area has a flat platau, nice sunset view, but you can hear traffic noise from the main road, but by night fairly quiet. No people come here, and the dirt road is not a pass trough road.

name: Vrachati
description: Parking at a marina.  There is also parking further down the road.  There is a water tap which is still open in December. Unfortunately you are unable to drive up to it, but to fill canisters is no problem.  Plenty of restaurants across the road. We parked here on a Sunday night and it was very quiet, maybe summer is different.  Showers and toilets were closed in December.

name: Road Loutra to Kalogrie.
description: Dirtroad Loutra to Kalogria. Good road but because of a lot of water and big holes only for 4x4 with high clearance. Beautifull ride through forest en marshes. Big fun.

name: Praktiker
description: BIG store with all kinds of household things, like gas, tools and food.

name: village
description:
In the middle of the village next to a playground.  Very quiet.  Some dogs and cats but they didn't bother us.  Water available.
.

name: Brake Shop
description: Motorbike parts and gear. Theodosis specializes in brake parts, but also has fluid, oils, and some gear. He found me a chain and sprockets and a shop to change my fork seals. He is friendly and helpful, and a great resource for anything bike related in Greece. The shop is on a main street full of motorbike shops, (KTM, BMW, Triumph...)so you can find what you need nearby.

name: Small funny world
description: Nice, cheap hostel, 8-9 euro pr night with free breakfeast and a small rooftop and laidback atmosphere.

name: Camping Thines
description: A quiet campsite on the beach €17 a night when we were there. Facilities quite old but very clean. Village nearby with shops.

name: Athens
description: Easy Wash self laundry. Knew it from Patras. Free WiFi; 3 euro for a normal wash, 5 for a big one.

name: Athens
description: Large parking lot 10 minutes east, by e-bike (we’re Dutch :))from the Acropolis. No facilities, very busy during the day but quiet at night. Everything you might need within walking distance. Stayed here for 2 nts.

name: Mechanic Yamaha motorcycle
description: Friendly, competent mechanic. Speaks English quite well - certainly enough to understand what the problem with your car is. He changed four of our glowplugs for 90 Euro plus material cost.

name: Mitropoulos Land Rover
description: This is the best workshop you can go if you have problems with your Land Rover. Our Defender had a crack in the cylinderhead and we needed to fix it. We checked all the prices of the different workshops and here you will find the best price and best service. They care a lot about you and your vehicle.

name: Salamis Office
description:
When shipping a vehicle from Haifa to Greece with Rosenfeld shipping out of Haifa this is where you come to pick up your vehicle. The company here is Salamis the same company that owns the boat.

If you are wanting to go the other way from Greece to Israel contact the Salamis company at +30 21045 29555.

name: Camp Charakas Tower
description:
Nice big flat area for parking, suit bigger rigs. Good cover for East wind, perfect sunset view. Camp just next to old tower ruin. You need 4wd to get here. 
The only “minus” is the local trashed some buildings materials, but must is overgrown and you can park so you do not see it at all:)

name: Easywash Self Service Laundry
description: Very clean self serve laundromat with well maintained washers and dryers. Has a change machine, but it gives a mixture of tokens and euros. Open from 7 a.m. to midnight.

name: sibylla hotel
description:
the cheapest hotel in town but definitely great value for it. paid €26 euro for a single with ensuite. parking in front but it s a super quiet town so it s safe enough for one night. 
central heating system and ceiling fan.
nice host

name: Cosy apt
description:
little apartment in the outskirts of Patras but still walking distance to the city center and few blocks away from Lidl.
paid €22 a night in a one bedroom apt with everything you need in it. street parking but it s a quiet enough neighborhood. good for one, two nights.

name: Hotel Vasilis
description:
great little hotel, family run, just behind the castle hill. parking for 3 cars (not too big).
fast wifi and huge rooms with small kitchen in it. nice hosts. a bargain for €22. i had balcony with ocean and city view.

name: Hotel Aquarius
description:
Decent accommodations considering that it costs like a shared dorm in a hostel here, and it has breakfast included. 
Perfect location. Walking distance to the center.
Parking in the street.
Decent facilities. Not the best in town for sure but for the price, maybe the best deal.
€22 a night with breakfast

name: River Beach
description: During summer there is no much water in the river giving you a great opportunity of having a wild night under the stars. Great place for camping but you need to go on foot or with an off-road motorcycle because of the bad condition of the road.

name: Turning point to Lasithi plateau
description: do not follow gps here, since it may lead you to the road on the right which is shorter but steeper. take a left here at the T, and then the first road to the right which is concrete paved.  keep following direction to Katharon and bear the left. you ll end up in Lasithi plateau.

name: Elafonisi beach
description:
Probably one of the nicest "caribe style" beaches in Crete. Similar to Balos. I managed to camp here during lockdown but i believe even during low season could be possible. 
there are toilets but those were locked.
there are showers but not sure if water is drinkable

name: Cavern on the beach
description: This is a naturist beach with terrific water colour and a nice cavern on the east corner which you can pitch your tent in. There is a shower at the back of the little cafe for freshwater. The beach is tiny by could accommodate few people. I was there by myself. You can park right on the beach if you have a 4x4 or motorcycle.

name: Road from Palaiochora to Gialiskari
description: this dirtroad leads to the cute beach of Geliaskari. the sandy side has umbrellas and sunbeds but along the way you can potentially stop everywhere (if you can fit on the side of the road). on the pebbly side i ve seen people with tents. otherwise at the parking lot there are lots of spots you can hide. there are showers on the beach and toilets during the day when the cafe is open. it may get busy during weekends

name: Pita Grill
description:
kind of local pita and Gyros place. PORTIONS ARE MASSIVE and meat is good. clean and good service. tables outside. 
it s more like a takeaway place but from all that i ve tried, this was one of the best

name: Niriis Hotel/Apts/Hostel
description: Nice and recently renovated place right behind the Apostolis beaches. There are bunk beds rooms and single and double rooms. you can ask for George or Petros, two nice brothers that will surely go out of their way to accommodate you. reasonable prices. I stayed for 2 weeks and got a great deal. AC and kitchen available in each room. better than staying in chania city, as traffic and noise can get a bit annoying.

name: Paralia Vithouri
description: incredible cove surrounded by cliffs. 4km steep and narrow road to get down to the beach, doable with any 2wd vehicle but maybe not campers. some turns are too sharp for those. you can camp at the beach. strong 4g signal. no water but there is a tap.

name: To Rizoma Hotel/restaurant
description: nice hotel with amazing view of the valley at the back of Karpenissi. paid €35 with breakfast and had dinner here too. very traditional greek food, homemade. clean room, plenty of parking and very quiet. loved it.

name: Μακρυγιαλός
description: municipal parking with lots of camping area inside the parking. terrain is dirt with little gravel, all shaded by big trees. at least 30 tents when I visited,  with lots of more at the beach. a cantine and a restaurant at site. shower at the beach.

name: back of  mountain climbing shelter
description: It's a shelter for climbers open probably in the winter. on summer you can camp on the back of the building with great view! the road to here is bad 15 minutesof gravelan stones, off road vehicles or bikes only. windy , it's a summit ,but the view worth  it.

name: river party
description: used to be a place where parties were held. a lot of leveled places. a river next to the places. really nice and quiet.

name: Camping Stavros
description: really nice camping. wonderfull beach. 4th time.

name: To Xani Toy Souflia
description: The owner is driving an old BMW who made the Paris Dakar. Never get such a warm welcoming anywhere. If you are riding, go there. You have a river nearby where you can swim and the road in the mountain is great.

name: Hobby Shop
description: For motorcycle or bike, Managed by an enduro pilot, friendly people, great service, good road recommendations. They have tyres.

name: Taverna Apostolos
description: really nice restaurant with tables in the sand of the beach. so feet in the sand. watch the sun set. nice food. except for the pork souvlaki.

name: Pine trees by the municipal water supply tank.
description: Flat ground under trees. No facilities. (in the village center is a public well) Visible from the road, pump of the water tank is a bit noisy, a farmer who lives 200 meters away came by to tell me it's o.k. to camp here, but warned me that there might be snakes.

name: Near Mt. Olymp
description: nice place to stay in the Mountains and use it as rest point to hike up to Mt. Olymp and Saint Antoinius Refugium

name: To Steki Toy Menioy
description: Really good food in a nice peacefull reastaurant. Fresh souvlakis, which you do not see everywhere. nice little village. old looking. very cosy village with more tavernas.

name: Above the cliffs
description:
Small parkinglot near the the street to agios jerusalem beach, but quiet in the night. some shadow in the evening, beautiful sunset.
Nice place to sleep, if you don‘t want to stay at the beach.

name: Kanallaki
description: Workshop for boots and off-road vehicles, Achillas speaks English, is very helpful, can repair engines, boats, help Oberlandesgericht, flexing, welding, metal work, oil change, repair workshop nearby, excellent organizer,

name: On a meadow
description: Flat spots near the road but hidden from the road, bushes and trees. Next to a small river, but had no water in summer, quiet during the night

name: Abandoned military camp
description: You can spend a night or two in a quiet location nearby the main road. It is an abandoned military camp and has ample, flat surfaces even for bigger rigs. There are a few buildings you can take cover from the rain if need be.

name: Veternik
description: It's a flat area next to the main, dirt road to Grammos settlement. There's a nearby creek where you can shower or get some water.

name: Elatos
description: You can camp next to the water tap. Only for normal cars, and tents. 1 km dirt, compact road to the spot from Itamos settlemement. Inaccessible when there's snow.

name: Vrisi tou Kalogerou (Monk's spring)
description: An easily accessible spot if you'll find yourselves in Oiti national park. There's a potable water source down the dirt road.

name: Kamnaitiko
description: Only for cars. Next to Kamnaitiko creek where you can take a swim.

name: Kamnaitiko
description: Only for cars. Next to Kamnaitiko creek where you can take a swim.

name: Haliki
description: Easily accessible camp next to a creek and a mill building. There is a table and a shelter at the spot. Good for big rigs, tents and any type of vehicle.  Caution for big rigs if you want to come from the north—narrow paved road, no shoulder, vertical drop offs, infrequent wider places, no turnoffs, for first 1/2 of 10 km road, and the 10kms takes 1 hour or longer — a lot of people live up here.

name: Jeepers
description: Jeep mechanic. Dimitris  really knows Jeeps very well.

name: Pebble Bay with a good spirit
description:
Lovely but not remote, just 40m from the road is a lovely bay with enough room and shadow to stop by, go swimming or spend the night. It might sound strange but this place has some special kind of soul and made us feel very connected. Next to the beach, there are two very kind traditional taverns that were fine with us staying for the night.
Depending on the season, you might find fellow camper here. The locals use the spot to hunt at night. Some road noise possible.
Enjoy, please mind the locals and take more trash than you brought.

name: End of the peninsula, STUNNING!
description:
Easily the most beautiful camp we've had at the beach in 3 months.
It's the tip of the peninsula, with the sea on two sides. Sunrise and sunset at the beach without moving! Really great, and not litter (please keep it this way, or clean up some stuff if you see it)

4x4 with Low Range needed for the last 50m Very steep

name: Remote Chapel with view and soul
description:
A lovely place we found on the slopes of Oros Likodimo (940 m). Several flat spots around a little chapel that is rarely used but nicely made. The place is mildly remote, very silent (only sheep and interesting jackal sounds) and made us feel close to the sky. Since no one was there we even had dinner on the seating area right in front of the chapel.
Proper 3G, running water...

Access: No 4wd needed, some parts may need ground clearance but can be passed with a little track building in a normal car too. Height is not a propblem, width (>2,3 m) might be.

People: Absolutely no one was around during week in September. Since this is a chapel it might be busy on weekends but even then there is enough space that no one should be bothered. 

Note: There seems to be an military area around.

A place to enjoy

name: beach
description: beautiful secluded beach with cristal clear blue water. almost reminds of the carribean. accessible over a narrow path that leads down from the road towards 3 ancient towers. makes a bend rigjt and then leads down to the beach

name: Next to small abandoned monestry
description:
At the end of a dirt track leading to the monestry. 
Small 2WD can also come up. Too tight for bigger vans or RV.
Spectacular views!

name: Wash House Laundry Good Parking
description: Very Good Laundery New machines. Parking for big rig no problem.. Local restaurant next door.

name: Coast
description: Camping directly at the sea with the most beautiful sunsets! We stayed here two nights and it’s super quiet at night. There are two small and cute beaches and 3 restaurants nearby (but also far enough to not disturb each other), one with a nice wooden Bar next two the beach. Perfect for a sunset drink or just to use the toilet.

name: ETEKA Gas Filling Station
description: Filling Station for Autogas "Eteka" at the corner

name: Public Toilet next to church
description: An old public toilet next to a little charge. You can empty your toilet cassette over there. Only if you can carry your cassette 20 meters up the hill.

name: Next to the river / lake
description:
At the end of an abandoned road leading to the lake. Close to the river and lake, but no view here. 
Just a safe, hidden place to spend a night.
Around the lake it was quite windy, here completely out of the wind.

name: LAUNDRY - KOUTSOUNIS MICHALIS
description:
very nice and fairly priced laundry. cleaning service, NO self-washing. 
Paid 10€ for one huge bag included washing, drying, folding within very short time

name: Kilini Beach
description: Nice place to stay for some nights. Directly close by the water. Small restaurant.

name: Kouremenos Beach
description: Kouremenos bay, next to Palekasteo, is definitely the kind of windsurfing resorts in Crete and one of the most famous spots in Greece. A quiet place on the beach for 20 Camper or so.

name: next to a small beach
description:
Several parking spots next to a small beach. Couple of visitors end of afternoon on a Friday, after sunset nobody around. 
We're quite small and could park right next to the sea. Great spot for only 20min from the airport or ferry!

name: Limnes
description: 300 m off the coastal road along a gravel path there are a few locations where you can put a vehicle near the gravel road. It's 20 m away from the sea. The rocks are flat and smooth, ideal for spending the day. Opportunities for swimming and snorkeling. There are no facilities.

name: Ani Beach
description: Hidden beach (rocky, no sand) away from the crowds. Access via dirt road which winds partially steeply up and down. We saw a regular car there, I would not have gone without 4WD in low range.

name: Plantania Beach
description: Going south at the edge of town take a very sharp left. A good dirt road will lead you to a nice cove with a gorgeous view of Mount Athos. Full LTE coverage.

name: Place at the beach
description: Nice lonely and quite place direct near the beach.

name: Grammeno Camping
description: The best campground in south/west Crete in my opinion. It is located directly on the sandy beach it is open 365 days! The manager Chris is very helpful a quiet place to relaxe. Everything is available.

name: Likoporia
description:
Rocky beach under small trees. Nice view and hidden. Behind blue bar but very quiet.
Narrow and max 2.50m high rigs can make it. 
(NOT for white washing machines aka Campers!) 
Keep your tables and chairs inside!
Turn right in front of the bar, stay close next to the road 50m then left

name: Public Fountain
description: Public fountain with faucet and Gardena hock-up.

name: Apollontemple
description: Nice place to stay for a night. Parking of ancient Apollontemple. Very quiet and lonely. 1200m high. Beautiful view!

name: Mount Olymp View
description: Between Vergina and Dion on top of rolling sandy hills. Beautiful view of the Olymp. Access via small country dirt road (as long as not wet, no 4WD needed). Good LTE coverage.

name: Messinian Cleaners - Laundry in Kalamata
description: Friendly and English speaking staff. 10€ per load (washing & drying & folding).

name: Beyond Meteora
description: Perfect spot on a hill top just off the main road. Calm at night. Occasionally goat or cow herds may pass by. Split LTE coverage.

name: Marmari Kite beach spot
description:
Gravel road above nice beach with great views. Good for snorkeling, kite and windsurfing.
Leave your chairs and tables inside!
This is not a campsite!
Shower available. Fresh water at the fuel station
Do not use the Kite school, absolut rip off!

name: Beach, camp on gravel
description:
Keep chairs and tables inside your camper. This is not a campground! 
Isolated beach with showers
Either to be reached from north or south along the coast on tough gravel or from main road on smooth gravel road. Bit of a long track

name: Plumbers Merchant
description: Fantastic service. English speaking. We were able to fix our water storage system.

name: Public water tab
description: Public water tab with faucet to connect a hose.

name: Akrata Beach
description: At the end of the beach and town, flat parking straight onto beach. A sleepy taverna opposite. Quiet spot at end of beach. Water and shower.

name: Agios Dimitrios Beach Free Camp
description: Take the paved (senic) road from Achilio to Agios Dimitrios. At the end only 1 km. good maintained gravel road to this spot. Close to the beach. Park between the olive trees. No need for 4x4. Easy access for all rigs, although the leading two meter wide track seems a bit narrow and olive tree branches hanging too low for big rigs. Very quiet. We stayed for 5 nights. No amenities. Good place also to pitch a tent.

name: Tourlida
description: Out in the lagoon you will find a lovely spot to beach, swim, eat, and enjoy bird watching. Don’t miss the flamingos!

name: Public Water Tap
description: High pressure water fountain with possibility to connect water hose.

name: Bouka Beach
description: Nice place to stay (NOT in high season!). At night sometimes some teenager,s  but no problem.

name: Gialova Pier
description: Out of season only as officially there's no entry.  Unofficially, it's locals car park and used by fishermen. Small stone and brick pier next to sandy beach and close to the restaurants. Probably noisy in summer, but a very quiet night spent here in November. Poor Internet reception.

name: Car park above Beach
description: A gravel car park with views of the sea above a nice cove and the small Vromoneri beach. No facilities in winter, although there's water and a shower on the beach in summer. A bit of litter - why can't people clear up after themselves?

name: Chapel near Polilimnio Waterfalls
description: Isolated, quiet, flat ground next to a little used Chapel. On a hill but no view due to overgrown vegetation. Peaceful. Steep and challenging uphill path. 4x4 or solid, small vans only.

name: Ritsa Beach, Kardamili
description: Out of season only as quite near habitation.  A few parking spots amongst some trees directly on the pebble beach. No facilities.

name: Lockdown Camp 2020
description: We have been here now for almost 2 weeks and have been enjoying the beauty of the spot. Situated right next to a barrier lake the only guests we have had were small sheep herds and lovely guard dogs. Firewood is available in abundance. Good cell phone coverage.

name: Bouka Beach Water Fountain
description: Water tap with potable water which is also user for free-of-charge beach showers.

name: Auto Service Kostas Dimoulis
description:
Mechanic for all vehicles including trucks. Speaks good English.
Likes to meet overlanders.

name: VET Animal Clinic Kalamata
description: A very good and very friendly VET. English speaking

name: Beach Gialia
description: Nice spot to stay for a night or two. Very quiet. No sand!

name: The ancient fountain.
description:
Very nice place to rest with drinkable water.

MODERATOR NOTE: According to Google Street View, not suitable for big Rvs. 4WD SUVs, small cars, up to 4 or 5m should be fine. Bigger vehicles will need to park 100m before the fountain.

name: near the river
description: nice place to park or to stay in a tent. direct on the river. there is a spring 100 m away and an old bridge

name: drinking water
description: place with drinking water. direct on the street

name: Parabolic Acoustic Mirror
description: First world war memorial. An acoustic mirror build to hear incoming war airplanes

name: Bivouac shelter "Paralia Scourpiu"
description: Bivouac shelter next to the road with benches and fireplace.

name: Gravel road
description: 1 km from an old tower next to a gravel road, but no vehicles were seen overnight on the road. During the day one man with a motorbike passed by. In the wilderness. Beautiful view and quiet.

name: Filia
description:
Highly recommended selfservice laundry and meeting point for travelers hold by a very friendly german couple. They also speak english and french. Prices between 5-7 €, depending on the machine/dryer you use. You can drop off your laundry and pick it up when clean or hang out there while you do your laundry, have a snack or drink, use WiFi, charge your batteries or repair your car. 
Also available: hot shower, some vegan products, dog food, a freebox for 2nd hand items.
Currently better with prior appointment due to the lockdown.+306944657060

name: Roadside
description: Quiet place at the end of the road next to the ocean

name: Beach
description: lonely beach, accessible only through a steep offroad. if you want get all the way down 4x4 is recommended. but you can also stop earlier. there is a small sunroof and a small spring that comes out of the mountain. beach is beautiful with clear water. a lot of flat stones, some drift wood for fire. 5 stars but i can not rate with my app.

name: tiny bay
description:
tiny bay with some fishermens houses. some locals come to work during the day and leave in the evening again.

there is no mobile connection at the beach. you have to go 300 meters back the road to get 3g/4g. 

clean toilets available.

name: Fourni Beach
description: quite beach with very beautiful water. we were here offseason. On season this looks like an organized beach.

name: freshwater hose
description: on the parking place at the ancient 300 battle statue there is a freshwater hose where truckers fill their water tanks

name: Near lighthouse
description: quite place near lighthouse. enough flat ground. some benches to sit. amazing to witness how the water disappears and gets back again. a ton of mosquitos at night. two friendly dogs are lying around here. a black one and brown one. the water is very very flat, therefore not good for a swim.

name: Roadside
description: drinkable water directly at the road. its between beach/old railroad and the street. the gps coordinates may a little bit off

name: Hose
description: water with a hose in a tiny park in front of a yellow building. the hose color is blue

name: sand beach
description: quite and beautiful flat sand beach/place. very quite. some local people going for a walk or fishing. very good mobile connection. lots of lots of space. sandy, 4x4 recommended but not required. you habe hear sea from two sides, one side of both is aleays very calm, no waves, like a lake. lighthouse nearby that makes light in the night.very clear water. no shadow from trees or anything else.

name: tap water source
description: tap water source with fresh water. with parking space and beach

name: End of peninsula
description: Grass pitch at end of road on peninsula. You could fit multiple cars here. Road is not used often, big cars might get scratched by bushes. Other than that, the road is in good condition. Views are amazing. Good spot to stay for a couple of nights.

name: Sunset place
description: Almost flat campspot for multiple tents/cars. Road towards this place is quiet, we had no visitors. Road continues a bit further but has no important destination. Beautiful surroundings, if you are adventurous you could view a local hidden beach from above.

name: Bend of grassy "road"
description: We stayed on a pretty flat grassy area in the bend of a "road". The road does not lead anywhere, and does not have many visitors based on the grass growing on it ;-) You'll need a 4x4 or high clearance. The spot is pretty big, we stayed with a rooftop tent and separate tent. We felt really private on this spot, with great views of the surrounding mountains!

name: Near beach
description: If you follow the road from the beach to this spot, you will pass several campspots. The campspots are quite flat, and shaded from sunlight and wind by the trees. When we stayed here we were the only ones, but in summer we think this place might be used as a picnic or local camping area. The nearby beach is really pretty, beautiful to watch sunsets!

name: Paralia beach
description: a lot of space close to a beach bar. sandy ground, nice and flat beach with a lot of waves. trash as always but its okay. fishermen pass by, from time to time some teenangers with scooters at the beach. in the evening moskitos. there is a shower and tapwater available that you can use.

name: church beach
description: nice spot with clear sea, very soft sand beach and a small blue church nearby. some locals pass by from time to time. the only drawback is that after the sun goes down here is everything full with very tiny flys that also bite. very annoying

name: Anna Mikrobiologie
description: we did our pcr test here. we did it on saturday in the morning and it was ready in the evening. 50 euro per test. very friendly doctor. speaks english. her staff speaks also german. tel nr: +30 255 10 24 944

name: Beach camp
description:
Parking next to Nectar Paradise (not a lot of people off season, ask the owner if he is there; a very nice man).
Just in front of the beach.Very quiet and beautiful. Maybe lot of people during week-end or summer.
You can ask for a beach shower at Nectar paradise.

name: Nemea small forest
description: Really good spot if you are near to Nemea. Forest behind a soccer field. Easy access. 5min from town. Quiet night.

name: Pine Tree Free Camp
description: Half an acre of pine trees. Mostly shaded places. Easy access for all rigs, but entrance looks a bit low due to low hanging dead thin branches. Close to the road but hardly no traffic. Easy to find a spot and not to be seen from the main road. Also  perfect to pitch a tent. A bit of dog barking at our first night. Second night  there was nothing to hear.

name: Chapel
description: Small remote campsite to be reached only with 4x4 or enduro

name: Swim Center Thessaloniki
description:
big parking place, without fees.
good for oversized vehikels. at the small church you can get water.

we also got free Internet via officional Wifi Spot.

quiet place if you look to stay a bit in Thessaloni

name: Pangeo
description: A beautiful spot next to the tarmac road. There’s a small playground for kids and a kiosk (shelter).

name: Paralia Beach with Shower/Tap water
description: Shower and tap water right at the beach next to a beach bar

name: Kalogria Beach
description:
Nice place to rest for a day or two,
very quiet, for 1 oversized camper,
about 15m above the coast with fantastic view to the other arm (finger), especially at night.

Restaurant, bar and shower are down the hill on the bigger beach.

name: Agios Vasileios
description: The weather made us decide not to take the long gravel road spot nearby. So we ended up here. It's a kind of a heavily rundown town park with some spots to park. It's located in the outer skirts of the village and you have a bit of a view on the lake. Enough grass to pitch a tent and there is even a (leaking) water tap. We enjoyed a quiet and peaceful night. Easy access for all rigs. Free.

name: Perdikas
description: Spring with drinking water. Enough space to stop by the road.

name: Paralia Porto Koufo
description:
Beautiful entrance to the sea between 2 hills surrounding the beach and port of Porto Koufo.  A lagoon is on the left side as well.
At the time of our visit no other people were around and we took a rest for a day and night. Quiet enough beside the street to sleep well

some fish restaurants on the northside, great for a walk at night

name: Kivotos Free Camp
description: Pretty large area with oak tree / shrubbery not high enough to put your vehicle under, but perfect shade for tent, bike or chair. It is not that level, but with a little improvising you will find your spot. Hardly any traffic during the day and at night very quiet. At almost 700 m. alt. it can be a bit cool at night.

name: parking lot for navagio beach
description:
We slept here after watching the sunset. The place completely cleared out after 940, mind you it is covid times... but there are no signs and we were not disturbed. 
if you want to walk out to the cliffs to see the beach you need to arrive before 9am or after 6pm because there is a security guard now as there has been many deaths. it's really beautiful but be very careful and don't go near the edges... it's over a 100 meter drop.

name: Navagio beach viewpoint
description:
Beautiful view of Navagio beach from above. *There is no way down to the beach from here* you need to take a boat taxi or tour to go to the beach (it's about 10-20€ depending on which one you do and when) and leaves from the top of the island, which is about 30 mins away from here. 

***if you want to walk out to the cliffs to see the beach you need to arrive before 9am or after 6pm because there is a security guard now as there has been many deaths. it's really beautiful but BE VERY CAREFUL and don't go near the edges... the path is very uneven and it's over a 100 meter drop.*** I'd also recommend running shoes or boots.

name: Veloutsa
description: small spot along a rocky dirt track (4 km from the road) offering stunning view on the surrounding islands. Super quiet.

name: Paralia Phournon
description: Nice place for one night before or after the season, very quiet beach.

name: Laconia_hosting
description:
Moderator Note:  iOverlander does not usually accept Places that require advance booking such as Airbnb. However, the User does provide direct contact information. Hopefully, the next User will let us know if there are any problems.
.....
Excellent place to stay with a local family, with affordable price (check booking or Airbnb) 
You will feel like at home in the Greece countryside!!!

name: Red dirt cliffside ocean view
description: Large flat red dirt patch can easily fit up to 20 vehicles large and small. Small dirt track down to flat section on the edge of a cliff with amazing sunset views. If raining this site can quickly become muddy and 2wd may have an issue getting out. Beautoful quiet spot away from it all. We camped here in summer when everything else was completely busy this place was quiet.

name: Karamanli
description: Parking on the beach not far from village quiet at night. Shower on the beach

name: Avra's Taverna campspot free
description: nice restaurant with a view of the sea on the cliffs. the owner is very funny and nice. he lets you camp across the street on his land surrounded by olive trees if you support his restaurant. he is very generous letting us try different desserts and liqueurs. it's a nice place to stay and nice way to support the people on this island. the "ball pancakes" are delicious!!

name: motorbike Tireshop for Heidenau
description: you can get here for example the Heidenau K60 Tire for motorbikes

name: Sandy Beach
description: Fantastic spot with sandy beach and turtle nests. We stayed here for one night allone.

name:
Ethniki Odos Kalamatas Spartis
241 00 
Greece
description: onderful, quiet, flat place at a height of approx. 1200m. There is only nature here. The last few meters are a bit rough, but doable with a standard vehicle. A restaurant is located nearby, at the pass. 4G signal is available bur weak.

name: Pineta from Elea
description: We found this place behind the dunes by chance. Several Campers stay here, but there is so much space! Sometimes the police show up. A great place to stay for a few days. Turtle nests on the beach. Don't mess it up!

name: Koloumbos Beach
description: Parking near to Soulis Apartments. This dirtroad leads to the cute beach of Koulombos Beach. The best place for overnight stay.

name: Beach
description:
Between Athens and Corinth. Quiet and accessible beach. We spent two nights here. 10 meters from the water. Our 4x4 was able to travel into the small narrow streets. Great opportunity while waiting for our ferry.
.....
ENTRE ATHÈNES ET CORINTHE PLAGE IMPROBABLE ET CALME ACCESSIBLE VÉHICULE PAS TROP ENCOMBRANT 
NOUS Y AVONS PASSÉ 2 NUITS A 10 METRES DE L'EAU. 
NOTRE 4X4 AVEC CELLULE A PU SE FAUFILER DANS LES PETITES RUES ETROITES
super opportunité en attendant notre ferry à 1h par l'autoroute.

name: Kremmidi Bay
description: Nice place between Pines. Sandy beach. We stayed here for one night.

name: Near Mandra
description:
Small clearing in a pine wood along a track.
No one living around, and no traffic on the track.

name: Beach
description: A perfect place to spend even more than one night. Transparent sea sand beach. Public toilets and showers and running water! (the toilets and facilities are not useable, but there is still running water and outdoor cold showers - May 22).  Even trees to shelter from the summer sun. It can be easily accessed from the road (about 50 meters) by compacted dirt road. The place is not visible from the road.  There is a large rubbish Palladian and the possibility of emptying a toilet cassette in the unuseable loo.

name: Ionion Beach
description: Nice camp ground more high end. Including pool.

name: Lonely Bay off the main costroad
description:
Lots of space. lonely bay next to the main road.
Entrance road is a bit steep but possible by normal car
Clear cold seewater,  no fassilities 
We where alone..you can hear the road.
some little shade for one car

name: Ammousso secret beach
description: Beautiful little bay, just 700 m behind the tavern at Ammousso Beach. We stayed here one night at the small Parkinglot above.

name: North Corfu shore
description: Small & simple parking lot for 3 rigs at a Dead End Road. Stone beach.

name: Halikounas Beach South
description: Sandy area between the dunes, just for 4x4-rigs.

name: Greek Beach
description:
Sandy beach with space for all kind of rigs. Perfect sand. 
Quite at night time.

name: Public spring
description: Public spring with drinkable water. In a small place beside the road, next to a junction.

name: Margaritis  Laundromat
description: At the main square is a laundromat with service. You can take your own soap. One machine with 40°C = 4€. If you want it hotter, so the price will rise. The guy speaks German & English.

name: motorcycle workshop
description: a really good small motorcycle Workshop between kavala and xanthi. Really nice people and they speak english and they know what they are doing.

name: Hidden away in the forest
description: Wonderfull cool space in a forest. Very quiet. A chapel is on the mountaintop. Nice view from here. There are many beehives arround nesr a sink hole. A local came by and wished us a pleasant holiday and gave us a salat as a present. Take water with you. Fountains where all dry in July.

name: In the cool mountains
description: Somewhere in the mountains beside the gravel road. Peaceful and refreshing at night ( less then 20°C). No traffic at all. Sometimes 4G ....

name: Parking Voidokilia
description: World famoust beach. At the fare out South end of the parking area and a small track. We camped there and it was good and silent.

name: Autogas Thassos
description: Autogas Car Station, also has an adapter and fills German gas bottles

name: In the harbour
description: A small village and a little pier. No mosquitos, restaurants, a sandy beach and a shower. Very nice.

name: Skidra
description: Shelter near artificial lake. Suitable for one night camp.

name: 4x4-Beach North of Monemvasia
description: A lonely place at the sea side. A little palapa and nothing else. Only a strong wind and therefore no mosquitos  :)

name: Beside a dry river & coast line
description: Outside the village at the shore you can stay and you will have silent night.

name: Lonely beach
description:
Behind some lonely houses you will find a cape for a sunny campspot. No trees, just sunshine and silence. Sometimes few locals came along.
Restaurants are in walking distance.
The track to the beach is narrow, so maybe big rigs are to wide ...

name: Refugio Mt. Olymp
description: Easy access by a regular car, no 4x4 neccessary. Sometimes just rough. No mobil signal.

name: Beside Beloi Viewpoint
description: Just an overnight spot. It is leveled. Good signal service.

name: Koutsis tyre
description: a workshop who Can Do Balance for heavy truck rim sell Semperit Tyre

name: In the mountains
description: Plenty of fresh cold water from a fountain

name: Camping Mitikas
description: Great large camping area, secure by fencing and security, great for bikers

name: Covid Test Center
description: Here you can get a rapid covid test if you need it for the ferry.

name: Free spot in the hills
description: Quiet and relaxed, with a view on the hills. Water source nearby. Plenty of space for motorhomes.

name: Dirt parking spot next to sea turtle busting beach
description: Very close to the center of site is center

name: Papingo spot
description: Take the gravel road in the corner and at the end is the spot view to the city and the valley no 4wd needed but high clearance.

name: Royal Freshness.
description: Laundry the owners work for shop also and Can give Many informations about everythings rent also bicycle Vespa

name: Marmari
description: Between 2 Tamarix. A place to stay on the beach along a dead end road. No traffic during night. No service.

name: Bouros
description: On the beach a small area with shadow. Showers and water on the beach.

name: Kalianos beach
description:
on the beach large place to stay at the begining of the trail of Dimosari quiet when we  were it is a windy week
