show and drinking water , few people a Cantina on the road Bread and meat vegetable at the top of village

name: Nea Styra
description: a flat area on sera side without service 10 minutes walking to town

name: Deliso
description: 6. km N.W Nea Stary a little sand beach flat area no service

name: Aliveri 2km South
description: a little clean spot shadow a small beach under road no trafic on night others spots on 2 km along the road only local people

name: Kalianos Beach
description: a tape of drinking water on the beach near shower

name: Easywasch Repthymno
description: Easy Wash with free WiFi password. Park space in front of the salon.

name: Agios Nicolaos
description: At the front of small church there is fresh spring water.

name: Phily or Pili
description: Near the harbour many places on the beach with shower and tap of water just before harbour shops and restaurants in the village.

name: Pili or Phily
description:
Balkanian Taberna in the village. Homemade cooking.
Courgette, french frites, slouvaki  and others fried vegetables all very nice.

name: Patitiri Ferry Harbour
description: on the dock place to stay without service quiet on the night

name: Garakas
description: Little harbor, little beach, little Kantina but amazing 30 peoples max on the beach in same time, if you will be lucky you can see seal.

name: Yialia beach
description: a 50 meters beach and an Amazing wind Mill now rooms to rent clear water

name: Near a farm
description: After 3 km of gravel road near a farm a place above the Hill , Can see the sea, a Shelter with table, departure of trail,

name: By the beach
description:
Beautiful view on Thessaloniki in the distance. Busy during the day (summer), quiet at night. 

Free showers, no shade, almost no trash.
The road to get here is narrow (because of cars parked on both sides), so in high season it might be difficult for big rigs.

name: Hotel Olympion
description:
Hotel with buffet breakfast. unlimited food, not tasty but nutritious (eggs unlimited, cheese, coffee, olives, basic cheese etc etc)

comfy room, they let us park two bicycles inside no additional cost.

40€/night for two people, cheapest we found.

name: Riverside
description:
Moderator Note: The User has not stayed overnight in this location.
.....
Near the river on the way to the cave. Have not slept here honestly, but the picture will speak for itself, seems like a really good spot to camp, next to the wooden bridge, awesome view 

edit : only use in summertime I think, because river is low enough.

name: River and waterfall
description:
Nature, waterfall, quiet and forest.
There seems to have been many people camping here as there is a fireplace.

name: Nekromanteioy
description: Beautiful archeological site. different periods, 'very old' up to 'just a little bit old'. 2 to 3k years till 19th century. well restored and preserved. interesting. with nice guide.

name: Eretria, Dreams Island.
description: Near-island in front of the city. Large spacious flat empty open area sticking out into the sea. water almost all around. might be uncomfortable in bad weather. fits big rigs.

name: Beach side
description: Beach "ruimte zat" (space enough). Long beach or picnic area. Shade from pinus and tamarisk. Beautiful sea view. Next to a boat-dry store.

name: Archeological Museum of Thebe
description: Very good museum that shows all the archeological and historical periods of Greece from the point of view of Thebe. Modern, clear, visitor-friendly exhibition with, for instance, English texts and very good light. Worth a visit. from 8.30 till 15.30, 3€ a person.

name: Kastania Cave
description: Closed. Bizarre opening times (as usual, I should say).

name: Panagitsa beach
description: Beautiful, but incredibly dirty small beach with clouds of flies. The cave was closed. The road has many very sharp curves and amazing steep inclines and down again. There is an awkward step to the beach. if you drive a big rig or a big classical camper, you might not like it. but there is no other choice.

name: Kokkala, Mani
description: Small parking lot of a playfield. place for 2 cars. Please realize that this whole area is impossible for anything bigger than a small van or a jeep. Roads are in places incredible narrow, and in the villages the streets are strictly one-car-wide. Camping spots are very rare. and beautiful it is.

name: Lake view with spring
description: Wonderful of the lake. d any with tables and a spring. On the side of the road.

name: Velika / Agiokampos
description: on the beach large place,  10 m to the sea, shower at each side, shop and restaurants 300 m

name: camping Armatia
description:
really nice campsite with hot showers, shade under the trees, outside table to eat  and cook with light after dark

5€ pp

very friendly owner, gave us coffee and cookies when we expected to pay

overall for greece, the price/comfort ratio is really good, totally recommend

name: Small Beach for a Mini Tent
description: Private beach and bay, just big  enough to pitch a 1-person tent. Great view of Lefkada.

name: Kokkino Nero Beach
description:
Small village plenty of Polish on the beach with shadow of bigs
Platanus Orientalis near shops restaurants shower 100m on  the beach very quiet on night cleaned every morning

name: Great place on the beach
description:
take a right on the dirt road before the big parking lot. then left through some abandoned houses down to the beach. beautiful view, only few people on the beach.
very fast internet with cosmote (50mb/s)
only for small vans, 4x4 or at least ground clearance required. lower tire pressure on the sand!

name: No Mosquitos ,Beach
description: an area with dry Grass no Mosquitos in the night a large Sandy beach wild natural réserve no dog allowed

name: panorama hotel
description:
paid 26€ for room for two people

really cheap and overall really great, balcony... has a restaurant. comfy

very friendly owner

name: Litochoro Sport Complex
description:
Parking lot flat area in front of Olympus Mountain Information. There is
 a pipe for drinking water.

name: Moto Vasilis
description:
Little but we'll equipped garage and repair shop for motor bikes. Father and son work together. They are doing a great job and both are very friendly. 

Small prices, big hearts.

name: Easywash
description:
Self Service laundry. Open from 8:00 to 23:00
.
Lavandería self service abierta de 8:00 a 23:00

name: Ancient Bridge
description: A flat area between river and road with very little local traffic. Quiet and also birds on river in summer. Cotton field.

name: 16th Century Bridge
description: A small area. Good to stay. Sunny or shaded. 100m from the old bridge. Internet average on the new bridge of road.

name: Taverna Faros
description:
Spacious restaurant parking, with outdoor shower with hot water and electricity. Next to the sea with access to a rock beach.
Only available in low season. Not in June, July and August. Price: 5€
.....
Parking del restaurante espacioso, con ducha exterior con agua caliente y electricidad. Al lado del mar con acceso a una playa de rocas.

Sólo disponible en temporada baja. No en junio, julio y agosto.
Precio: 5€

name: Spiridoula Hotel
description:
very very friendly owners, really helpful and so nice. full of advices
20€/person, cheapest in the area

name: Elati
description: in a park near game field, flat with water

name: hotel egnatia
description:
comfy rooms
private guarded parking underground nearby
17,5€/pp 

friendly reception

name: Camping Ayannis
description: Very charming Campsite est. in 1966. Quiet atmosphere, stony beach with crystal clear water, hot shower, shady as well as sunny places for campers of different sizes. The village Kirra with a small market, bakery, pharmacy and 2 taverns on the seafront can be reached by a 15mins foot walk along the beach. Also a hiking trail to Delphi starts here. Check in and you will enjoy a calm and pleasant stay!

name: Olive Garden parking
description:
Road bar, for € 5 allows you to sleep in the parking lot under the olive trees.
If you consume something you do not have to pay.
Very close to the famous Voidokiliá beach

Bar de carretera, por 5€ te permite dormir en el parking bajo los olivos.
Si consumes algo no debes pagar.
Muy cerca de la famosa playa Voidokiliá

name: closed café with nice view and running toilets
description: the title says all, good view for camping, running water, toilets behind the building that had toilet paper when we went

name: Zervas auto
description: Helpful and good mechanics. Left my bus 1 month there for free. Antoni is a great guy

name: Quiet place hidden from road
description:
A steep dirt road just off the main road, we did it easy without 4x4. Follow down to the beach, and then hide the bus between the trees. Lots of trash but quiet and safe.

Seafood restaurant within walking distance (Fish Tavern)

name: Camping Sikia
description: Large camp site for families. Camping is directly next to the beach. Section D is a bit elevated and has great views. Good restaurant with nice atmosphere.

name: Wild Camp / private beach
description: Steep and rocky path, 4x4 needed, but not too far from the main road. Flat place for 2-3 cars nearly directly at a small beach. There’s a forever closed house, so property probably belongs to someone. Also some abandoned/rotten wood stuff lying around but all in all this beautiful place seems left many years ago.

name: Paradise
description: Lock your differential, deflate your tires, put in your crawl gear and you’ll find a paradise spot. Private 100m sand beach, no people, no houses, nothing. You can park at water level, where you’ll find a flat spot for 2 cars. Make sure your car and you will make it upwards again, the track is very rocky and steep. Before the last big turn, around 300-400m meters, I’ll recommend to stop and walk to the beach to check if your car and your shelf will make it. The track is very narrow, no turning points until your down at the spot. What a beauty!

name: Hills above the Sea
description: Off-road track to an abandoned farmstall in the hills above the sea. great view. Must have 4×4 to get there. track ends under an ancient monastery Ruin. Access the track from the road by the sea, turn right at icon club

name: Petrota Beach
description:
Parking next to Petrota beach. Very quiet out of season.
===
Parking al lado de la playa de Petrota. Muy tranquilo fuera de temporada.

name: Camp Nissos
description:
What a fantastic place - think of simple, informal beach life with really good, clean facilities and very relaxed vibe.
The taverna is now closed (September) but personally I’m glad as it’s very quiet and relaxed.
This site is only new this year (2021) and everything is brand new - showers/ toilets/ kitchens/ laundry etc. Spotlessly clean.
Informal parking around the site either under shade of the olive trees and plenty of areas right on sea. Plenty of shade also.
Cost - €15 per night for van and two people.
We’re now on our 2nd night but it may well drift into a week as think it may be hard to leave.
There’s a small market for food and supplies only two minute walk up into the village.
What a fantastic find….. I’m sure most people blast through here on way to the south but I’m really glad we didn’t.
Please visit but treat it with full respect.

name: Road between Vathytopos and Achladochori
description: this road is impassable at this point and at this time because of underwashed narrow road. only very small and light cars may drive through!

name: camping Tholo
description: super nice camping place. Nice and helpful owner. good clean facilities.

name: Along River
description: Access from main road an old agregate screening station flat no service, 1,2 ml South to old bridge

name: P. Theodosiu Ltd
description:
repaired our defunct Eberspächer Diesel Heating. Good service partner. 
Have lots of other Equipment for air condition as well

name: Open Plateau near Igoumenitsa
description:
a great open Plateau near Igomenitsa. great view over korfu. Access is narrow rocky ground might require 4×4. we came with an Unimog.
only about 100 m from the main road but very quiet and secret. no other campers here as Access is a little tricky.

name: Potable water tap
description: Roadside potable water tap.  Confirmed by local inhabitant to be potable water.

name: Impassable (dead end) and severely bad road
description: There is a sign in the roadside for one of the many ancient bridges. On Googlemaps it looks like its a throughroad but there is a dead end and no road on the other side. Bridge is  beautiful but the road parts steep down can be very muddy and have deep ruts so only serious 4x4 can go to the bridge. Is avery Nice place to sleep though.

name: City View
description:
Beautiful spot with great view over (part of) Thessaloniki and hills on the other side. As it's close to the city you can hear the traffic a bit. Perfect for tents, not much shade. Awesome sunset and sunrise. 
We stayed 1 night and only 1 car and 2 people passed by.
Note: Google says it's an offroad dirt track course, it was not used when we were here, but be careful not to pitch the tent on the track - just to be on the safe side.

name: Rapid Test
description:
BioAcuHealth
Rapid test for travelling, we used it for the ferry to Bari (no one asked to see/check the test)
15 Euros, result ready in 10 minutes
Fluent in English

Update: You don't get a QR code. There a pharmacy which does the test for 10 Euros WITH a QR code, which might be relevant for Italy, eating inside restaurants, etc
Pharmacy Panoraia Xarisi
Ag. Apostolon 45
Igoumenitsa 461 00

name: Mountain View Terrace
description: Quiet camp spot with a nice mountain and ocean view. A few kilometres up a decent gravel road. The camp is hidden out of view off the gravel road. Easy access for motorcycles or vehicle, big rig may need to park at the road. Other camp options near by as well. There is a water source coming from a pipe out of the mountain side 100 metres from the camp entrance. Nice clear water, but should be boiled or treated.

name: Village Coffee
description: Nice little coffee shop with some food options. Fast wifi and friendly staff.

name: Hotel Delfini
description: Ok hotel, close to ferry terminals. Wifi works good and seemed like the best option compared to other hotels in the direct area. Not a vacation spot by any stretch but good if you're catching a ferry. 40 Euro for a double. Street parking.

name: Local Restaurant
description:
I apologize as I am not too sure what the name of the restaurant is. There is no sign. It’s in the center of the three-way intersection and is pinkish brick with a beige banner.

We had a wonderful meal here. Two chicken souvlaki plates with fries, a Greek salad, plus olives and tzatziki, bread, and two soda waters for €14. The family is so nice, such a great local restaurant experience.

name: Arodamos Guesthouse
description:
This place is expensive but we didn’t have any luck finding tent camping - it was getting late and the weather was turning and it seemed to be the only place in the area 

The cost was 80€/night. We did negotiate the price down to 70€, and later found it on Airbnb for about $75€. I uploaded the Airbnb write up for a little more info. 

I can absolutely recommend this place though. It is an incredible drive though the mountains, passing through farmland and mountain villas. Very peaceful spot. Irini and Iannis are very warm and kind too. Her apple cake is amazing. 

The rooms are two stories and ideal for families. The one we were in slept 4, one double and two single beds, plus had a crib. It had a kitchen, hot showers and good wifi. It’s a very nice place. They don’t have smaller rooms which is why it is so expensive.

name: Makria Ammos
description: Quiet Beach to camp at in November. Some small shacks on the beach but no one around. Bathroom and water tap at the entrance. Might be busy in high season. Nice view along the shore, other than the island petrol station.

name: Pebble Beach Paradise
description: Nice pebble beach, great for a night or two. No facilities. Out of sight of any houses, down a steep gravel road, ok for motorcycle or 4x4. Campers and big rigs may have an issue.

name: Hotel Exari
description: Basic Hotel with restaurant, friendly owner. 40€ for a double room, includes breakfast. Fast wifi and hot showers. There are also a few other hotels on this street.

name: Fishing spot
description: Alternative spot to the other mentioned nearby (the church parking was busy and the town parking did not seem free anymore). Next to the street so not totally quiet. Just at the lake. In the morning fishermen use this spot so we left earlier than usual just not to bother them. They were not unfriendly though. Police passed by a few times but did not stop so we guess our stay was tolerated. Not a good place for big rigs (too little space) and not suitable for tents (rough concrete ground with some grooves)

name: Spot at a hairpin turn in the mountains
description: We just stopped to eat breakfast here in a nice scenery, but this could also be a spot to spend the night. I is next to the road, but it seems quiet (in one hour there was just one car passing). A shed with tables, garbage container. From what we could see there are small gravel roads nearby so there could be more camping options there. We saw some signs for "wildlife crossing" so there could be wild animals around.

name: Beach - Open WIFI
description: There is an open wifi connection here at the entrance to the beach. Parking along the roadside and a supermarket on the same corner if you need grocery items.

name: Makre wild camp
description:
small area next to the see, 
accessible for bikes and motorbike,
at the end of a gravel road

name: Picknic Place at the Sea
description:
It is a small Place at the Sea 5 min. walking into the smal town.
The place is just about 9x7 meters. And there will fitt one car. We came with a 11 ton Truck and it fitts. Police and locals drove by but no one baterd us.

name: Camping at the beach
description:
Nice spot on the sandy beach
There were been two offroad camper here

name: Parking by the sea
description: Parking close to the town of Korinth.In Town are Restrictions for 3,5t but you can drive around the town, depending on the direction you're heading. Free Parking

name: Laundry by Miele
description: There is the possibility to wash and dry your clothes.

name: Gythion Bay Camping
description: We preferred this campground over Mani Camping next door, although a little more expensive. We paid €22 for two people and a tent. They have a pool, an area for wifi. We liked this one better because they had a communal kitchen. They also have bathrooms and laundry.

name: Leonidas Statue
description: There is a water fountain right in front of the Leonidas Statue. If you are standing facing the statue is behind you on the right side of the street.

name: Forest Shelter
description: We are following the TET (Trans Euro Trail) through this beautiful area. We dodged off the trail looking for camp and found this gazebo in the trees. A great spot. No water source or facilities. The TET is a off-road trail for motorcycles but we’ve seen some farmers in small trucks along a lot of the route. If you come out this way, I recommend 4x4 only.

name: Vlahika Plateau
description: Some great off road moto riding here, we did see a camper van as well so it is possible on four wheels. There are tons of roads to choose from, some of them gravel, some of them can get quite muddy. Beautiful scenery, hiking trails, it’s peaceful, reminds us of home (BC, Canada), We saw a few water sources while riding but there is not one where we found camp here. There are many many camp options around here.

name: Hotel Enastron
description: Very nice hotel, and best deal in town. The rooms have a small kitchen and private bathroom. 45 euros for one night or 40 euros per night if staying longer. This includes a nice buffet breakfast.

name: Camping at the beach
description: Nice place at the beach. Little side road, free to camp. No traffic. Quite at night. At least in November.

name: Hotel Alma
description: Nice hotel, €40 for two people. We couldn’t find any options in Thermopylae so we came to the next place we could find a hotel on the map. Happy with what we found. Nice room with a sea view, bathroom with hot water, fridge. Wifi worked great in the evening, it was down in the morning but there was a storm so maybe that is why. Nice owner. There is a restaurant with breakfast but we didn’t eat there.

name: Camping at the beach
description: Camping at the beach. No sand, but realy nice. It is close to the cave, but you have to drive around. It is free, quite at night. Place for about 20 CamperS. Also big rigs fit.

name: Tripi
description:
Clean and tasty source water. 
note: There is no tap to connect the hose and the source is few stairs up the road.

name: Riverside Terrace
description: This is either a park or informal campsite, but no sign of use late in November. We had a quiet night, with a nice place to put our tent under a shelter.

name: Hotel Virginia
description: Best deal we could find last minute, in fact this is one of the only open hotels we found in the area. 55€ for two people and breakfast. Nice clean place and friendly owner.

name: Laundry (Large / Industrial)
description: Large industrial laundry service which mostly works for hotel, restaurants, hospitals etc. Very friendly English speaking owners.

name: kamapee
description: Diagonally opposite the pharmacy is a nice restaurant. There weren't many places to eat so we thought it would be helpful to know this place. Very friendly staff, basic but delicious food, hot and cold drinks. Wifi and nice toilets. Owner speaks English.

name: Taverna Camper Stop
description: Overnight parking at a restaurant bar. Electric available. Really friendly helpful owner speaks English. Great food, inexpensive prices. You really can't go wrong here, especially if you are planning to visit the nearby ruins.

name: Lucas Guesthouse
description: Guesthouse Lucas, a wonderful place with a very kind Belgian host. €50 for two people. Lucas has 3 rooms available. Hot showers, kitchen to use, and wifi. Gated parking for motorcycles. Really nice and clean place. Highly recommended.

name: Asopos River Gorge
description: Nice spot on the old road next to the washed out bridge. Perfectly quiet on a Friday night in December, except for the noise from the river.

name: EUROPA (Bosch Service)
description:
The manager speaks german, is very friendly and did a superb job, by changing our rear leaf springs and shock absorbers on our Merc Sprinter 4x4. Within a day they got the parts from Thessaloniki, which was 70 Km away and all the work was done in the later evening.
Costs were a bit high, but still less expensive than in our home country.

name: Lookout next Poseidon
description:
It is a very nice place to stay for one or More nights. But we only can do it for the low season! 
Here you have a great view to the sea and it’s not far away to walk to the temple of Poseidon. Four trees offer shade or a possibility for a clothes line. 
There are no facilities like water, energy, toilet. It is great if you take your waste away!

name: Kokkinogeia Beach Parking
description: Dirt parking lot at the southern most point of Peloponnese. I was here end of December and it was very quiet. Two other European campers came here and one or two locals visiting the archeological sites and ruins. No amenities, no cell reception.

name: Valtaki Beach Parking
description: Dirt Parking lot with a few campers during off season. Must be crowded during vacation season. There's a cold shower at the beach front and garbage bins. Nothing else. Very close to Dimitrios shipwreck!

name: Roadside
description: Nice wild camping spot with the magnificent sunset view. Next to the road, but there is possibility to drive 20m deeper, but there is not much traffic at night anyway, so I didn't bother.

name: Roadside
description:
Quiet area next to a road by the small closed church. Easy access for every rig.

Attention - strong winds, park parallel to the road, not orthogonal.

name: 1000 trees
description: Wild camping space next to 1000 trees park. You can go for a walk in the park where you will see age long oak trees!

name: Aegian gas refill&tools
description:
Gas station where they refiled my gas bottles, needed to have just an adapter from Greece bottles to German ones, I had it since forever.
Very friendly attendant, speaking good English.
I even got an adapter from. gas station format to greek one!
A lot of tools available the same building, tyre service opposite street in case if emergency need.

name: Hotel Trifilli
description: Great place stayed here for almost a month. The owner Susan is Swiss and speaks perfect German. She is extremely friendly and very knowledgeble. They offer a lot of different Rooms and the prices are very reasonable. They also have a big hidden away parking space, and I am sure it would be no problem putting the camper there over night after dinner or ask nicely for multiple days.

name: On abandoned road
description:
A few flat spaces on the abandoned road, great sea and sunrise views. Entry is from north only, south entrance is blocked.
Kind of dead end road, not too much space to turn around, but shall be doable for regular RVs. Caravans and trailers not recommended.

name: PROTOGEROS ‚parts warehouse‘
description:
Parts shop for all kinds of cars (European, American, asian - old and new). Quite a big warehouse. Parts that are not in stock can be ordered mostly within one day. The English-speaking staff is very knowledgeable and go out of their way to get you the parts. 
Went there with my VW T3 had everything I needed the next day.

name: spring on the end of a village
description: drinking water and a place to sit down at the end of a village

name: Athos invitation
description:
Here you can get the general invitation (permit) to visit mt. Athos.
2022 status: general invitations are not issued, only the specific ones from the monasteries. Before boarding the boat you need to come here and they make free-of-charge rapid test which you need in order to take the boat.

name: Water Well near Chapel
description: Water always running. When water along the beach is disconnected, go here. Don't know if it's potable, but looks very clear. Keep your big rig on de x-ing. Walk the 100 metres to the well.

name: The cheapest gas station in Greece
description:
It seems to be the cheapest gas station in Greece. Silk Oil, direction - driving from Athens.
In Feb'22 diesel is 1.39 while in all the country from 1.45 to 1.6.
Also LPG is cheaper than everywhere as well.
Filled full tank, drove it with no issues.
Also I got a free glass just as some kind of promotion, nice surprise.

name: Blue Water
description:
Just follow the coordinates. The road is good, but not made for Big rigs. Space for maybe 6 Vans. beautiful sundown, big waves. fantastic spot. Stayed 2 nights.
Pick some trash if you leave!

name: Behind the dunes near Glyfada beach bar
description: Large sandy flat area with a few trees for shade of smaller vehicles behind the dunes just meters from the beach and the ship wreck Dimitrios. Photo taken from the road above.

name: artemida
description:
Nice place on the beach next to à old chappel.
You can stay here à lot of time and eat to the trolley cafe... The guys is Very Nice, he was an traveller and if you need, he help you.. His name is giannis.

name: Free parking
description: A very big, free parking area just 2,5 km from city center. It's accessible 24/7 and you can spend the night here. A supermarket can be found nearby (1,2 km away). The spot is adjacent to the local bus station.

name: Spring
description: Small spring next to a church. Water is clean and tasty, take as much as you want :)

name: moutain fountain
description: Good drinking water on a small village, easy access

name: Public Swimming
description: Here you stay for one or two nights. Had been here late; was already closed.

name: Near the church.
description: place to stay the night with tent or van. Only 4x4.

name: Happy Chalci
description: really nice place, beautiful view, sea, sand and sun! 2 nights here, quite, it's ok to do a fire (we did it!), garbage just in front of the posseidon Hotel.

name: Xerolakas park
description: Park next to a tarmic mountain road with picnic tables. Near the river. Perfect spot for a night.

name: place for tends or vans
description: place for tends or vans near a  beach on the end of a gravelroad.

name: Roman Aqueduct
description:
Some parts of an old roman aqueduct.

No camping place! There is a warning sign only in greek language. The fine is 300€

name: Trinkwater near aqueduct
description: drinking water fountain near roman aqueduct.

name: sleeping near roman aqueduct
description: There is a hidden place near the road on the right side. Some trash and old tires. Place enough for 3 vans and 5 tents.

name: Near a stream across a cliff
description: Flat ground near a stream. You have multiple options to stay that are level. We were well protected from the wind. The gravel road that leads by it is a dead end. We were here in April, no people or cars around. Just some remains from cattle.

name: beach
description:
Spot for 3-4 campers. very quiet with no dogs at night. (unofficial?) nudist beach.
---
Spot für 3-4 camper. sehr ruhig, ohne Hunde in der Nacht. (inoffizieller?) FKK Strand.

name: Diesel engine
description:
Excellent garage for large diesel vehicles.

hervorragende Werkstatt für große Dieselfahrzeuge.

name: 4x4 camp on Beach
description: Clean beach, not crowded in this time of the year. Lots of camp spots

name: Great Camp by the River
description: Great Camp by the river. Accessible by 2wd.  Alternatively camp at the refuge up the road for 5 Euros (Has showers and restaurant) or stay in 11 Euro dorm.

name: Camp with View
description: Camp with a great view into the Gorge.  2wd, van and motorbike suitable. Hiking trail E6 starts here to be narrow and steep.

name: Analipsi Beach
description: You can camp on the Southern end with a small tent (ask the owner of the Tavern) or with a camper on the Northern end (lots of toilet paper in the bushes). Fresh water shower on the beach. Rocky beach but wonderful water.

name: Near the Ancient Tomb
description:
Followed signs from the road labeled 'ancient tomb'. The tomb is kinda cool and also there's a tucked away section hidden from both the path and the road that was good for a night of tent camping. Best for access by foot or bicycle. 

Follow signs for ancient tomb. Looking at the tomb from the path, nice spot is just on the right.

No water but there was a public fountain in Sofiko, nearby.

name: Field of flowers
description: Gravel road close to a regular street. Very quite and fantastic view over a vast grasland (beautiful in spring). A big hill gives good privacy and wind protection. Watch out for shepherds and the herds of sheep. The dogs are quite serious about their daily business and don't like cars and dogs (if you bring yours). We didn’t meet any dogs at this particular spot but several on our way here.

name: Saloniki
description: Wild camping spot on hill side. Plenty of space for vehicles. Hard packed surface as well as concrete base that you could put a free standing tent on.

name: Truck Washing
description: Shell station. After a long looking for a washing place in the area we found this. Some of the petrol stations which are able to wash a truck, too, were very unfriendly. This is a good place to wash a truck. The people are very nice and they did a good job.

name: Agitis gorge parking
description: It is a very spacious and easily accessible by tarmac road, free parking spot. It is open 24/7, and you can visit the nearby gorge and Alistrati cave.

name: Ionian Blue Restaurant
description: Free campsite next to a good restaurant and beach. Bathrooms, outside cold showers. 50 minutes from Patras port. Perfect for Motorcycle campers. Really nice owners. 5k to nearest village so bring some supplies.

name: D. ARTAS-WIFI4EU
description:
SSID: D. ARTAS-WIFI4EU
You have to click to "register to login'. a webpage opens, there is a login button.
No password needed

name: D.ARTAS
description: Just open wifi, no registration. no password needed.

name: Hotel_Poseidon
description: Free Wifi. Even on the beach. Maybe slow in tourist season.

name: Tower at Mesimvria
description: Small site next to ancient tower ruin looking over the see. Room for one or two 4x4 vans. Not completely sure if it is legal but we stayed here for beautiful night in april 2022. Need a 4 wheel drive car to get there. Also not a flat surface but we managed to manoeuvre into a somewhat flat spot. Amazing views!

name: Water tap next to small chapel
description:
At the end of a steep and windy gravel road there is a small chapel with a Water tap. It's ok for small vans and 4x4s. I would not want to dive this road with a long wheelbase sprinter. 
On the way to the chapel there a plenty of places to sleep next to the road, at the chapel it should also be possible to stay the night.

name: Tap and shower at the beach
description: Tap at the beach also nice place to sleep

name: Shell petrol station
description: There are several taps in the parking lot of the Shell petrol station. One of them even has a hose adapter (Gardena).

name: Star Hotel
description: very quiet and private little hotel right on the water, good for motorcycle tourers. Very reasonable, good food, nice people! highly recommend!

name: Simos Cave
description:
the cave gave birth to the island! It is worth the short but strenuous climb (15 to 20 minutes by footpath) to 85 meters to explore the cave and enjoy the view over the Bay of Sarakiniko (Simos).
Text from:
https://www.exploring-greece.gr/en/show/39776/:ttd/SPILIA-SE-SIMO
Tip: Take good shoes.

name: Kottane wild camping spot
description: Kottane is a mostly abandoned town at the end of a dirt road, there’s only a caretaker in the mosque. The patch of grass is at the end of the road just before entering in the town of perfect for one night wild camping with a great view and the sound of the river.

name: churchs garden
description: A really quiet and beautiful place in front of a small city with a good market and really friendly people

name: up in the Mountains
description: Quiet and Beautiful place in the Mountains for Motorcycles or a 4x4 vehicle

name: Riverside
description:
A big meadow beside the River. 

I was there with a Motorcycle but is no problem with a 4X4 to come down here.

name: Hidden cove
description: Stunning place to park up and then camp and swim, further up the track is a suitable place to pitch a tent. Track a bit dodgy in places but otherwise good.

name: Greek Customs
description: We were able to extend our Canadian motorcycle permits here. Took one day for paperwork. No cost, first six months in Greece are free.

name: Limenas Kalos
description:
Big grassy field with some trees for shade and a pebble beach. It’s along a small unpaved coastal road and therefore extremely quiet. Road from/to the south is fine for 2wd up until this bay, but road from/to the north is very rocky and 4wd only. 
Beach tavern 2km south.

name: Mylokopi
description: Beautiful secluded little bay with several nice spots to camp in the shade of the trees. More spots in the sun in the next bay around the corner. Loads of wildflowers in spring. Most of the beach is actually hardened rock slabs, some gravel. No other campers when we visited but judging by the amount of wet wipes in the bushes, weekends might be busier. Beware, it’s a steep-ish gravel road and as the warning signs say: 4x4 only.

name: Camping Porto Algeranos
description: A large site on the beach with many trees and plenty of shade.  At first glance it seems deserted, but it is open.  We liked it very much, because it is so quiet.  It is very peaceful and quiet.  All amenities are there, just very old, but it works and it's clean.  A shower building with hot water and toilets without toilet seats and a shower building with only cold water and squat toilets.  Good and fast internet.

name: Shower by the beach plus faucet for feet.
description: I’m sure you could refill water bottles, canisters etc. Easy to overlook!

name: Water fountain
description: In a narrow road in the center of Pyrgi.

name: Water Fountain
description: In the center of the town, near the church.

name: water fontain
description: Potable  water fontain next to the small chapel at the side of the road

name: ferry Rio-Antirrio
description: here you can take the ferry to Antorrio. This safes you a few euro, because the bridge is 21 euro (higher then 2m) and the ferry is 6,50. So if you have no hurry. The ferry is a nicer and cheaper option then the bridge.

name: 360° view on sea and mountain
description:
Large field close to the road, but in May there is almost no traffic at all.
The view is amazing, extremely easy to access, and almost flat. Perfect for watching sunset! 
There are hives close to the road, and the bees are curious, but not agressive.

name: Lakeside
description: Quiet place right by the water, with cold shower and drinkable water. We stayed three nights, some fishermen and friendly locals during the day.

name: Dolphin Camp
description: Great camp, left naturally, private owner with his dog and cats :) … lovely place, some minutes from the beach, charged 16€ for our car with rooftent and two adults. Has hot water, toilette, shower, free wifi, flat surfaces to park.

name: Easywash
description: Self Service Laundry in the city so not easy to find parking. Very profesional and clean 3€ per load

name: Shell / Continental station
description: We had a punctured tire. The English speaking mechanic helped us out in no time. Friendly guy, affordable price. Also gave us some hiking tips.

name: Hotel Oscar
description:
This Hotel is perfect for a night or two. Very close to the port. 24h Check-In, perfect when you arrive/leave the port late.

Friendly staff, speaks English well. Price for a double room around 50Eur. Good Wifi, A/C, TV

You can park motorbikes inside!

name: Elea wild camping area on the beach
description:
huge ( several kilometers) wild camping area on the beach, locals like to spend summer holiday here. During off season very good free option for camping.
Shadow options under trees.

name: By the Sea Chapel
description: Small Chapel almost on the beach. Another great free wild camp on the way to the border. Quite place with water from the church and toilets. There is also a plug for power but you need to request permission to use. The road down is a bit tight so not easy for big rigs. 4x4 not necessary so even for vans is fine. We asked a local and he said that we were more than wellcome to stay.

name: Fern Forest
description: Small field next to an unpaved dead-end track into the forest. Extremely quiet. The track is only 500m from the paved road, but a bit washed out currently so better have a look before you drive in. Some branches so probably not great for big rigs. No visitors except for a friendly dog.

name: Aspropotamos
description: Very lovely little rest spot, right next to a road that's hardly used. A lot of covered tables and a flowing river.

name: Beach Thesis Timari
description: Very nice sandy beach. You can overnight on concrete surface on the edge of the beach. There is a lagoon where you can spot flamingo's. In this periode the taverna/kantina is open during the weekend. There are a couple of friendly doos. Sometimes they walk with you on the beach. Very quiet during night.

name: lost campground
description:
old campground, was closed 2015 so no service etc. 
but we ask the next Restaurant if it's ok to stay and was noch Problem. had a nice evening in the Restaurant NAOMIAHE. was ok to use the Toilette till there was open. nice spot close to the lake

name: Gialova Beach
description: Sandy offroad right next to the beach. Only to reach by 4x4. Plenty of space aside this sandy path. There are a few places where you can enter the sandy path with 4x4…. At gps-points: (36.95658, 21.67357), (36.95687, 21.67492), (36.95721, 21,67758). One side bushes, other side beach. Not much shade. Very quiet, peaceful. No rubbish. Please keep it that way.

name: Camping Village Dionysus
description: Very chilled spot close to Corfu town - we arrived on a crazy early ferry from Italy and headed straight here, owner (prearranged) allowed us enter and set up, billing only €20 for the Landy and 2 of us in a RTT.   Good, clean ablutions, level sites on grass.  Power and water at each site.

name: River camp
description: Perfekt camp spot at a riverbank. Lots of level spots, accessible with any vehicle. You can have a dip at the point where the crystal clear water meets the main river. Full reception with Vodafone

name: E6 - Katara Pass
description: It is a nice trip from Igouminutsa to Kalambaka (E6) via the Katara pass. But the road is like a little adventure.

name: Worksbike
description: Dimitritus is a great bike mechanic. It's a well organized shop full of Yamahas and KTMs but he'll work on anything. The people are great. This is right in the middle of a mechanic district to the city so whatever you need is very close. When covid came I had to abandon my trip and leave the bike. After two years of rain and sea breeze he quickly and easily brought that motorcycle back from the dead.  +30 210 92 10 933

name: Top of the hill
description: Was a very nice place, but run down now. Perfect for a camping car or van. A bit steep to get up there but very calm place. Free.

name: Turtle Creek Canyon
description: This was an unexpected and lovely stay for us. A local picnic site, with benches, picnic table, volleyball net and spring beside a small creek. Lots of shade too. We were here on a Friday night and didn’t see anyone. It’s quite clean too. Tons of turtles (we spotted 3 species) and bird life. There is a small canyon behind the spot that is fun to explore as well. We saw a family of owls chilling in the rocks.

name: Quiet place in the woods with water
description: very quiet place in the forest with a drinkable water source (end of June so I guess there is water all the summer). space for tents under the trees, you can also sleep in the little hut. I didn't see anyone, weak 4g but works

name: Mega Orange Beach
description: This spot is accessed via a different road than the Orange Beach. It is located between Orange Beach and Mega Orange Beach. High Clearance is required but should be okay without 4x4, road is a bit rough. Midweek in June there was only one other camper while we were here. Two beach bars on either side of the camp give it more of a resort feel, but very picturesque (and free). Beaches are busy in the day, but die out with the sun. This spot was much quieter than Orange Beach. Lots of shade, and yes, of course, garbage. No fires allowed. Great snorkelling! View of Mount Athos from the point.

name: Kyra Despina
description: Great choice for traditional greek food. Fresh fish in good prices as well. Really great service

name: Camping near the mountain road
description: I stayed with my tent together with a German couple travelling by van next to a small dirt road. There is a river nearby and nice flat grass to pitch a tent. Place visible from the road but only a few cars passed by in the evening, quiet at night,

name: pretty cove by the sea
description:
Small cove accessible by 4x4, by the sea. No services
Avoid in high season.Petite crique accessible en 4x4, au bord de mer. Pas de services
A éviter en pleine saison.

name: Paralia Trachili
description: It needs a bit of an effort to get down to this beach but it was worth it. High clearance will help but there is no need for 4x4. No facilities other just your own private beach

name: Small Church
description: We arrived late with the boat and we ended up here on our quest to find a place to camp. The little church looks like it is partly used. You can park and camp next to it. Nice view and next to some water source. Quite night. In the morning a local passed by and asure us that it was absolute fine to sleep here.

name: Agios Kirikos square
description: Main hub on the island if you need supplies, banks or ferry tickets. This spot is actually the main square but everything is around here.

name: Laundromat
description: Coin operated laundromat in the town. Convenient and comes with free wifi

name: Dionisos Cave Beach
description: Also mention on maps as Iero beach. Pass the airport and down a dirt track doable with any vehicle you get to this beach. It has great wind protection but no other facilities. There was another semi permanent caravan here. We ask and they said that camping is not a problem. Locals use the beach and visit the cave during daytime . Quite at night.

name: MaMu
description: Great option for real traditional food in Raxes. Highlight of the island and the visit here. You get to listen to the local live band!!!

name: Raxes Church
description: This forest church is just out of Raxes. It is a dead-end dirt road. We asked the owner of the house near by if we can spend the night next to the small chapel and he said yes. Some noise from the road in daytime hours. There was a tap in the church but no drinking water.

name: Free Inn Zagori
description: Free Inn Zagori is a guesthouse run by Akis - an outdoor enthusiast and a true mountain man.  You can either stay in a room or camp on the lawn in front of the house. The place is located in the middle of nowhere and it's surrounded by beautiful mountains - simply a perfect place to stop when exploring the Northern Pindus.

name: Karavostamo Parking
description: Public parking under the shade of maple trees. We did spend the night here and it was fine but we can not recommend it as it might have been an one off situation. Worth to have a look!!

name: Konitsa.
description: Public water tap (with spire to connect a hose).

name: Glyfa
description: A small port where you can take the ferry for main Evoia and for the islands Skopelos, Skiathos and Alonisos. We took the ferry for Evoia and we paid for one campervan and two people: 30 euro.

name: Zozas
description: what a cool place! 30euro for a nice room with a balcony and air conditioning. walkable to restaurants. unique decorations. this place is what I love about Greece

name: Aegean Acres
description:
On this road up the mountain there are several sections of disused switchbacks. We chose this one, but there are many others like it. This one is mine. 
4wd recommended. Great cell signal and great view. Nice and cool escape from the heat. 
Photos show what the entrance from the paved road looks like.

name: Pydna beach (free showers)
description:
That is a simple beach where you can sleep and waste some time, very few trees.
Aside from the beach who have some mud baths where you can put it all over your body and then walk the 100m to the sea to clean yourself 😁.
No wc!

name: camping forest
description: Very nice forest for pitching tents. Officially not allowed at this place but everyone does it and the owner of the nearby beach place seems to like the guests. There are a lot of flat spaces to pun up a tent. I have seen some people park their car at the edge but I think they mostly park it at the nearby parking space and take their stuff into the forest.

name: cactus beach bar
description: Just a place where to sleep in front of the sea, there is a restaurant at 100 metres , cold shower on the beach but I don't know if there will be water during the night

name: Moto Storm
description: Great mechanic for motorcycles. Really helpful they fixed my broken wheel. They have tires.

name: Church parking
description:
On the road to mountain parnass, situated on your right while climbing, there is a little church at something like 50 metres from the main road. Campers and Van can easily get in but big rigs would find it difficult.
When you arrive at the church, there is plenty of place (Square of 15 metres on 15 metres) to make your U-turn to be ready for departure. You are safe from the road and will have the sensation to be lost in mountain. What a wonderful place!
Space for a group of 4 vans if you know each otherwise alone would be perfect!

name: acro Korinthos parking
description:
Hi everyone
This spot could be a very good one but Gasps are all around (but not aggressive!) and Greek people are comming until very late (2h00 in the morning).
If you really wish to sleep, please go to the end of the restaurant parking then you will be a little bit more quiet.
Look at the photo, the ones with the vehicles are not where you should be to sleep but a nape is ok
Otherwise avoid it to sleep! But the ruins are marvelous

name: Camping at the beach
description: Good secluded camping space, right on or above the beach. Even in high season very few day visitors. The acces road is very bad, definitely need 4x4, but if you have a small car like we do, you can leave it next to the main road.

name: Iti Mountain Shelter
description: After visiting the famous "monks spring" and just before you summit of Iti, we found this shelter for the night. You can drive wright up the hut that is mostly for trekkers(was locked). Stunning views to the valley bellow, phone signal and wind protection . There is a rim for fire but only for the outside fire ban period.

name: Mountain shelter
description: One more great location for overnight in the mountain of Iti. Small river is going through it. Basic facilities in the shelter when is open.

name: parking with fountain
description:
Simple and easy access to that rest parking where big rigs can go. 
It is separate from the main road by a simple little wall. 
Main road is quiet at night, no one came to disturb us. 
4g coverage. 
Clean if you don't look to far 😏. 

Fountain is constantly flowing without the possibility of putting a hose

Trees are too small to give good shadow.. But they will grow up 😉

For a night that is OK (tents should be secured with the trees)

name: LKW-Werkstatt
description: Great truck service-friendly, professional quality and cheap.

name: Fokiano
description: Beautiful place to stay with crystal clear water. Very quite at night.

name: Place in the Nestos Delta
description:
Nice place directly at the water.
Absolutely quite

name: Livorno Taverna
description:
Nice area next to River opposite Taverna on a very quiet road. Water available with a few benches and seats. Area is flat and pretty.
WI-FI available in Taverna which is very friendly. Entrance gate is narrow so not sure if a big rig would fit but I am sure you could park in the Taverna car park opposite if you asked the owner.

name: Kalidromo Lake
description: This lake has water only in the winter but that does not stop it from being a great camp spot year round. There are picnic tables and some shelters for the wind. No other facilities and no phone signal.

name: Xani Megdova
description: Just before the iron bridge this traditional Xani serves good food and specializes in meats and trout. You can have a nice swim in the river as well.

name: Zirou Lakeside
description: A beautiful lake a bit outside Arta. Access by vehicle it is only possible from one side of the lake. Here you can rent canoe and also spend the night. No "No camping" signs but try not to spread out to much as a lot of day trippers also use the place. There is a tavern further down.

name: Manzios Sweat shop
description: Best Ice cream in Ioannina. Also has a variety of other traditional deserts. Not to be missed.

name: Axerondas springs
description: Camped right next to the shore of the river. In this place you can spend a night or two with a bit more privacy than the other side where a large parking is used by caravans as a camp spot. The river is always running and it is freezing cold. Beautiful walks all around. A bit noisy in the morning with the rafting operators and their clientes.

name: great place inside the dunes
description:
Wonderful place inside the dunes. Only a few locals and some fishermen.

4x4 not bad...

name: Nikopoli bay
description: Further down than Monolithos ,this is a bit more quiet and private spot for the night. Between the road and the beach this place has no facilities but is ideal for an overnight by the sea. No "No camping site"

name: flat place near by a dead end road.. alone!
description:
A flat area where max 2 vans or 2 big rigs(max) can stay.
You are safe from the road, nobody can see you.
There are only the cows and their bells!

2 dogs went by, barking at us.. But they are just doing there jobs, they've seen that their was no problem and just went back to the cows😜
4g full coverage
Btw, if you drive 200-300 metres more you will find another flat area where no one can see you!

name: Beach in Front
description: Nice place to stay direct at the Beach lokal people camp and fish here small beach bar with toilets. Showers on the beach and water source for me a wonderful place to stay

name: Wildcamp
description: Nice place with water and a great view. Next to a (quiet) road, but we only saw one car.

name: Garage Kravariotis Truck & Bus & Overlander Service,
description:
Best mechanics for trucks and busses (no "small" automobile, only more than around 3t) in Patras.
Very friendly and helpful, get lot of spare parts quickely.
Are honest in whats to do and whats not necessary at the moment.
Understand english and spend coffee :)

name: View of Mt. Olympus
description:
Disused switchbacks up to an old Granite quarry. nice flat spots at the top looking right at Mt. Olympus. Good cell signal. 
4x4 and ground clearance recommended. The rain ruts you need to straddle and sometimes cross only get deeper as you ascend. There are lots of lower pull offs and spots to camp in the corners of most switchbacks. 
If you can make it to the top it's worth the view!

name: Oasis Parking restaurant
description:
Very nice flat parking area that offers camping services for only 3 euros. The deal is you have to eat at the Taverna to then be able to use the toilets, showers. Super friendly Family owned Restaurant. Owner speaks very good English. Grey water can also be dumped and there is a small kitchen area .  Washing machine also available.
This is a great find as any type of camping is quite sparse in this area. 
There is wild camping around but that comes with the risk of a big fine if the Police come.

name: Riverside
description: Large car park with campers, grassy area for tents next to river and bins for waste, about 10 campers here currently in high season.

name: Public Parking
description: A free area where you can leave your vehicle while exploring Pilos.

name: Field
description: Beautiful and calm place to camp, with a big field and great view to the town below. With a small tent, it's not really seen by cars passing on the street, that is about 50 meters away.

name: Hotel Isidora
description:
Looks a bit run down but it has been refurbished recently. Rooms are decent and clean. Airco. 
Very friendly staff. 
Taverna nextdoor.

name: shell patrol station
description: fast fill of a german propane bottle,they have an adaptor.great

name: Acheloos wild camp
description: A wonderful wild camp site at Acheloos river bank. Very easily accessible by a short dirt road. Depending on the season you can camp literally in the river bank, and enjoy a swim in the river.

name: Boza tavern.
description: The tavern allows campers in the olive field right next to it. The actual beach has. "No camping" sign but if you get a snack or a coffee from the tavern you can use the campground. Facilities available: in the tavern wc ,and shower on the beach.

name: mouson street
description: street alon a small beachi stayed sveral days waiting for my flight perfect

name: Picnic area
description: Great location about 500m past the little village, had a very peaceful night, a few locals came and walked dog and a shepherd with his flock passed by.

name: Balcony with Acheloos river view
description: A “balcony” parking over Glystra hydroelectric plant. Magnificent view of Acheloos and surround mountains.

name: Kapnophyto lake
description: Nice place at the Lake near the village Kapnophyto. Water is clear, the whole place is clean. And absolutely calm. 2 tables here, one with roof. Also a grill and a chapel.

name: Profitis Elias
description: It’s a green space just 4.5 km from Vlasi village. It’s accessible via a dirt road. There’s water all year long and the trail for Karava peak starts here.

name: Great Bay
description:
Wonderful small bay with fine sand and crystal water.

A small shop (maybe only during season) and some deckchairs, at night a generator. 

Only some locals; during our stay no other camper. 

4x4 is a good idea, only dirtroad (gravels) to the bay,  but not a big deal. 

Some mosquitoes during sunsets and wasps at day.

name: Large flat area on the beach.
description:
Big open flat area right on the beach, next to a very nice beach bar restaurant. Room for lots of vehicles van or big truck accessibility 4x4 not required. 
Great beach for swimming and fishing, about 10 campers there when we stayed.

name: Former camp at the beach
description: Probably former campground. Just at the beach. Calm, clean. Only few locals that left in the eveninig

name: Olive Trees orchard
description: Probably only one possibility of real wild camping at the beach here. Only small cars possible.

name: Angitis Canyon
description: View point to the Angitis canyon, close to the Alistrati cave

name: Triadi lake
description:
Place at the Triadi lake, bit busy here, may be because it is saturday, but nobody bothers or isn’t even curious what we are doing here…
Caution! Lot of bees as there is lot of bee nests / houses on the dam. In the night I expect lot of mosquitos…
Close to the city

name: Stefaniada lake
description: A stunning spot by Stefaniada lake. Be advised that the last kilometer is dirt, but accessible road.

name: Chapel at 1360m
description: A place to camp next to a stone chapel and a tomb to commemorate the battle of Kaliakouda.

name: Kaliakouda pass
description: An amazing spot at Kaliakouda pass! Wonderful views of the roads down below and of the surrounding peaks.

name: Panta Vrehei (Πάντα Βρέχει)
description: A spot by Krikeliotis river where Panta Vrehei canyon starts

name: Maniaki lake entrance
description: Lot of mosquitos, quiet place, only few dogs and fishermen in the morning

name: fountain with tap next to a cemetery
description: fountain with tap next to a cemetery.  good flow: 20 l/min.  space to park nearby.

name: Beach
description: Excellent location for wild camping by the beach. The road to get there is of moderate difficulty for 4x4 raised vehicles only. Very beautiful place. No 4g

name: Vereniki cementary
description: Chapel and cemetery, running water and open toilets. Saved us in the evening. Silent night

name: Most beautiful water fountain
description:
On the top of a cliff there is a water fountain with a few trees, shade and two comfortable benches.
It's also a big flat area, possible to spend a night.

name: Xaliki entrance
description: We were directed here from the locals. It is a basketball and football court with a nice stone kiosk. There is a river running all year around. We had some cows pass by in the morning otherwise Great night!!!

name: Zaggas Marine
description:
Long term storage for vehicles and boats.
In the open or under shade or under tarpaulin.
The owner speaks good English.
Fair prices, good communication.

name: Aoos lake
description: A higher ground right off the national road with view of the lake. You can either camp right here or, depending on the season, drive down to the shore. (One of the photos shows the access road)

name: water source in the mountains
description: Great and powerful water source in the mountains. Locals come here to get their drinking water.

name: Most amazing beachside spot
description: Clean, quiet, 10 meters from the water.  The water is crystal clear and clean.  10/10

name: Agios Vasileios
description: On the beach of Agios Vasilios there are multiple permanent caravans. We camped here with their half way through September. All caravans were empty, except for some campervans on the other side of the beach. Very quite and sheltered spot, easy to reach!

name: Drinking Water
description: Drinking Water, indicated by sign on the tree. Tap can be used with Gardena adapter to attach a hose.

name: Polylimnio Waterfalls start/end
description: rocky parking spot for 5/6 campers. next to the end of the walk if you walk up the waterfall, upstream.

name: Stomio Beach
description: Great location if not windy for wild camping by the beach under the trees. Beautiful beach.

name: Beach with olive trees
description: Nice place in a quiet bay on the beach in between olive trees. The way to get there is only for small 4x4 cars possible because the track is narrow, and you drive between olive trees. Unfortunately, a lot of rubbish has washed up, but the view is fantastic!

name: Wild blue beach
description: nice place to camp in a small bay with little shade but grass. Accessible only by 4x4 vehicle.

name: Roadside Restaurant
description: In an abandoned train station. Locals come here for a coffee. Take a beer and watch the sunset from there. Easily to miss if you just see it from the road.

name: San Leon
description: Exceptional good restaurant and very lovely people. They just use fresh goods from the island and manufacture a lot by themselves.

name: Paradise
description: What a spot right at cliffs, what a view. The way down is a the last two kilometers gravel and at some spots quite steep. Road is very wide and in good condition. I would recommend 4x4 but you could maybe do it also without.

name: Port Koufo
description: Water tap at the port that is open to the public

name: Hotel Apartments Katerina
description: Excellent value for money.  Ideal self catering relatively close to both Igoumenitsa and Patras ferry ports along a scenic coast.

name: Brunnen an der Friedhofsmauer
description: Fountain on the cemetery wall in Lessini.  Small parking lot in front.

name: Elefteres
description: Great place with hotsprings and abandoned houses. Very much worth a visit. Many Greek people enjoying the hot springs, but absolutely not crowded, you will easily find your spot.

name: Easywash
description:
Easy place to do your laundry yourselves. You need coin. Detergent Can be bought from automat. 
Difficult to find a parking spot.

name: Fakistra Beach
description: Just on top of this beautiful Beach. There is a small plateau, only for one, or max 2 campers. You will need some stones under the wheels. The road that leads to this place is more than wonderful.

name: fresh water
description: fresh water next to the rosd clean and cole nice

name: Fakistra tap
description: Water tap. We filtered it for drinking. No hose and no one to ask if it was ok.

name: official free campside at the lake
description: official free campside at the lake with beautiful surrounding

name: nice place near small town
description: On a field near town. There is also a nice parking near monastery 100 Meter down the road

name: beach parking
description: lot of space for cars and trucks near the ocean

name: Korinos
description: Small Chapel in front of the sea with parking area. Also possible to put up your tent. There's a shower at the beach and water in the chapel.

name: Remiza Parking
description:
Parking and sleeping for busses, but also for campers. 24 hours guarded. 
Safe place if you want to leave your car and go to see the city. 
20€ pr 24 hours. 5 € Extra if you need electricity. 
Price includes hot water for shower(you need to ask to open the heater 15 min before) & WC!**In case of credit card, prices +24%VAT

name: Camp spot near stadium
description: Near an almost abandoned stadium. At the highest part, near and old mine or something, there's this silent and secret spot. Good for hikers, cyclists, 4x4 and high campervans. to arrive there's you need a high suspension because the road it's a bit bumpy.

name: Camping along the river
description: Strongly advise against camping anywhere along here. Held at gunpoint by the army.

name: DOPEA
description: Drinking water in front of museum. Behind the museum is a toilet.

name: LADA
description:
We stopped for lunch but ended up staying overnight.  
It is a very small and quiet village.  The place where we spent the night is the "square" in front of a closed museum.  There is a toilet and running drinking water here.  
The city seems to have public wifi for free use and it works really well.  
We asked 2 residents if it was ok for us to sleep here?  They couldn't see anything wrong with that, - but of course we don't know what will happen if someone comes every day.?  The place is beautiful and clean and quiet.  
No restaurants but free mountain air.

name: Mountain view
description: End of a dead road with wonderful view of the mountains

name: Coral
description:
The hotel is run by a nice, very friendly, young couple. Very nice garden, terrasse, yard, sunset restaurant, and a shisha lounge directly at the sea. They have homemade delicious bread and various dishes and a small, child-friendly beach. 

accommodation: 45€ for three persons per night in the late season. clean rooms without a kitchen.

free parking.

Open: from April to the end of October.

name: Camper Stop Greece
description: Long- or Short time parking, overnight and shuttle service. Check it out on their website on http://www.greececamperstop.com/. Coordinates are entrance gate. Email fast responding Tasos on info@greececamperstop.com in Greek, German or English. We parked our rig between quite a few other campervans for almost 6 months. Happy with this service so close to the airport.

name: mountain church
description: wonderful place next to a small mountain church.

name: mountain meadow
description: Beautiful place in the mountains with much space. You can do many hiking trails and many mountain bike trails.

name: Lefkada Harbour
description: Lefkada South West part of Harbour. Hidden behind a wall. It seems someone gives water to the cats here.

name: Myloi
description:
Very beautiful and quiet.
Next to Nauplies.
Spent 1 night here. no problems.
Only à Shepherd went by.
Place for a fire but please don't do it in Greece in summer.
Place for 2 rigs. Easy.

name: camping mycenae
description: A nice campground,  very old but clean, nice old couple are the owners. All year open. Restaurants around.

name: Flamingo spot
description:
Here you have water on both sites. 
You Will have both sunrise and sunset. You will be close to Flamingos. 
You must be able to drive in sand/small stones. Unfortunately some litter.

name: Patisserie Spyridon
description: Famous organic patisserie, café and ice cream. very delicious. a dream!

name: Camperstop
description: New, small, beautifully landscaped campsite from an emigrated German couple. Toilets and showers are being built at the moment. 10 euros a night. Shops and restaurants within walking distance.

name: Seaside
description: Flat area next to the small town. Quiet and directly at the Sea. Water station directly next to the place. water runs from 17:00 to 20:00

name: tsolis camp
description: beautiful camping,  all year open, 3 nice snall dogs

name: Do.it.yourself
description: Shop where you Can buy What you need to fix the camper.

name: Menies Beach, Chania, Crete
description: Beautiful isolated beach with stunning views also for the off road track to get there. Easy though-out however difficult track for the last 100 meters. One of the best places I have ever need.

name: Camping with beautiful view
description:
Small camping area just off gravel track with a beautiful view straight off a 500ft cliff 
It’s a very peaceful place to camp, make sure you have good levelling chocks however! 
Only level place we could find was reversing over the fire pit and using two chocks under the front wheels (our chocks suck but on the bright side they were free)

name: the troyan horse
description: Best place in town for your drinks cocktails and chill out nice garden billiard super friendly and good prices for the drinks wifi and toilet top! Verry coasy and warmly recommended

name: Laundry
description: Not self service but the owner loves land rovers and is very friendly

name: alonaki beach
description: a great spot nthe beach.i washere in november,not knowing what happens here in summer

name: Park up by the sea
description:
There’s a couple other identical places near by that were already full when we arrived, I guess this is because the ferry lands nearby? 
Plenty of rubbish around 
Lovely beach that makes that worth while

name: old road near milina
description: old road along the sea.paved no traffic.nice to sleep.

name: Little Church near the sea
description:
Translation: Quiet area near a chapel and in the middle of olive trees. Possibility to fill up with water.

bivouac au calme près d'une chapelle et au milieu des oliviers. Possibilité de faire le plein d'eau. 

quiet bivouac near a chapel and in the middle of olive trees.  Possibility to fill up with water.

name: Camping in abandoned city not even on the map
description:
Camped up the top of the mountain in an abandoned city. 
We couldn’t find any info on the maps about it at all. No effort has gone into preservation so you need a good imagination whilst exploring. 
The track up isn’t suitable for anything other than a small overlander (we came through the tiny hamlet and it was very tight in our defender 110 ambulance) 
The rest of the track is a mix of concrete and rocky gravel, other than steep not too challenging. 
Ace place to sleep if you get there. 
No signal what so ever and some cows including a bull in the area when we stayed

name: Nice secluded spot
description: Perfect secluded spot, ideal for any size vehicle. Take the track up towards the solar farm and then after the concrete section take a right into a beautiful meadow. Probably not suited to 2wd but I don’t drive one so no idea. Good signal too.

name: Easywash
description: Self service laundry shop. 5 washing machines and 4 tumbledryers.

name: Bus stop to Athens
description: In case you ship your car with Salamis here’s the bus stop to get back to Athens center. 1h45mins riding time.

name: Peninsula hill top
description:
Lovely well trodden spot far enough away from the Corinthian canal and Athens to be clear of any dodgy types. 
Great view and place to explore

name: Camping on the beach
description: A couple of spots next to a clean gravel beach. Nice place to relax.

name: Lake side
description:
Nice spot on the lake side, water looks
Clean and nice for a swim in the summer

name: kalochori lagoon
description: several places near limnothalassa restaunt god internet,very goos grssk food.

name: Cemetery
description: Small walled cemetery with small parking area.  There is a water tap by the gate and inside the cemetery in the left far corner are toilets in a small grey building with running water.  4G signal and rubbish bins as well.  It's not far off the highway so there is traffic noise.  I wouldn't recommend more than 1 camper as the privilege could be taken away.  Leave no trace.

name: unknown
description: here you get all the parts for sanitair and water.

name: Water and shower
description: Water point on the shower, this is by the salt pans where people rub the salt on their face hence the no mud sign

name: Port of Eratini
description: To the left of the small fishing port, small grassy (may be muddy) area with sparse trees. Plenty of space to park directly on the sea edge (no beach to speak of) and walking distance to village (beach, bars, restaurants and mini markets etc). Locals not bothered by us and very friendly in the village. Perfect out of season spot. Maybe less tolerant in height of summer. Good Vodafone signal.

name: Large dirt lot
description: Large mostly flat lot.  Rubbish bins and 5G signal.  Lots of restaurants nearby, one block from the beach.  We had a quiet night.  Could be busier in season.

name: Large beach parking lot
description: Paved lot above the beach. We spent a quiet night here in December.  Some spots slightly sloping.  Not many cars overnight, lots of walkers during the day.  Toilets at the beach were open.  4G vodaphone signal. Water is available near the entrance.  Short walk into town for shops and restaurants. In summer the beach showers are probably open.

name: Easywash
description: Self service laundry.  4 regular size washers at 3eu each, 1 large washer at 6eu and 4 dryers at 4eu each.  Open 7am to midnight daily.  Parking is not easy as it's only street parking.  We had to park 3 blocks away.  Clean and has good WiFi.  Change and detergent machines on site.

name: Camper stop Korinth
description: Great little campground with services: power, water, hot showers, WiFi, mini market and restaurant. Price 15eu for 24 hours. Nice owner.  Gravel pitches.  Fresh bread daily for 1.50eu and a nightly hot evening meal for 8eu pp.  4G signal.  About 1 km away from ancient Korinth which is closed on Tuesdays.

name: Phrachti Beach
description:
Lovely for an overnight stay
Beautiful vistas and a calm evening

name: Vai Palm Forest
description: Beautiful please for an overnight stay at the parking when off season. Stunning views.

name: Small church with water
description:
Small but beautiful church with great mountains view and fresh water source !
really nice inside too, so sad that people use it as toilets...

name: Litochoro port
description: Nice small port with water and shower (cold) on the beach. We spent the night here (it's forbidden on the beach but we stayed before).  We bought some good fish and shrimps with the fishermen (only 2€ for 10 fish !). Lot of dogs but friendly. It was quiet in december.

name: easywash
description:
Easywash automatic laundry.
3€ to wash, 1€ for 10 minutes drying.
Open May - September : 7:00-24:00
October - April : 8:00-22:00.

With seats and free wifi. Coffeeshop, mini Market and beach nearby.

name: Outlet Athens, Smart Park
description:
It's a Shopping Center complex and there is a parking in the fields. Totally quiet at night, useable water via the toilets near the childs park/Jumbo Market. And free Wifi 24/7.
Security passing by but nothing.
Stayed afternoon to next days afternoon, all fine

name: Richtig Beach
description: Good place outside the season. It has water and is beautiful around the Richtis gorge to explore waterfall.

name: Agia Marina beach, Rodakino region
description: One of our favorite spots for overnight stay and a short break from work. Tents, camper vans, RVs, all welcome. Gravel road to get there, accessible also by normal cars.

name: Amazing nudist beach
description: Tents on the beach, space for a couple cars with rooftop tent. Almost impossible to get there with big motorhomes.

name: Public foutain
description:
Great public foutain, easy access even for big trucks. Near the main road, Turn when you see the Métro shop. 
Turn left juste After Mercedes shop and then right. Free

Fontaine publique avec un débit important. accès facile même pour gros véhicules. A gauche juste après le magasin Mercedes puis tout de suite à droite.

name: Beach
description: Small but quite lively beach with bar and outside toilets. Chillout place to spend a night.

name: Amazing cost
description: Amazing cost line, clean and easy to park next to the beach. You may find other caravans but lots of free places around.

name: Ekklisia Agia Marina
description:
Lovely spot behind an old church overlooking the sea.
Quiet night only disturbed in the morning by some wandering goats

name: FunkyRide
description: small bicycle workshop with owner Panos, who is so nice and will do a good job

name: Tsasis Gaz
description:
You can have ALL types of gas cylinders changed or filled. If he doesn't have a suitable bottle, he will bring it to be filled and the bottle can be collected after 24 hours. Super friendly owner and good English.

https://m.facebook.com/100077483623465/about/

name: Center Konitsa
description: huge parking for Cars and Busses 100m from the central square. overnight allowed, calm, even big rigs Park without problem

name: Public spring
description: Fast spring in a mountain village. Water tastes good. The road from Leonidio is good but pretty curvy.

name: Old Road in Nature
description: It is the old road underneath the new main road, which nature is about to conquer back. You have a nice view into the valley. It is quite apart from the main road. Access is from the village.

name: self wash laundry
description:
Helpful owner. 3.50 for 10kg wash.
1.50 for dry

name: Gefiri Agion
description: No cell phone singnal, private camping next to a river side. Peaceful with towering trees and cliffs

name: water tab
description: water tab at the side of the road. 3/4inch thread. Medium pressure. Close by big water tubes (probably the drinking water supply system for the near by vilage) are visible. it's on top of a "waterfall" which is coming right out of the side of the Mountain.

name: Lardos Beach
description:
Parking spot at Lardos Beach next to the road 
quiet at night

name: Overnight in pass
description: Big view point in pass to Mount Olympus. Very quiet during afternoon and e. Beautiful view of Adriatic coast. Nobody bothered us.

name: Epar. Od. Aspraggelon-Miotadon
description: It was late, spent the day cycling and found some flat ground on the right side of the road. pushed my bicycle up a hill and found flat ground.

name: Camping Varades
description: Small campsite, in average condition (some showers broken, moderately clean, somewhat old), next to rocky beach. Quite cheap, Cost €4/person + €3.5 per tent, electricity 0.6€ per person. Has sinks, but no cooking facilities, fridge you can use. Bike rental, kayak rental, small bar (high season only). Lots of permanent caravan installations.

name: Big open field
description: Big open field with lots of wild parking overlooking the sea. Exposed. Although there are rubbish bins, still a lot of trash laying around. All size campers. Good 4G.

name: Komi
description: Official parking spot in the centre of Komi 50 m from the beach - quiet at night

name: Moto 4all
description: Very recommendable motorbike workshop. Giorgios, the owner is very helpful, traveller-friendly and speaks excellent English

name: Laundryroom
description:
Self service laundry in the Center of Athens - 
machine cost between 5 & 6€ - drying is 2€ - open 8-23 everyday - free wi-fi

name: takis travel
description: Threes people have is a good deal on getting to Italy. 2 10 euro for the van and 2 people. Better than direct with the shipping line.

name: Wash & Go
description: Self Service Laundry. The owner is here, if you need any help. He works from 8.30 - 11.30 / after 18.00. Opening hour of the laundry is 8:00  - 22.000. Washing machine = 3 €, Dryer 0.5 € for 10 min. Easy handling! Next really nice Cafė with sandwiches, sweeties.

name: Water (and shelter)
description: Water and shelter. Fountain at the end of a small park with next door a shelter with bench.

name: Water and shelter next to the road
