description: Water and shelter. Visible from the road but flat ground and beautiful view. no traffic at night

name: water point
description:
water point. 
Nice especially when you go uphill by bike

name: above the big road
description:
A little above the road there are very many picnic tables. We only stopped to eat but there are places with flat ground. 
Water fountain 500m on the main road to the climb

name: fountain
description: water point.  nice especially when you go uphill by bike

name: large grass area along the river
description:
Just below the church there is a large space with grass, hidden from the road.
To get there, in the bend of the main road, there is a path follow it for 100m.

name: road 9 : dangerous road by bike
description:
National road 9 between Pyrgos and Gastouni is very dangerous on a bike.  There are plastic studs installed in the middle of the road and no hard shoulder => So the cars overtake you very close... imagine a truck. 
Avoid it and go inland

name: Steno
description: Public water tap on the main road in Stena - good pressure - tap with thread

name: abandoned hotel
description: Empty buildings and old hotel. We were lucky and found one almost clean room upstairs. It's not really romantic, but good shelter from wind and rain. Puppies included.

name: if you arrive late from the boat
description:
big space. 
lots of stones but possibility of finding a place to put the tent + river nearby. It's not necessarily the best but if you arrive late from the ferry it helps

name: beautiful camp spot at the lake
description: This place is really nice, we passed it with the bicycles and saw a campervan already. It has bins and an abandoned house, lots of space. And you can go for a swim. Perfect camping spot

name: On top of a Hill with great view
description: Nice place on top of a hill with great views. Way up from the road very rough. Abandoned hut which was a viewing point years ago.

name: Nice view from a hill
description: Small hill with views towards the ocean. Not far from the road, so a good stop for the night on the way. The track to get there is little rocky so not for motorhomes but with a Sprinter it should work without 4x4.

name: Marmaras beach
description: nice car Park at the beach. In summer also public toilets ans water

name: Off road Peloponesos
description: A secluded spot in between two mountains with marvelous views towards the sea. It ‘s really off the beaten track!

name: Kakaris Motorcycles
description: Super friendly and helpful Honda motorbike mechanic. They worked until late in the night on a Saturday to fix our bike even though it was Easter holiday. They picked us and the bike up, fixed the camshaft problem, and had it running again the same day. The daughter speaks English and helped translate.

name: Olympia
description: Public parking for cars and camper - we stayed a night and no one bothered us - quiet at night - restaurants and shops around - 500 m walking distance to the entrance of Olympia archeological site - public WC on way to entrance

name: Sykaminea
description: Water source next to the road from Kallithea to Leptokarya on right hand side - high pressure

name: Karya
description: Parking spot for a night next to football/basketball field of Karya and opposite of Olympia Monument- 500m walking distance to the centre - 3 taverns at your choice - very quiet

name: Leptokaryas
description: Water source next to the road with picknick area - good water pressure

name: 1000 Trees near Lake Doirani
description: Water source with thread & good pressure on a picknick area next to Lake Doirani - reachable only for vehicles lower than 3m cos there’s a wooden gate with roof - 5-10m hose needed if you don’t have portable tanks

name: Above Arna
description: Big flat plain next to road. Marvelous views across mountains and towards sea. It’s very open at an altitude of 900 meters, so check the wheather forecast first! No shade.

name: Santorini KABIA Bench
description: Santorini Kabia bench. There are tourists during the day, But it is quiet at night. There only sound of the waves.

name: Riverside
description: This a nice and quiet place near a river. No one disturbed us, also good for hiking.

name: Roadside
description: Drinking water next to the road with good pressure

name: Free Parking
description:
It’s the free municipal parking, it’s a grassy area with a lot of olive trees. Lot of space, in low season it’s tolerated to camp there with a van or bigger rws.
Not the case to put out chairs, and placing the sundeck ;) 
Keep it clean and enjoy.

City, markets, bars for toilette ;) 2 min of walk.

name: Dias Hotel Appartement
description: nice and cheap hotel, parking for all kind of vehicles. Very warm welcome from Yanis and his parents. 26€ on booking. good breakfast included.

name: quiet flat meadow
description: Pretty nice and quiet meadow. you need enough clearance to get here, but nothing too serious. Lonely and pretty private.

name: Holy Rock
description:
among cheapest hostel for a tourist attractions place. nice clean place to bunk before heading to Albina or come from.

good space to park motorcycle next to motorcycle enduro shop. can do service change tire repair maybe.

name: Camping near the Castle
description: Large grass area near the chapel and drinking water source. You have ti drive along an unpaved road, but 4x4 not really needed I think.

name: Neapoli
description: Nice place, for car also without 4 wheel, tent posible, no water, direct on Sea bring your own Staff, quiet, some motorbike

name: Galataki beach
description: At the end of the road, just below the monastery. Follow the signs to the monastery. Almost there, the sealed road goes up into the mountains towards the monastery. Take the dirt road that continues along the sea. At the end is the beach. Quiet pebble beach. Good 4G signal. From the beach there’s a footpath to the monastery. Do visit, it’s special!

name: Dragonera Cliffs Camping
description:
New private camping ground. Mainly hard compact gravel for vehicles, but with a hammer I got the pegs of my tent in.
Basic shower, toilet and cooking area.
Maria speaks english (and french??).
Paid €5 for 1 pers, tent and motocycle. 

10mins walking is a good and cheap Taberna.

Area seems to offer climbing.

name: Track near Gyalia beach
description:
Great spot close to the beautifully small but charming Gyalia beach. A little more away from the road compared to the other spot.
I wouldn’t recommend taking dogs here as the underground was full of thorny vegetation. (No problem when wearing closed shoes)

name: between beach and lagoon
description: very beautiful long sand- beach. Lot of space along the small road. Good 4G Internet . A small water supply 10 meters away.

name: Taverna Zorbas - Mini market
description: I asked to the owner of the restaurant if possible to camp behind his place, in the middle of olive groove and he said yes! Quite place, 200mt from the beach. There is a tap for water close to an abandoned trailer.

name: little hilltop
description: there is a track up this little hilltop. i think 4x4 is not really needed, but a car with higher clearance or at least shirt wheelbase will help. On the back there are little ponds that are a bit smelly, but on the top, you cannot smell them. the sunset is absolutely great and people from the road cannot see you up there. Perfecr spot for one night.

name: RioRaYes (ΡίοΡάΓεΣ)
description: Small, traditional Greek café place and restaurant by the train station in Rio (Patras) with quality coffee and food for cheap prices. Lovely and very detailed design and atmosphere in that place. You can sit inside or outside to watch the typical local life. Owner and staff very friendly with great hospitality. Definitely a nice stopover after crossing the Rio-Antirrio-Bridge.

name: Husqvarna / Utility shop
description: At this place we were able to swap (not refill) our empty Campingaz 907 bottle. It was not an official Campingaz one so we did ‘lose’ our genuine one but it works exactly the same so we went for it as we weren’t able to find official selling/exchange points here.

name: Dikella
description: Fresh water tab with gardena mouth in a small village park/village centre.  Good place to park next to it.

name: Lake view
description: beautiful place with lake view. Possible with all kind of cars ( just a little bit rough), you dont need  4x4.

name: campsite at the beach
description: A nice and quite place at the end of a road directly at the sea. Suitable for vans or tents.

name: Havellas Moto
description: A professional workshop that services KTM, Suzuki, and most other brands of Motorcycle. They sell quality oils and parts for the above-mentioned brands. I got an oil change, and they were very professional... They used a torque wrench on the sump plug and filter housing bolts to the correct torque. Recommend.

name: Wild Nature Ecolodge Camp
description: This is an outdoor activities Camp (mainly for hiking , biking and ecotourism) which offers Campsites with own ablution (31 Eur for 2 ppn incl Power in low season) and Tentlodges with integrated ablutions.

name: off-street on the Aoou Lake
description: nice off-street campground, flat and quiet,

name: valley view
description: Beautiful place for all vehicle. Good for rooftent because you can find a place without wind. Nice view down to Metsovo.

name: Meadow by a Church
description:
A nice field on top of the hill by a church that doesn't get a lot of visitors.

Probably one of the few places not on 'park4night' in Greece, which means that you won't have 7 other campervans here.

There is a gravel road leading here that can get a bit rocky, but it's wide and shouldn't present a problem for any kind of vehicle.

There is plenty of space and the view spans across the sea.

There is a road that leads to the seashore, but we arrived quite late and the road looked corrugated, so we opted not to continue.

Nice and quiet place.

name: A&A Camper Parking
description:
Very nice Camper stop with space for 36 camper. Shuttle to city available. Very friendly and helpful owner. German and English spoken.
.....
Heiße Dusche
Waschmaschine/Trockner
Wasser

name: fantastic view
description:
Small place on top of the mountain. 
1 km easy to drive dirt road with 2WD. Might be a bit slippery after rain. Not to be driven on with a mobile home. Very good with 4X4 and roof tent.

name: Kastraki
description: Good place for overlanders.  So good sites for tents - if you travel with bikes.  Camping is at the sea.  Sanitary is renewed and well maintained.   Car with rooftent and 2 persons is about 23 euro per night without electricity.   Internet working well.

name: Quiet place by the lake. Pelicans, storks, herons, egrets...
description: Quiet (except for the frogs...) at the lake shore, behind trees. One fisherman boat. Full of birds at this season (pelicans, storks, herons, egrets...). Nice spot for kayaking (if you carry one with you). 4G ok

name: Kefalochori
description:
Remote village town with a grass field and trees in the middle. Two restaurants with wifi, toilet and enough street lighting for the night. All the locals are welcoming and the restaurant owners allow free tent or hammock camping there.

Pictures that i posted here are from inside the restuarant looking out to the “campsite”

name: Assa Maris
description: parking for cars. easy to go. transparent sea.

name: Paralia Psakoudia
description: place close to the beach, far from touristic place. Some trees. lot of mosquitos.

name: birds lake
description: Very nice place near the lake. We dont drive the last 50 meter to the lake because we dont want to disturb the birds. This place is suitable for 4x4 or minibus.

name: Beach
description: This is a quiet spot to spend the night, nice little beach. Very private. Close to the highway.

name: Angelochori
description: Parking front of the sea. Windsurf, kitesurf and wing area. Easy access. Calm.

name: Arnissa
description: Nice place, near the lake. Lots of birds. beautiful view.

name: Recreational area
description: Big area with lots of places with river running through. Garbage cans and water available. Could be crowded in summer!

name: Mandraki
description: At the waterside, start of boat trips for birdwatching. Water available, shops and restaurants in village.

name: Below the Dam
description: Off the road with covered shelter, hidden creek a short walk, beautiful geologic viewa

name: Chios Technomoto, Gemelos
description:
Motocycle and Bycicle repair shop
Honda, Triumph and BMW dealer/repair
Ilias is very professional and speaks fluent English. He seems to have a lot of knowledge. 
Fixed my broken stator and little repairs.

name: Grilos
description:
Great place to stop under the shadow of an big old tree when you are visiting the stonevillage Koukouli, or hike the epirus trail. Dimitris warm welcome and food is great and everthing fresh made with local incrediants.
Dont miss this place when you are at vikos gorges or the bridges of kipi.

name: woods by the beach
description: Slept here whilst bike packing, woods by the beach. Lots of space to put up a tent or park. There is a portaloo and cold shower at the entrance to the beach and we used the public tap in the boat yard for water. Very quiet, the beach is not the best but good for a swim. There were benches for cooking at.

name: Meadow with view
description: Nice flat meadow after ~700m of gravel road. We spent one night here in our VW Crafter (6m). Access is via a gravel road, no 4x4 needed. We just had enough clearance (2-3 cm left) with our non-lifted Crafter to enter the meadow.

name: Potable water
description: We asked the restaurant next door, which said it's potable water. Attached our hose, has good pressure.

name: Tsepelovo
description:
Public place provided by the village for camping. Nicely located under many trees. To enter, one has to open a metal "door" that was installed to keep the cows away.
We wouldn't have dared to camp there, but the people of the village told us, the place was made for camping. There is also a water tap. Gorgeous place!
Unfortunately, the entry is steep and narrow, so larger vehicles may not be able to enter (VW Crafter, 6m, was just ok).

name: Riverside cafe
description:
Bike packers. 
Cafe by the river with an outdoor tap, bins, wifi and toilets open 24hours. We camped up the road from the cafe about 100m in an orchard. Quiet and undisturbed, not too many bugs! Polite to buy something if you're using the facilities (we got ice cream)

name: Camping Bungalow Elizabeth Variko
description: Quiet camp 300 metres from the sand beach. Portable water, wash machine, warm shower, old but functional toilet and shower. 3 minutes walk is market in next one camp

name: Close to the stone brigde
description: Down from the main road, there is a stone bridge and there are signs. Small meadow, accessible for 4x4. Invisible from main road.

name: Fast4ward
description:
Manthos in his grarage help me to fix some problem on my 4x4 camper truck. He is very professional, passionate in 4x4 and really friendly. We took 1 day together (Saturday) for making all the reparation and he give me lot of advice on my truck.  If you have any problem on your 4x4 it is the right place to go!  He don’t sell spare part but know how to get it fast!
Now my truck is ready to take the road again!

name: volvo trucks
description: A good team of mechanical professionnal, the boss is really friendly, they speak a bit english and they make good price and good work ! for heavy vehicule :)

name: Great spot next to the river
description:
Great and absolut quite place a few meters from the river.
Great for swimming.
Flat area, a little bit sandy and the sand and gravel road needs 4x4.

name: Overlooking the monasteries
description: Stunning location at the end of a track, overlooking the monasteries. Not a clear view to be honest as a few trees in the way, but the surrounding view is stunning. The final spot, where the track ends, is lovely for a stop and a meal, but a bit windy so we retreated back about 100m and stayed there the night. Lots of places along the track to stop. Passed one shepherd who gave us the thumbs up.

description: Large area next to a beach. Approximately 10 camper van when we were there + 3 tents. Possible to stay on a kind of grassy/dusty area (not very clean but it was still ok to put a tent), or on the parking just in front of the beach, or on the beach. Abandonned beach bar on the beach. Functional shower, some people drank the water from the shower for two days and were OK. Dogs at night (barking but not agressive).

name: Picnic place in the woods
description: A picnic place in the woods, turn into dirt road and a little downwards, you will find a large picnic table and a natural water source. There are lots of trees which give you the desired amount of shadow in summer.

name: Camping Palouki
description:
Located next to a long and sandy beach, blossoming with berries, nut and eucalyptus trees, Camping Palouki offers place to more than 30 thirty tents and 32 thirty-two caravans and motor-homes.

Each pitch is supplied with electricity and water. The places are naturally separated with bushes, flowers and trees, offering privacy and rich shade. The facilities are modern and comfortable with free hot water around the clock. shower and toilet infrastructure are separate for men and women. Two supplementary showers and WCs are provided for people with physical disabilities. Furthermore, washing machines, an ironing counter,  a chemical toilet and waste-water deposit are included in the provided facilities. Most of the campsite’s places are covered by our free WiFi access.

 In our mini-market shop, a large variety of goods can be found including fruits, vegetables, local jams, extra virgin olive oil, wine selections, milk, juices, fresh bread, honey, soaps, shampoos and detergents in the morning, while our restaurant serves original Greek specialities on the edge of the site with a direct view on the sea.

In order to enhance our visitor’s experience and well-being here, a variety of sport and wellness activities is offered, such as yoga, pilates and massage sessions, beach-volley, surfing and table tennis. Dogs are welcome in our campsite, under the supervision of their owners.

Palouki, with its small fishing-port, is eighty (80) km south-west of Patras and only thirty (30) km away from ancient Olympia and various other places of natural beauty and cultural-historical interest such as ancient Elis, the Apollon temple of Bassae, the Chlemoutsi Castle, the Kaiafa Lake,the river Neda and Diakofto.

As a traditionally family-run campsite we feel personally responsible for our guests and their accommodation. We speak English, German, French and Italian and are looking forward to welcome you here.

name: Petra waterfalls
description: End of the dirt track (ends with the closed gate) where the 5 minutes trail to the waterfalls starts. Bit downhill but nothing extreme. At the gate is the garbage bin and 50m behind the gate are toilets. No dogs. In the morning only local handymen crew came to check us but without any problems.

name: Diakos place
description:
Nice piece of flat ground on the E4 hiking trail. If you want to hike to the Korakas mountain, this place is perfect. The road will let you drive up to the 2000m to the refuge and then it is only 2 hrs of hike. 
Keep the place clean, only 3 cars of the shepards went down and up, probably didn’t noticed us

name: Windmills
description:
Place at Windmills. Offseason Camping is possible. Great view over the hills.
No service, except 4G

name: Agios Ioannasis chapel and beach
description:
Small beach, with small chapel. Nice, clean, silent place. Gate that wasn’t closed for ages. Only few locals and visitors of nearby villas, but after the sunset everybody gone. 
Garbage can here and water source at the chapel.

name: Open field
description:
Big open field with many flat spots for camping, with or without shade. Also some fireplaces if you’re into that. It is just beside the river, but the vegetation is very dense and the shore is steep so there is no easy access to the water. There are many concrete building foundations, but the actual buildings are gone.

I saw a couple of overlanders, a local collecting firewood (dead branches etc), and a few hikers. So only few people.

Should be accessible with almost any car except sports cars. Bigger vehicles might get scraped by the vegetation at the access road though.

There is 4G coverage. It varies a bit on the big field, so check before deciding on your spot.

name: St. Athanasios Park
description: Absolutely great and very quiet spot next to a chappel. Place is maintained by local volunteers. Has showers, toilets, running water (filling up water tanks is possible), benches and tables and a grill area. Everything well maintained and clean. The box for voluntary donations is next to the fireplace. Shop, restaurants, petrol are in the village about 800m away.

name: Glaliskari beach
description: Hidden beach, road is bit rough but with higher clearance ok. Space for 2-3 rigs, probably will be busy during day. Not that much rubbish

name: Hilltop by the church
description:
Spot on a Hilltop besides a church. For being hidden at the very end of the path there's space for a tent and motorcycle, maybe not completely flat but ok. Maybe also possible for one 4x4. Otherwise in the churchyard above is enough flat space for multiple tents, but stairs leading up, so vehicle has to stay below.

I only met two kids there at sunrise otherwise no disturbance. It's a bit noisy because of the dogs and cars from the city streets below. But still okay, with ear plugs definitely.

The path up is gravel, but should also be doable with 2WD. Not for big trucks.

5G available.

name: Next to antenna
description: Nice and quiet night here. Flat ground for one or two cars.Rubbish free and not really visible from the road. We were here with land cruiser but 4x4 not necessary. Not for campervans i think, because of slight uphill leaving point.

name: camping kalami
description: nice little campsite with direct access to the sea.  €18 a night in a tent for one person with motorbike.  clean bathrooms and hot shower.  restaurant, market and bar inside the structure.  clean sea.  15 minutes away from the port of igoumenitsa.

name: Water Tap
description: Fresh water from the tap. Hose and Gardena connector included.

name: Never Built Residential Area
description:
This is a weird place. Apparently, they decided to build a residential area here about 20-30 years ago. So they built paved roads with side walks, street lights, sewers, a basketball court etc, but they never built any houses! Or actually, there are 3 houses, and one abandoned construction of a house, but that's nothing on 1 km^2. 

The view is great. There are more people roaming around here than one might think. People enjoy the view, drive dirt bikes, have picnics use it as a "makeout point", and what not. But nobody bothered me.

The road going here from Thessaloniki is paved and in good condition, but some rocks have fallen down on it at places. Drive carefully. The roads around the area are also in good condition, but some manhole covers are missing.

I didn't notice any mosquitos.

There is cell phone signal.

name: Fanaria Rest

A very nice Campground with a very delicious Tavern. It is close to Ancient Korinth and the highway. 
You have water, electricity, grey and blackwater disposable, clean showers and toilets on site and you can wash your laundry and it's all inclusive. 
The owners are amazingly friendly and helpful.

name: Truck Parking
description: Very clean truck parking lot with several drinking water taps, toilet and shower.  Euro 12 per truck and night.  24 hour security, fenced and well lit.  This is not a camping or RV park, only for truck-based campers.  Directions in all directions: Turn right at the entrance gate and right again at the next street.  Now go straight ahead to the roundabout and choose direction there.

name: Kerkini Pier
description: Having been told the wild camping sites around the lake could not be used overnight, the ranger told me this location was legal and safe. It is where the tourist boats go out from onto the lake and very quiet in mid October with just one other local bird twitcher here. It’s a really good place for a night or more. Park on the grass facing south to leave the car park free. No facilities except for free unlimited drinking water. Also, if it’s really wet you can get undercover overnight

name: Seaside
description: Nice camp spot not too far from the main road. Easily accessible for any vehicle, with grass areas for setting up tents (a little rocky).

name: Athens Auto Parking
description: Very safe and secure parking especially for motorbikes. They offer security and 24 hour access to park or leave. Price per 24h of service used is at 5€ but discounts are provided if a space is booked for a week or more. I booked a week of space for one motorbike for 25€ total.

name: Prapa Mali beach
description: Nice shady place under the pines. Place for 4-5 cars. During the daytime few people at the beach. Beach is 5 minutes of walk down from the spot but nothing easy. Caution 4x4 really needed. The road to the spot is really rough. Keep it clean

name: Karagiannis Nikolaos
description:
Car workshop.
Very nice guy. Helped us with our T2 and electric/injection problems.
Speaks English and German.

name: 100 meters up
description:
Beautiful view from this spot on the side of a mountain. A small dirt road ends here (at least for cars, a bike might be able to continue?). It is possible to turn around a normal car here, but I wouldn't go with a big van.

It is very private. No building in sight (except many, many kilometers away along the coast), and I don't think you can see the car from the gravel road further inland (and even that is rarely used, only met a single car in the 30 minutes or so I drove on it). Some boats pass by in the ocean, but you are 100 meters up and about the same distance inland...

A normal 2WD vehicle should be enough as the road going here is not steep, but higher than normal ground clearance will make it easier.

There is 1 bar of phone reception. It works, but it is sometimes a bit slow.

name: Camping Sylvia

really nice place 
13.50€ 1 moto , 1 person and 1 tent 
and amazing beach for swimming

name: Afrathias Beach
description: Nice Spot along the beach. Stay beside the dirt road as the sand at the beach ist very soft. Beach shower, waste disposal and a local Restaurant. Some Rocks in the water but no Problem in good weather conditions.

name: Empty beach
description: A long, empty, clean stretch of beach. The beach itself was somewhat wet when we got there, but there's lots of flat spaces in or behind the dunes that are dry and very nice. This marker is just for direction. Just a few locals in the morning, otherwise no people (at least this time of year). No street dogs. Please make sure the beach stays this clean and take your trash.

name: Tsoutsouros
description: nice beach at West end of the small town. stay along the dead end Road. some trees for shade. Off season very quite town and beach but Restaurant Zorbas Close by ist Open all year.

name: Camping Paleochora
description: Big Camping Site along the beach with a lot of space for tents and 6 to 8 motorhomes. a little bit rundown but cheap off season. 15,50 Euro per night in one campervan, two Persons and Electricity. 1,2 km to town. forgott to make Pictures. OK for at least one night.

Nice place next to a dry riverbank. Looks like there can be some water sometimes. I stayed for one night and it was quite and peaceful.
I took the paved road, passing a farm or factory to get there.

you're probably not suppose to camp here, place but it was out of season, the gate was open, no one was there to say i can't :) and the view is great. Just get up and out before the site opens. *not for cars*, place for one tent, maybe two, no water available.

name: At The River
